loans.name: Kabuku Success Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand and holding a cheque in the photo is Salome. She is 46 years old and joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to benefit from training on enterprise development. 

Her economic activity is vegetable farming and she also sells clothes to supplement her income. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more clothes to add  to her clothing sales business stock to enable her to earn more income. She intends to use the increased profits to boost her vegetable farming.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale and hence to increase her income and use the profits to boost her vegetable farming.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 40 years old, married, and blessed with two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training on enterprise development.

She farms maize, beans, potatoes and vegetables. She also sells cereals in the nearby market. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy certified seeds for vegetable farming and hence increase her vegetable production. This will enable her to meet customers' demands and earn more income to enable her to pay for her family house renovation expenses.

Florence is so happy and grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy certified vegetables seeds and hence increase her vegetable production for increased income to pay for her family's house renovation.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 55 years old, married and blessed with 3 children; one child is still in secondary school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to benefit from the training on enterprise development.
 
She is involved in poultry, dairy and goat farming. She is taking a Kiva loan to buy more poultry and poultry feeds so as to increase eggs and chicken stocks. With increased income she will be able to pay for her child's tuition fees.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.  She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: buy poultry and feeds to increase poultry production i.e. eggs and chicken for more income to pay her child's tuition fees.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is grateful to Kiva for the previous loan that enabled her buy a water tank for harvesting water, both for domestic and farming use. She was able to maintain a clean environment for her dairy and thereby maintained her livestock's good health and realized a consistent milk supply.

Lucy is borrowing another Kiva loan to buy dairy feed to increase milk production. This will help her earn more income to cover her family's expenses.

loans.use: To buy dairy feed to increase milk production

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña María se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir, ella necesita un préstamo de $1.300 para la compra de una nueva máquina de coser que le permitirá mejorar la calidad y la variedad de las prendas que ofrece a sus clientes.
texts.en: Doña María makes clothing. She needs a loan of $1,300 for the purchase of a new sewing machine, which will allow her to improve the quality and variety of the clothing that she offers to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
Agripina previously accessed a PHP 37,000 loan that she used to purchase more computer units needed in her business. It was indeed a milestone for her, especially since she was able to provide a better income for her family. 

She would like to apply for another loan in the amount of PHP 28,000 for the maintenance of her computer shop. She would use this and, at the same time, add more PC units to her current inventory. She hopes that your hearts will be touched and your support will be with her in her aim to be better. 

Agripina hopes that her business will just continue to expand. She is also praying that her family will always be at peace and harmony. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her computer shop and to add more PC units to her current inventory.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 33 years old and has four children. She is married and has four children who are in school.

Dominga is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Dominga has been in pig-fattening for five years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Dominga would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a responsible, hard-working, and enterprising man from the Siongiroi area of Kenya. He is 30 years old and married. 

He makes a living selling farm produce, such as milk, meat, grains, and vegetables produced at his farm. He gets help with his work, especially grazing, from members of his family.  

Thomas has been trying to get money to buy seeds, to no avail. He is seeking a loan to purchase seeds for planting. This loan will enable him to cover more land with crops and produce more food that will give his family decent diets and better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Srin's Group

texts.en:
Srin is a mother 55 years old of a dependent child, living in Kampong Cham province’s Ou Reang Ov district. Nowadays, she does rice farming to support her family’s living for thirty-seven years. Her rice not growing well was the main challenge for her business. 

For Srin, this is third loan cycle for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and the previous loans have helped her to improve her living standard. Due to lack of funds, she is now leading a group of two members will request for new loan of 500,000KHR and another member is seeking of 500,000KHR as well.

Through this loan, she is going to use her entire loan portion to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland to increase the productivity of her crops. She hopes her current business will earn more income to upgrade her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland to increase the productivity of her crops

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Tunas Group

texts.en:
Imelda was appointed as the leader of Tunas Group, which consist of 7 women. She is a 23 year old mother of a 1 year old baby boy. In this picture, Imelda was flanked by two women who is wearing square patterned red blouse and striped orange blouse. Imelda and her friends are housewives who are helping their husbands to manage the household as well as to seek additional income for daily needs fulfillment. 

Last year, Imelda started operating a kiosk that provides daily needs for her neighborhood. As she wanted to enlarge the business, she also needs capital to realize her wishes. Therefore she asked the participation from some women friends from her village, who are also seeking for additional capital. They formed a group and have requested a loan of IDR 21, 000, 000, - in total. 

Imelda has spent the cash to purchase various goods i.e. rice, cooking oil, kerosene, noodles, drinks and etc and for her members, they have spent their loan on business improvement.

loans.use: to purchase various goods i.e. rice; cooking oil; kerosene; noodles; drinks, etc

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a CCT partner since 2005. After 10 years of being a member, she decided to apply for loan this year amounting of P40, 000 to help her grow her direct selling business mainly focused on home appliances. She has been managing the business for 5 years now and still contemplating for ways to come up for better marketing strategy. Lilia believes that CCT nurtures aspiring entrepreneurs by lending certain amounts for business profit and provides seminars for business aspirants. 

Like other entrepreneurs, Lilia aims to be successful on her chosen path have her own car and personal properties. Most importantly, being able to sustain her family’s needs. That pushes her to strive more and excel.

Being a long time member of CCT, Lilia has been consistently attending CCT fellowship group that consist of 15 to 30 members where she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners, this made Lilia to become strong spiritually and dependent to God on every occasion.

loans.use: to be used as capital for her appliance direct selling business

loans.name: Maa Baman Dei Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Bimala is a 25-year-old young lady from Kandulguda village of Koraput district. She is the featured borrower of Maa Baman Die SHG-A Group. Bimala lives with her husband and two daughters. Her husband works in a local jewelry shop and is unable to provide sufficient income to the family. Therefore, Bimala faces difficulties to meet the needs of her family. The lady standing to the right in the photo is Bimala.

She even does not have a bathroom and goes outside to the field for defecation. She, along with her group member, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Bimala will use her portion of the loan amount to build a septic tank and install a latrine pan so that she no longer has to go outside for defecation and will maintain hygiene.

Bimala aspires to start her own grocery business in a short span of time and make herself financially independent, and repay her loan in due course of time.

loans.use: to build a septic tank and install a latrine pan.

loans.name: Rakma

texts.en:
Rakma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of clothes to sell for her clothing sales business.Rakma has been in this business for 30 years. 

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand her poultry business and buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To restock her foodshop.

loans.name: Iibangaryiza Group

texts.fr:
Iribaryiza est un groupe de Gitega. Sur la photo, un des membres, Melchiade, a été représenté par sa femme Eliane. Dorothée  est la représentante du groupe  . Elle a 38 ans et est mariée à Pascal  un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont  4  enfants  âgés de  8 à 16 ans, tous  étudient.

Elle fait le commerce   de bananes depuis  7 ans. 

Elle est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bananes   à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
The Iribaryiza group is a subgroup of Gitega. In the picture, one of the members, Melchiade, is represented by his wife, Eliane.

Dorothée is the group representative. She is 38 years old and married to Pascal, a retailer. The couple have 4 children, aged between 8 and 16, all of whom attend school.

Dorothée has been selling bananas for 7 years. This is her third loan from Turame. Her Kiva-sponsored loan will increase her capital and allow her to buy a large quantity of bananas for resale, so that she can earn more money. In the coming years, she would like to see her children get an education.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of bananas for resale.

loans.name: Mutirithia Women Group

texts.en:
Pauline, standing at the middle in the photo is a 24 years old lady who joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in year 2013 to benefit from the training on enterprise development.
She is involved in selling scarves, shawls, and caps. She is taking a Kiva loan to buy more scarves for selling during the cold season. She will be able to meet the rising customers demands and hence increase her income.  She intends to use the profits to buy more stocks of caps and shawls in an effort to expand her business.

Pauline is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for financial support.  She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more scarves for resale during the cold season hence meet customers demands and earn more income.

loans.name: Munyaka Progressive Self Help Group

texts.en:
The man raising his hand in the photo is Harun; a member of Munyaka Progressive self help group which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in year 2013 to benefit from the enterprise development training. Harun is 31 years old, married and blessed with one child. 

He practices mixed farming; grows potatoes, cabbages and keeps cattle. He is borrowing Kiva loan to buy a calf to boost his cattle keeping. This will in future enable him expand his dairy farming thus generate more income from milk selling. 

Harun is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. He promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy a calf to boost cattle keeping business, so as in future to improve income from increased milk production.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more cow skins and beef for her business.

loans.name: Adonay Group

texts.es:
Miriam es una mujer de 25 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijas de 2 y 6 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, activa, constante, optimista, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en el estadio de la ciudad, con una capacidad real para 30mil espectadores sentados, donde se realizan espectáculos deportivos, musicales y escolares. De clima templado durante todo el año con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-27 grados centígrados.
Miriam es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado estilo cola de caballo, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (sentada la segunda de la derecha, viste chompa verde). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como chofer asalariado, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de adobe, ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba eléctrica, no cuenta con alcantarillado. Su necesidad de superación la llevó a formar una banca de personas para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Las personas de la banca desarrollan actividades como; tejido de chompas de lana, venta de medicinas naturales, artesanía en yeso, venta de comida, venta de ropa de segunda mano, reparación de equipos celulares y venta de productos lácteos. Su negocio es la venta de sándwiches como el ‘tranca pecho’ esta comida es muy popular y está preparado con arroz, papas fritas, ensalada y sillpancho (carne aplastada para ser estirada), todo envuelto en un pan, actividad que realiza todos los días de la semana en su puesto de venta fijo en las afueras del campo deportivo, sus clientes mayormente son los espectadores y público de eventos deportivos como futbol y otros, "Todo lo que está en este plato, incluido el arroz, se lo incorpora al pan tortilla que también es típico de esa ciudad…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la comida que prepara es muy popular, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de insumos de cocina como, arroz, carne, pan, etc. Su sueño es abrir un comedor popular ella desea realizar la compra de insumos de cocina para preparar tranca pecho y deleitar a los amantes del deporte. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Miriam solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina para preparar tranca pecho y alimentar a los amantes del deporte.
texts.en:
Miriam is a 25 year old woman. She lives with her partner and has two daughters, ages 2 and 6. Her business is selling food. 
She is a good mother, entrepreneurial, active, persevering, optimistic and very hardworking.  Her business is in the stadium of the city, that has a capacity of 30,000 seated spectators and hosts sports and musical spectaculars. There are mlid temperatures throughout the year, in the range of 18-27 degrees celsius.   
Miriam has a brown complexion, brown eyes, and long black hair, which she wears tied back in a ponytail. She is short and physically strong. Her mother tongue is Quechua, which is spoken in the home and she speaks Spanish outside the home and for business. In the photo she is seated second from the right and is wearing a green sweater.   
She shares her life with her partner who workers as a salaried driver. They live in a house owned by the family and made of adobe, bricks and cement with an iron roof and a dirt floor. The home has electricity and well water, which is drawn out by an electric pump, but it does not have a sewage system.  
Her need for self-improvement led her to form a bank of people to request a loan and improve her activities. The members of the bank develop activities such as: knitting wool sweaters, selling natural medicine, plaster artwork, selling food, selling second-hand clothing, repairing cellphones and selling dairy products.
Miriam's business is selling sandwiches, such as the "tranca pecho", which is a very popular food that is made with rice, french fries, salad, sillpancho (beef flattened to be pulled), all inside bread. This is the activity that she does everyday of the week in her foodstand, which is on the outside of the sports field. The majority of her customers are spectators of the sports events like soccer and others. 
Miriam comments that "Everything that is in this dish, including the rice, is incorporated in the tortilla bread that is also typical of this city."
The advantage of her business is that the food that she prepares is very popular, the disadvantage is that she does not have sufficient finances to buy the ingredients such as rice, beef, bread, etc. She wants to buy the ingredients to prepare "tranca pecho" and please the sports fans. This is the first sequence of loans in the 15 years that she has been working in this business. 
For these reasons Miriam is requesting a loan, to buy the cooking ingredients to prepare "tranca pecho" and feed the sports fans.
Her dream is to open a popular restaurant.

loans.use: to buy the cooking ingredients to prepare "tranca pecho" and feed the sports fans.

loans.name: Gregoria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gregoria, puede mantener la tienda de artículos de primera necesidad y la venta de tortillas con actividad gracias al buen uso que hace de los créditos que la institución y los inversionistas Kiva le confían, su familia se mantiene, las nuevas condiciones económicas le permiten tener puntualidad en el pago de sus cuotas y disminuir las necesidades básicas.
Tiene deseos de seguir mejorando su negocio por lo que requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar maíz, arroz, bebidas, boquitas, aceite, etc., podrá elaborar la venta de tortillas y surtirá la tienda, la esperanza de Gloria es seguir progresando y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Gregoria can maintain her store of staple goods and selling tortillas thanks to the good use that she has made of the loans that the institution and investors of Kiva entrusted to her. She provides for her family, and the new economic conditions allow her to be punctual in the payment of her dues and lessen basic needs. 

She desires to continue improving her business; to do so she requires a new loan to buy corn, rice, beverages, snacks, oil, etc. to be able to make and sell tortillas and supply the store. Gloria's hope is to continue progressing and get ahead with her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, beverages, snacks, oil, etc. to be able to make and sell tortillas and supply the store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, sugar, oil, yeast, etc.to help with her children's education

loans.name: Vanessa Alejandra

texts.es:
Vanessa, es una persona soltera, vive con su tía y un hermano, debido a la gran necesidad generar ingresos para costear sus gastos personales y apoyar con los gastos del hogar se decidió a fundar una tienda de productos de la canasta básica, la tiene ubicada en su vivienda desde hace dos años, maneja un horario de atención de ocho de la mañana a siete de la noche.
Está solicitando un crédito para poder mejorar el inventario de la tienda, se limitará a comprar bebidas, golosinas, arroz, frijoles, aceite, condimentos y otros productos que necesiten sus clientes, pretende ofrecer la mercadería a un precio justo para que sus ventas sean mayores y pueda mejorar su situación financiera, el riesgo es una mala administración.
Los sueños que ella tiene son continuar creciendo con su  negocio, tener estabilidad económica para salir adelante junto a su hermano.
texts.en:
Vanessa is a single person. She lives with her aunt and a brother. Owing to a great necessity to make an income to pay her personal expenses and help with the home expenses, she decided to open a basic goods store. She has had it in her home for two years. She manages a service schedule from eight in the morning to seven at night.

She is requesting a loan to be able to improve the store’s inventory. She will limit herself to purchasing soft drinks, candy, rice, beans, oil, condiments, and other products that her customers need. She hopes to offer the merchandise at a fair price so that her sales are better and able to improve her financial situation. The risk is bad management.

The dreams that she has are to continue growing with her business, to have economic stability to get ahead along with her brother.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, candy, rice, beans, oil, condiments, and other products that her customers need.

loans.name: Odilia

texts.es: Doña Odilia, tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijas, reside en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Lempira junto a su hermana. Desde hace 10 años se dedica al negocio propio, anteriormente se dedicaba a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, ahora cuenta con una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica como granos basicos, pan, dulces, referscos, churros, condimentos, productos de higiene y aseo, achineria como desodorantes, cremas, champu, cosmeticos etc.Esta solicitando un préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras para comprar mas producto y surtir para aumentar las ventas, comprara granos basicos, referscos, leche, golosinas, embutidos, productos de limpieza, y achineria. Su plan es tener un mejor negocio para mejorar su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Odilia is a 55 year old single mother of two girls.  She lives in a village in Gracias, Lempira with her sister.  For the past 10 years she has run her own business.  Previously, she works making and selling tortillas, but she now has a small grocery store where she sells essential goods such as basic grains, bread, sweets, beverages, churros, condiments, hygiene products, cleaning supplies and personal use goods such as, deodorant, lotion, shampoo, cosmetics, etc.  

She is seeking a loan of 15,000 Lempiras to purchase more products and stock her store in order to increase her sales.  She will purchase basic grains, beverages, milk, snacks, deli meats, cleaning supplies, and personal use products.  Her plan is to have a better business and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: purchase basic grains, beverages, milk, snacks, deli meats, cleanings supplies and personal use goods.

loans.name: Thuong

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuong is a 24-year-old, married and has a baby. She runs a business making bricks and selling them to earn a living. 

She requested a loan to buy cement, sand, a shovel, and a wheelbarrow to help her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. With support from her husband,  she is able to repay the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: To buy  cement, sand, a shovel, and a wheelbarrow to help her run the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wire, chemicals, seeds, hose,etc.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Ángela de 59 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y su grupo familiar. Para Ángela y su esposo lo más importante son sus hijos y es por ellos que hacen todo lo que está a su alcance para darles lo necesario. Ella se dedica a la elaboración de esencias naturales y la venta la realiza de forma ambulante en comunidades y mercados cercanos a su vivienda, es una labor que realiza desde hace mucho tiempo  y gracias a la calidad de sus esencias muchas personas la prefieren ya que son efectivas para dolores de estómago, musculares y de cabeza. Ángela gracias a un crédito anterior ha podido sostener el negocio por lo que se encuentra muy agradecida y con deseos de superarse cada vez más es por ello que  solicita este nuevo crédito a FUSAI para continuar invirtiendo en la compra de  materia prima para la fabricación de esencias naturales las cuales son muy demandadas por las personas debido a su efectividad. Por lo anterior con el monto solicitado piensa invertir en la compra de: alcohol, especias, colorantes, frascos, etc.
texts.en:
Ángela is 59 years old and lives with her husband and family in a home that they own.  For Ángela and her husband, the most important thing in life is their children for whom they do everything possible to provide for them.  She works making natural essences that she sells by traveling to different neighborhoods and markets near her home.  She has worked doing this for quite some time and thanks to the quality of her products, she has many customers because they are effective in treating stomach-, muscle-, and headaches.  

Thanks to her previous loan, Ángela was able to sustain her business for which she is very grateful.  With the hope of continuing to improve herself, she is seeking a new loan from FUSAI to continue investing in the purchase of raw materials to make her natural essences that are in high demand due to their effectiveness.  She plans to use the loan to purchase alcohol, spices, dyes, jars, etc.

loans.use: purchase alcohol, spices, dyes, jars, etc.

loans.name: Taivale

texts.en:
Taivale is a single 18 years old lady. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. 

To do this, she needs a loan to buy bags of flour, a bag of sugar, vegetable oil, oven and a pot. In the future, Taivale hopes to expand her business and to support her family financially. She joined SPBD in June this year 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, a bag of sugar, vegetable oil, oven and a pot

loans.name: Magdaleno

texts.es: Magdaleno, tiene 44 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa, tiene dos hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Desde joven se dedicaba a la agricultura con el cultivo de maíz y frijol, ahora cuenta con su propia finca de café, el cual le genera mayor ingreso. Esta producción la vende en pergamino húmedo y seco y lo vende a intermediarios de la zona. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 20,000 Lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y pago de trabajadores para limpieza y fertilización de su finca de café. Su propósito es mejorar la próxima cosecha. Su plan es que sus hijos estudien y tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Magdaleno is 44 years old, is married, has two children, and lives in a village in Gracias, Lempira. From a young age, he worked in agriculture, growing corn and beans. He now has his own coffee farm that generates a substantial income for him.  He sells his harvest to local intermediaries as wet and dry parchment coffee. 

He has decided to seek a loan of 20,000 Lempiras to purchase fertilizers and pay for workers to clean and fertilize his coffee farm.  His goal is to improve his next harvest. His plan is for his children to attend school and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers and pay laborers to clean and fertilize his coffee farm.

loans.name: Sitati

texts.en:
Sitati is 52 years old and married. He lives with his wife and 4 children in the Kitale area of Kenya. He practices poultry and sheep farming on his 10 acre farm in his village. Being a doctor by profession, he also runs a small clinic. 

Sitati is seeking a loan to start commercial poultry farming.  He intends to use this loan to buy traditional breeds of chicken that are adapted to local conditions. With your loan, he can triple the number of chickens he currently has to 85, which will make economic sense and make the investment worthwhile. 

With the growing demand for poultry products in the market, Sitati plans to use the income that he hopes to earn from poultry farming to look after his family’s well-being and his children’s education. He also wants continue investing in poultry to make it bigger and more profitable.

loans.use: to buy poultry to expand his farming business by a large amount

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
This young man is 23 years old and he lives with his mother and grandparents in Sevan in the Gegharkunik region. His name is Albert and he works at the local police station as a policeman. Albert is very kind and clever young man and as he mentions he adores his mother and he cannot imagine his life without his grandparents.

Albert is the only bread-winner in his family and he feels great responsibility to take care of the most precious people to him properly and provide them with a good living. Now this loan is very important for Albert as his grandfather (you can see him in the photo with Albert) has some health problems and he is in a hurry to have this loan in order to help with his lovely grandfather’s health problems.

loans.use: to help with his lovely grandfather’s health problems.

loans.name: Ravshanoro

texts.en:
Ravshanoro is a strong woman. She was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1966. She is married and has one child. She has 8 year experience of working at public service as a specialist. She is capable, responsible and goal oriented person. 

 Her daughter is going to university. She had a dream to educate her daughter in order she won’t face with difficulties in her life. She is willing to ensure her studies and appealed to IMON to get a loan. She is planning to pay her daughter’s tuition fee. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to pay her daughter’s tuition fee

loans.name: Marianette

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Marianette works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, she also earns additional income from fish vending. Marianette is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy fishing net use for her fishing business.

Marianette has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets used for fishing

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Judith is 44 years old and has one child still in school.

Judith has a food vending business in the Philippines. Judith requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Judith has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is 45 years old and has three children. Ivy is married and has two children are presently in school.

Ivy is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Ivy  requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pig.  Ivy has been in this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is 48 years old and has a beautiful family who are the driving force of Pamela´s life and the reason why she works so hard in her farming business.She is a smallholder farmer based in Kitale, which is a small rural town in the Rift Valley region of Kenya.  For ten years, Pamela has been a mixed farmer. She keeps dairy cattle and poultry on her farm. She also grows vegetables, among other crops. Despite prevailing animal diseases, she finds dairy farming to be the most enjoyable commercial farming activity. Besides dairy farming, she has a deep connection with gardening. In African communities, gardening is the most popular, yet the least exclusive hobby for women. 

She is seeking a loan to buy seeds and start horticultural farming.  She is very excited to start growing different varieties of crops for commercial purposes. The demand for vegetables and other greens is always high. 

Income from this venture will cover the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs.
Pamela just needs a little help, and you can give it to her now, so that she can accomplish all that she dreams of.

loans.use: To buy seeds and start horticulture farming

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es:
Marta, considera que las demandas de sus servicios como cosmetóloga están creciendo y necesita mejorar la vistosidad del negocio para atender mejor a sus clientes, requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar sillas de espera, vitrinas, estantes así como también cosméticos para continuar mejorando su salón de belleza.
Se siente muy contenta por estar mejorando su negocio con la ayuda del crédito anterior, además tiene nuevos ingresos para cumplir con sus compromisos y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Marta finds the demand for her cosmetology services to be growing and she needs to improve the appearance of her business in order to better serve her clients. She requests a new loan to buy chairs for the waiting area, display cases and shelves as well as cosmetics in order to continue improving her beauty salon. 

She is very happy to be improving her business with the help of her previous loan. She also has additional revenue in order to fulfill her commitments and help her family get ahead.

loans.use: to buy chairs for the waiting area, display cases, and shelves as well as cosmetics in order to continue improving her beauty salon.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is 42 years old, is married and has 2 young sons who depend on her and her husband financially.

She currently owns her own business and works there. She prepares nutritional breakfasts and sells them in her store. She is asking for the loan so she may by more products and grow her business.

loans.use: to invest in nutritional products for her business.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly, 41 years old, is the mother of two children. She makes a living working one hour a day raising livestock, a business she inherited from her family and which has allowed her to forge ahead with her own family. A reason for which this woman struggles day after day is to fulfill her dream of paying for the education of her children, since she worries a lot about their well-being. 

She is requesting a loan to buy feed wholesale and renovate the place where she keeps her livestock.

loans.use: To buy feed wholesale and renovate the place where she keeps her livestock

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
Jerlyn is 32 years old, married, has 2 children of school age and lives in Dipolog-Manukan, Zamboanga del Norte. She has an eatery business which she operates for more than 5 years. She sign up for membership with Paglaum MPC to avail on its fiancial services to small time borrower like her. 

Recently, she took a loan of PHP 14,900.00 to purchase pork, beef, chicken, fish, vegetables, spices and condiments for her eatery.

loans.use: to purchase pork, beef, chicken, fish, vegetables, spices and condiments for her eatery

loans.name: Sinfronia

texts.en: Sinfronia is 52 years old, married from Polo Pitogo, Bato, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She owns a fishing boat which is operated by her husband. This type of business gives her enough income for her family's needs. She signed up for membership with the cooperative and just recently, she requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new fishing nets.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing nets

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
The time when Maricel became a CCT partner was the start of a tremendous impact on her business. It’s been a great opportunity for her to continue and expand her chosen industry when she decided to loan certain amounts. The previous amount that she applied was P47,000. And this really became a medium for her business growth. Since it helped her buy trendy items to add for the business.  Managing RTW Business for 3 years really is challenging yet rewarding, you need to contemplate ways on how to acquire customers and return investments. 

Like any other business goals, Maricel wants to have her business expanded, have her own car and continuously able to provide needs for her family. Aside from hard work and patience, Profit is one of the bases for business’ success to take place. That’s why Maricel decided to apply for P50,000 loan this year.  She believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. 

Maricel is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consist of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony , share her own experience of God’s love and  hear God’s word that  was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to pay for additional merchandise like children's, men's and women's clothing.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 49 years old and married with one child.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home product care, and other groceries.

Jocelyn has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Jocelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 30 years old and married with three children, two of whom in school, Violeta works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell.

Violeta has been in this business for 5 years .

In the future Violeta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is a 60-year-old married woman who has three married sons, none of whom is economically dependent.

She has been working preparing and selling corn at a market place since 1980. She lives in a house of her own and is asking for 15,000 MXN (fifteen thousand pesos) to buy raw materials. She has taken two previous loans and paid them on time.

loans.use: To buy merchandise, mostly raw material.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
As a married mother of five, Rosalia works hard to support her family. She has a weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns income from food vending. 

Rosalia, who has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF, is borrowing PHP 12000 to buy additional materials for her weaving business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: sheet metal, wood, nails and cement to build a covering in front of his house.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 61 years old, widow with 7 children of adult age from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She has a sari-sari store which she operates for more than 10 years. Through this business activity, she earns meager amount of PHP 5,000.00 per month that supplements her needs so as with her grandchildren. 

Recently, she loan from Paglaum MPC to restock her store with canned goods, condiments, confectioneries, detergents and beauty soaps.

loans.use: to  restock her store with canned goods, condiments, confectioneries, detergents and beauty soaps

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Miss. Nhung, 19 years old,  is a single woman and her business is running a restaurant. She is earning a good income every day because many people come to eat in her restaurant so she is very happy with her business. 

Now she is applying for a loan to improve her business because she wants to open a bigger restaurant in the future. She opened her restaurant in 2014. She is taking this loan because she wants used to buy more materials such as rice, cooking oils, chicken, beef, salt, fish and other things to use. She hopes with this loan, her business can be improving in the future.

loans.use: To improve her business because she wants to open a bigger restaurant in the future

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en:
Arnel is a 49 years old, married and has two children to provide for. To earn an income he engaged in a buy and sell shoe business. He buys shoes okay sells them to the neighborhood. He aims to increase his income and improve his family living condition. So he decided to request a loan to buy more stocks of shoes for resale. Being able to sell more shoes will generate more income.

Arnel plans to save money to sustain the needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of shoes for resale.

location.town: San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
Pheap is 32-year-old, living in a remote area of Siem Reap province’s Banteay Srey district. She is a mother of two dependent children. She struggles for a living via rice farming as the main source of income. Meanwhile, her husband also works as a construction worker to supplement family’s income. She has been involved in this business for fourteen years. Her business earns her about 13,000KHR per day and she is able to save around 3,000KHR each day after offsetting her business expenses. The crops have destroyed by insects, which is the main challenge for her business. 

For Pheap, this is her fifth loan cycle with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. The previous loans have helped her to have enough consumption so to have a better  living standard. As the group leader of four members, she is going to apply for new loan to buy fertilizer to increase the productivity of her crop yields. She hopes to earn more income to timely expand her current business to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase the productivity of her crop yields.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Banteay Srey Distrcit

loans.name: Sokkheang

texts.en:
Sokkheang, who is a local farmer of Prey Prorsorb district of Kratie province, is 54 years old and a married mother of eight children, four of whom depend on her. She has two schooled children needing her support. She is growing paddy rice and vegetables to earn main income for better support in family. She sometimes works for others for a fee to earn additional income. Her living condition becomes tougher for she can earn only about 20,000KHR per day. 

Due to a lack of capital, Sokkheang decided to take out a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and this is the first time for her. She will use her loan to pay for plowing fees and buy fertilizers to enrich the crop with nutrients. She hopes to earn more income to improve the living standard much better than ever before.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fee and buy fertilizers to enrich her crop with nutrients.

loans.name: Bong

texts.en:
Mrs. Bong is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking woman, 48 years old. She has a fishing business. 

She requested a loan in order to buy a new engine for her fishing boat. She has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy a new engine for her fishing boat to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase photographic paper, ink, and other materials necessary for his services: photography, recordings, invitations, announcements, and other items.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Emelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Emelyn is borrowing PHP 29000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell in her store.

Emelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell in her store

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a thirty six year old married man with six children living in Masindi-Uganda. He has a shop selling general merchandise and also earns a salary as a teacher. He is challenged by high transport costs.

He is acquiring a loan to finish constructing his house.

loans.use: to finish constructing  his house

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Evaline(holding her small baby). She is a smallholder farmer from Siongiroi area of Kenya. She is extremely hard working, only taking Sundays off so that she can spend time with her family.Like many farmers in the region, she keeps a dairy cow. Siongiroi has a thriving market for dairy products. Evaline has sustained herself through dairy farming for six years now.  She has aspirations of expanding her dairy farm, but due to financial constraints, she has been unable to do so until now. 

Evaline is kindly requesting KES 50,000 from Kiva lenders, to purchase a high yielding dairy cow. This cow will boost milk production on the farm. As a result, she will have a higher quantity for both consumption and sales. With the money from the additional sales, she will be able to service her loan on time. With increased income from the loan, Evaline plans to spend money to settle the high costs of production in farming. In the long run, her family will realize an improved standard of living
Contribute to Evaline’s dream and make a loan.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to expand her farming activity

loans.name: Sudati

texts.en:
Sudati is a very hard working married woman charged with the responsibility of taking care of 3 children, who all attend school in Hoima Uganda. She ventured into selling of second hand clothes alongside owning rentals whereby she anticipates generating a lot of incomes to support her family. 

She hopes to expand her business and also educate her children. She is seeking  a loan facility to buy more second hand clothes for selling.

loans.use: to buy more second hand clothes for selling at her stall.

loans.name: Sefuluai

texts.en:
Sefuluai is 28 years old and married with 2 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for 1 year. 

Sefuluai has requested a loan to  buy 2 bags of flour, a bag of sugar, vegetable oil, oven and a fryer. She joined SPBD in June this year 2015 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Sefuluai will support her family financially and to expand her business

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of flour, a bag of sugar, vegetable oil, oven and a fryer

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina who is in  her early 30s is married with three children, two boys and one girl and all of them are still at school.  She has been selling fabrics, shoes and Moslem type of dresses for two years now. She works from 10am to 05pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Amina's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on the fabrics and then started selling shoes and Moslem type of dresses in door to door sales and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy fabrics, shoes, Moslem type of clothes to sell door to door.  She dreams of improving her life.

Amina will make sure she pays back her loan within the loan scheduled time.

loans.use: to  buy fabrics, shoes, moslim type of clothes to sell door to door.

loans.name: Niyozmoh

texts.en:
Niyozmoh is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1971 and is living in a village with her family. She is married and has two children. She grew up in a family of workers. Her father died when she was child, so her mother with hard difficulties raised her alone. After her marriage, she learned sewing at short time classes. Recently she is busy with sewing traditional women dresses. She works hard all day. 

Her health has deteriorated and she got tested at the doctor. The doctor strongly recommended that she need to go to the hospital and get treatment. But Niyozmoh has no money to pay medical service at hospital. She asked for a loan from Kiva and IMON to be treated at the hospital. She hopes to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders kindness.

loans.use: to be treated at hospital

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 58 years old, married and supports a family of 4 children. He is a farmer and has been growing cash crops for sell for 10 years now and it has been profitable. The income generated has enabled him to educate his children and provide for his family's needs. 

He has applied for his first loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow and hopes this will enable him to get milk for sell, make more income and support his family.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and improve the living standards of his family. His future hopes and dreams are to expand his farming business by adding more dairy cows and growing more cash crops, make more income and be able to provide for his family.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cows and hopes this will enable him to get milk for sell, make more income and support his family.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 66 years old and married with ten children.

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Lilia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pig. Lilia has been in this business for 15 years and also earns additional income from weaving.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus works at a restaurant as a waiter. He is 46 years old and married. His mother-in-law owns a gas tanker truck, which is managed by his wife and is a family business. He wants to take this loan to fill it. He is asking for 10,000 MXN (ten thousand pesos).

He had two previous loans which he paid with no problems or delays.

loans.use: fill a gas tanker truck owned by his family.

loans.name: Angel Maria

texts.es:
Ángel es casada, vive con su esposo de 44 años de edad y sus hijas de 20 y 15 años de edad, todos los miembros de su familia trabajan para tener un bienestar común, ella se dedica a elaborar tortillas para vender, tiene 10 años de dedicarse a desarrollar dicha actividad, inicia sus labores muy temprano cada día para ir a vender su producto al mercado municipal.
Con el crédito comprara  maíz, cal, bolsas, leña y otros materiales que son básicos para mejorar la productividad de tortillas y atender a nuevos clientes, para ella es importante tener a sus clientes satisfechos ya que así tendrá su fuente de ingresos con vida.
La visión que Ángel tiene es ampliar su negocio y darles a sus hijas una vida más confortable.
texts.en:
Ángel is married and she lives with her 44 year old husband and her 20 and 15 year old daughters. All of the members of the family work for the collective well-being. She works making tortillas to sell. She has been working to develop this business for 10 years.  She begins working very early in the morning each day to go and sell her product at the city market.
With the loan she will buy corn, lime, bags, firewood and other basic materials to improve the productivity of making tortillas and to serve new customers. It is important to her to have satisfied customers so that she will continue to have a source of income. 
Ángel's vision is to expand her business and give her daughters a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, bags, firewood and other basic materials to improve the productivity of making tortillas and to serve new customers

loans.name: Sophiko

texts.en:
Sophiko is 33 years old. She lives in Senaki district with her husband and 3 children. Sophiko gets orders to bake cakes and generates income. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan for purchasing a minibus. Her husband will drive the minibus and they will sell fruits and vegetables. Sophiko will be able to increase family income after this selling business. 

Sophiko thinks that the business will be profitable for her family and they will be able to improve the living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus and start selling fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Mrs. Thuy is 45 years old, she is a hardworking woman. There are four people in her family. The loan can help her to build a sanitatary latrine, which can contribute to improve the health for her family, as well as environment protection. Animal husbandry and fishing are the main income sources of her family so she is able to pay the loan monthly .

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Quyen

texts.en:
Mrs. Quyen is 46 years old, married and has three children, two of them are in school. She would like to improve her family’s living standard, especially her children but lacks capital. 

The loan can help her to build a sanitary latrine and she is able to repay the loan from fishing and selling chickens from her garden.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Situanai

texts.en:
Situanai is 22 years old and married with 3 children. She wants to start a small business growing and selling vegetables in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy vegetable seeds, a bag of fertilizer, spade, bush knives, a wheelbarrow and a rake. 

In the future, Situanai hopes to expand her business and to save more for her children's education . She joined SPBD in June this year 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, a bag of fertilizer, spade, bush knives, a wheelbarrow and a rake

loans.name: Emo

texts.en:
Emo is a 42 years old married woman with 6 children. She has a small plantation and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

Emo has requested a loan to buy timbers, iron roofs,wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Emo hopes to expand her business and to improve her family standard.

loans.use: to buy timbers, iron roofs, wheelbarrow etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase snacks, eggs, beverages, bread, etc. in order to stock her store with wholesale merchandise.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi is 49 years old and married with two children.

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Noemi is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs. Noemi has been in this business for 14 years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 43 years old and has five children. Teresita is married and has three children who are in school.

Teresita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Teresita has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Eusebia Antonia

texts.es:
Eusebia, vive con su esposo, una hija y dos nietos, tiene como actividad económica la crianza de cerdos, oficio que heredo de sus padres, su esposo practica la agricultura, crianza de ganado y le apoya con lo relacionado a la porqueriza, no tiene un horario establecido.
Ha solicitado un crédito para comprar cerdos, concentrado para alimentarlos y otra parte le servirá para hacer mejoras en los corrales, de esta manera los cerdos tendrán un mejor entorno y se mantendrán saludables espera poder venderlos a mejor precio y cancelar sin problemas la deuda.
Los sueños que Eusebia tiene son tener estabilidad financiera para que su familia tenga un mejor futuro.
texts.en: Eusebia lives with her husband, a daughter and two grandchildren. Her business activity is to raise pigs, a job she inherited from her parents. Her husband works in agriculture and supports her with everything related to the pigs. He does not have an established schedule. She has requested a loan to buy pigs, concentrated food to feed them and to make improvements to the pigpen, so they have a better environment and will remain healthy. This way, she hopes to sell them at a better price and pay off her debt without problems. Eusebia's dream is to have financial stability so that her family has a better future.

loans.use: to buy pigs, concentrated food to feed them and to make improvements to the pigpen so the pigs have a better environment.

loans.name: Maa Baman Dei Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Chanchala, aged 33 years, is the featured borrower of Maa Baman Dei SHG-B Group. She lives with her husband, her 5-year-old daughter, and an unmarried sister-in-law in Kandulguda village of Koraput district. The lady standing on the left in the photo is Chanchala. Her husband works as a daily labourer in a nearby town. The area where she resides does not have an appropriate source of water that can be used for consumption purposes.

In order to provide safety and hygiene to her family, Chanchala, along with her group member, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Chanchala will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase steel pipes, taps, and a hand pump, which will provide her with clean water for usage and prevent her from getting harmful, contagious water-borne diseases.

Chanchala has a dream to get her sister-in-law married in a well-settled house and provide her daughter with good educational facilities so that she can succeed in her life.

loans.use: to purchase steel pipes, taps, and a hand pump.

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Ms. Trang is a hardworking woman, 21 years old. She is single and lives with her parents. Her income is mainly from animal husbandry and cultivation. 

She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family’s member. With support from her parents, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa, prepara tamales y antojitos para vender, de esta forma puede generar ingresos para aportar en los gastos de su hogar, sale a vender de manera ambulante y también lo hace en su vivienda, vive con su familia integrada por su esposo, su suegra y sus hijos de 15, 13 y 12 años de edad, todos colaboran para mantener funcionando el negocio.
Utilizará el crédito para comprar maíz, papas, yuca, aceite, etc., para continuar trabajando y mejorar localidad de los tamales y antojitos, espera satisfacer los gustos y demandas de sus clientes, pues así sus ingresos serán mayores y cubrirá sus obligaciones.
Rosa sueña con tener recursos económicos suficientes para mejorar su vivienda y continuar dándoles a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar.
texts.en:
Rosa prepares tamales and snacks for sale. This is how she generates income to contribute to her household expenses. She sells both as a street vendor as well as out of her home.

She lives with her family, which is made up of her husband, her mother-in-law, and her children, who are 15, 13, and 12 years old. They all contribute to keep the business running. 

She will use the loan to purchase corn, potatoes, yuca, oil, etc. in order to continue working and improve the quality of her tamales and snacks. She hopes to satisfy the tastes and demands of her customers, so that her income will be better and she will be able to fulfill her responsibilities. Rosa's dream is to have enough economic resources to improve her house and continue giving her children the opportunity to study.

loans.use: to purchase corn, potatoes, yuca, oil, etc. in order to continue working and to improve the quality of her tamales and snacks.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen, 44 years old, is a hardworking woman and the mother of three children. They are the driving force of her life and the reason why she works so hard in her business. She specializes in cows, a job that she’s been doing for more than 15 years.

Yen wants to stock up so she can increase her profits and make the business more successful. That’s why she wants to buy two more calves that will let her increase her investment in her work. She wants to see her work become sustainable over time, so she’s willing to invest more in her business.

Someday, she expects to pay for her children's education because she believes that is the way to do better in life. She just needs a little help, and you can give it to her now, so she can accomplish all that she dreams of.

loans.use: to buy two more calves that will let her increase her business.

loans.name: Tumelo

texts.en:
Tumelo is a Business Management Student at the Maharishi Institute. Joseph is 22 years old and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute: This is his story:What do you study at Maharishi Institute? Which classes you enjoy most
I am studying towards a Bachelor of Arts Degree in management. The classes which I enjoy most are marketing management, business law and ethics and career strategies to name a few. However, I would say that all my classes have been pleasant and I have learned and grown from all of them. 
What are your goals after graduating from the Institute? Please be specific: In which sector do you expect to work? In which city would you like to work? Would you like to travel?
My goal is to find myself a decent work that will enable me to fulfil my needs, after that I would like to start the business in green sector. My goal here will be to reduce the harm that most of the company has already done. Johannesburg or Durban is my main city for this. Yes I would really like to travel outside of the country
Tell us about your background. Where were you born? Do you have brothers and sisters? What do your parents do for work? Are you married? Do you have children?
I am the only child in my family. I was born in Free State. My parent are domestic workers and I am not married and do not have children.
What do you like to do in your spare time?
In my spare time I would like to read, be with friends, go to the mall, watch movies and sometimes relax with my mother.
How will a Kiva loan change your life? Describe how the loan will affect your studies and your lifestyle: will there be significant changes?
Kiva loan will help me pay for my school fees, transport and have some money left for personal use. Because I will not have stress about my fees, I will be able to concentrate more on my studies.

loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Febelyn

texts.en:
Febelyn is 33 years old and a mother of two children. She is engaged in a buying & selling feed. She buys feed and sells it. Her husband is a farmer. He helps her in providing for her children's needs but since her children's educational needs are increasing she needs to increase her income. She decided to buy more stocks of feed for sale so that she can sell more feed and be able to generate greater income.

In the future, Febelyn plans to save money to improve her living conditions

loans.use: to buy more stocks of feed to sell.

loans.name: Adeliza

texts.en:
Adeliza is a married woman with seven children. She is 44 years old and four of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Adeliza has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed.

In the future, Adeliza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed for her weaving business.

loans.name: Carolina Esther

texts.es: Carolina en su infancia estuvo ligada a la labor comercial que ejercía su madre y con una sonrisa en sus labios nos cuenta que inició su negocio motivada por este ejemplo, ella ya tenía la habilidad de persuadir y realizar ventas,  de este modo palpo la oportunidad entre sus vecinos y conocidos de ofrecerles a crédito carnes frías, un producto muy consumido y que hace parte de la canasta familiar.   En la actualidad cuenta con dos años de estar brindándole a las familias que residen en su vecindario salchichas, mortadelas, chorizos, butifarras y jamones a buenos precios y como su capital es insuficiente para la demanda de sus clientes está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en mortadelas, salchichones y salchichas.  Esta inversión permitirá incrementar sus ventas y cumplir con todos los pedidos.  Su meta a futuro es ofrecer a sus tres hijos una educación de calidad y continuar trabajando comprometida para incrementar la base de clientes.
texts.en:
Since she was young, Carolina has been linked to sales, as this is the type of work her mother performed. With a big smile on her face, she shares how she started her business motivated by this example. She already had the ability to persuade and carry out sales and, in this way, the opportunity arose to offer cold meats, which are a basic staple and are frequently consumed, on credit to her neighbors.

She has currently been providing families that live in her neighborhood with bologna, ham and a variety of sausages at a good price for two years. Since her capital is insufficient to meet the demand of her clients, she is applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she will invest in bologna and sausages. This investment will allow her to increase her sales and complete all of her orders. Her goal for the future is to offer her three children a quality education and to continue working, committed to increasing her client base.

loans.use: to invest in bologna and sausages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, blouses, dresses, skirts, etc. in order to improve her inventory and cater to the needs of her customers.

loans.name: Shamim..

texts.en:
Shamim is a thirty three year old married woman with four children living in Masindi-Uganda. She deals in selling clothes and soft drinks. She hopes to educate her children though she is challenged by inadequate capital.

She is accessing credit to buy bags and clothes for selling.

loans.use: to buy bags and clothes for selling

loans.name: Gela

texts.en:
Gela is 30 years old. He is married and lives with his wife, son and parents. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have 2 cows and a pig, also a plot of agricultural land, where they grow maize and sell. Gela wants to start trading business to have stable income.


The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan for starting trading fruits and vegetables. He will gain stable income and will be able to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to begin trade fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Sergio Ivan

texts.en: Sergio is 26 years old and lives with his parents. He has no economic dependents and works as a helper at a market place. He is asking for 10,000 MXN (ten thousand pesos) to buy a motorcycle so he can travel to his job faster. He has had a previous loan and had no problems repaying it.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to get to his job faster.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.en: Maria is 40 years old and has two young kids who live with her. They depend on her economically. She wants 8,000 MXN (eight thousand pesos) to buy and resell cosmetics merchandise.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics merchandise by catalog and resell it.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a married lady aged 55 years old. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training especially enterprise development and financial management. 
She practices dairy farming and pig farming. She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy dairy feeds hence increase milk production. With increased income, she will be able to meet her family's basic needs e.g. food and clothing with ease.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy dairy feeds hence increase milk production and earn more income to meet family basic needs e.g. food and clothing.

loans.name: Leonel Alfredo

texts.es: Leonel tiene 48 años  de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus dos  hijos de 19 y 14 años de edad. Leonel se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado bobino y vacuno desde hace once años. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Este negocio es la principal fuente de ingresos por lo que anteriormente ha venido trabajando con créditos con los cuales  Leonel ha invertido  en la compra de otras cabezas de ganado vacuno y bobino para mantener el negocio activo y poder cubrir un mercado más grande. Dado que el desea mantener su negocio siempre a flote y seguir con la inversión solicita este crédito a FUSAI para proceder a la compra del ganado y de esta forma seguir manteniendo la economía de hogar con las ganancias que le generan las ventas.
texts.en:
Leonel is 48 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and two children, ages nineteen and fourteen.  

Leonel has been buying and selling cattle for eleven years; this is how he earns a living and provides for his home.  This business is his principal source of income, so Leonel has been working with loans before, investing them in the purchase of other heads of cattle in order to keep the business active and cover a larger market.

As he wants to stay in business always and continue with the investment, he is requesting this loan with FUSAI in order to proceed with the purchase of cattle. In this way, he will continue supporting his home financially with the earnings generated from sales.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and maintain his business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 45 year old, resident of Gen. Trias, Cavite, Philippines. She and Ildefonso, her life and business partner, have been in the construction business for seven years already. They build small townhouses. It is their source of income and provides for their needs and for the educational needs of her children.

Almost every family in the Philippines.has one member who works and earns abroad so they can afford to buy their own house which leads to a higher demand forf houses. To help Elizabeth fund their construction project she would like to request a PHP 20,000 loan to pay for construction materials to continue building a townhouse She will be grateful and is thanking God and you in advance for the help that will be extended to her.

Elizabeth hopes to build more townhouses and prays that her construction workers will always be in good health. She aims to send all her children to good schools. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for construction materials needed for her construction project, building a townhouse.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is 50 years old. Her family lives at Alcala. Her husband works as a clerk in a nearby province while she manages a store for income.

Filomena wanted to gain more income that is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy grocery items to sell. She will buy soft drinks, biscuits, noodles and canned goods to sell. She will invest the additional revenue in improving her farming business as an additional source of income.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Barack

texts.en:
Barack is a forty nine year old married man with nine children living in Masindi-Uganda. His major business is selling clothes alongside farming. He is a hard working man who hopes to expand his business though capital is not enough to help him do well.

He intends to use the loan money to buy clothes for selling.

loans.use: to buy clothes for selling

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maria is 48 years old and has four children who are in school.

Maria has a fishing business in the Philippines. Maria requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Maria has been in this business for 24 years. In the future, Maria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 32 years old, married and has two children.  

She is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Jenalyn requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy piglets to raise and feeds.

Jenalyn has been pig fattening and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jenalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and feeds

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuy is 37 years old, married and has two children. She lives in rural area and raising poultry and cattle are her main job, which she has been doing for more than 10 years. 

The loan can help her to build a sanitatary latrine in order to improve her living standard, especially her children.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Amiran

texts.en:
Amiran is 55 years old. He lives in Kobuleti. Amiran is unemployed and lives in poverty. He wants to start some kind of activity to generate income. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative for Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan for purchasing a used car. Amiran will serve people as a taxi driver and will be able to generate income.

He is very motivated and awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a used car and start a taxi business.

loans.name: Sejahtera Group

texts.en:
Sejahtera is a group consisting of 5 women. It was formed a few weeks ago because the members have one purpose: to get a loan from TLM. They are Kristin, the group leader who is standing in the middle of this group, and Meriance, Margarita, Wedelmina and Hendriyati. 

Kristin is married and has been blessed with 4 children. One child is working, one just finished senior high school, one is attending school, and the last one does not attend school yet. In 2014, Kristin established a small-scale business of selling mung bean porridge. Besides that, she also sells ice cubes in small quantities. Kristin admits that the income generated from that business is not adequate for her household needs, and that is why she wants to run a business selling gasoline. To make it happen, she formed a group and is asking for a loan from TLM of IDR 15,000,000. She will use the money to buy gasoline. The other members will use the money to support their businesses of selling cakes, fishmongering, and running a food stall.

loans.use: to buy gasoline

loans.name: Joyma

texts.en:
Joyma, 38, lives in Tuguegarao. She had two children, both are studying. She and her husband manages their sewing business. She had clear vision in expanding her business and hopes to improve her output to gain more profits in selling curtains.

 She is now asking additional capital to expand her business. She will buy more fabrics to use in sewing curtains and also buy t-shirts and do printing jobs as additional business. She hopes to become succesfull in their business and achieve economic stability.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics to use in her sewing business

loans.name: Mzevinar

texts.en:
Mzevinar is a 46-year-old married woman from Batumi. She lives with her husband, two children and pensioner mother-in-law. Mzevinar works at a local bakery. She is very experienced in this field and gets a monthly salary. 

She decided to open her own bakery and generate more income. The Start Up program is a joint initiative with Kiva, and Credo enables her to get a loan for opening a bakery. She will bake Georgian bread to sell. The Start Up program will significantly increase her income, and Mzevinar will be able to provide better living conditions for her family. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a bakery

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia works hard to support her family. Letecia is married and has a bakery business in the Philippines.

She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, milk, sugar and margarine for her bakery.

Letecia has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Letecia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, milk, sugar and margarine for her bakery

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
