Vivian is 42 years old and married with three children. She lives in a rural community in the outskirts of Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

She raises pigs and sells them in her community or at the market to earn a living. She has been doing this for sixteen years.

Vivian needs a loan to buy three pigs and pig feed for her business. She plan to use her profit to help covers her family's weekly expenses and also provide for her children's education.

She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a Taiwan boar and sow (a local breed of pig) and also pig feed for her business.

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel is 36 years old and has five children. Three of her children are in school.

Ethel is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Ethel requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Ethel has been in this business for 10 years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ethel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric for tablecloths, thread, and embellishments, which would allow him to increase the productivity of his business in order to sell his products in the market.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a 59-year-old married man with children who buys beans, maize, and soya beans in Kyenjojo, Uganda. For many years, he kept cattle and grew bananas and millet, then he started buying and selling maize and beans. His hardship is that the business is seasonal. His vision is to become a market leader in produce and to own a modern food store that caters to increased demand. Edward needs the loan to buy beans for selling.

loans.use: to buy beans to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 43-year-old lady. She is married and has three children.

She sells fruits and vegetables and has been in the business for 15 years.

This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya. She intends to use the loan to purchase her stock of bananas for re-sale.

She will use the profits from her business to educate her children and buy land.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to buy a lorry to transport fruits as well as to buy land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy bananas to re-sell

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 30 years old and married to Samson. They are blessed with five children between the ages of six and fourteen years.

She is into horticultural farming which she has been in for three years now. She has borrowed KES 30,000 of which she intends to purchase seeds,fertilizer and pay labor charges. This being her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, she plans to work extra hard to become a large scale farmer in her region.

Her dream is to educate her children to higher levels and be successful in life.

loans.use: to buy farm in-puts and pay for labour.

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es:
Rosa, logro establecer mejor la venta de ropa interior con la ayuda del crédito anterior, tiene una mejoría en sus ingresos, nuevos clientes y un estilo de vida más confortable.
Desea continuar progresando por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar variedad de ropa interior, ofrecerá nuevos estilos, colores y tallas para satisfacer las demandas de sus clientes. Espera que las ventas se mantengan y que la clientela crezca.
texts.en: Rosa was able to improve her underwear sales with the help of her last loan. She has seen an improvement in her income, new customers, and a more comfortable lifestyle. She hopes to continue progressing, and thus is requesting a new loan in order to purchase an assortment of underwear and offer new styles, colors, and sizes in order to satisfy the demands of her customers. She hopes that her sales will stay steady and that her clientele will grow.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of underwear and offer new styles, colors, and sizes to satisfy the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en: Candelaria is married and the mother of five children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who is 38 years old and earns a living by running a rice mill in the Philippines. Candelaria has requested a PHP 10,000 loan from NWTF to buy spare parts to maintain her mill. She has been in her current line of work for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to maintain her rice mill

loans.name: Silvia Lorena

texts.es:
Silvia, manifiesta que su negocio está mejorando con la ayuda del crédito anterior, su situación financiera poco a poco está cambiando, actualmente además de vender frutas y verduras vende ropa, de esta manera tiene oportunidad de mejores ingresos. La familia se mantiene saludable.
Requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar frutas, verduras y prendas de vestir, para fortalecer su negocio y brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
For Silvia it is clear that her business is improving with the help of the previous loan. Her financial situation is changing little by little. 
Currently, in addition to selling fruits and vegetables, she is also selling clothing. This is giving her the opportunity to increase her income. Her family continues to be healthy.
She needs a new loan to buy fruits, vegetables and articles of clothing to strengthen her business and provide better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables and articles of clothing to strengthen her business and provide better service to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wood, nails, glue, sheetrock, varnish, etc. to continue building beautiful furniture.

loans.name: Flaviano

texts.en:
Flaviano is a 55 years old, married, and has two children to provide for. 

To earn a living, he engages in a transport business. Flaviano aims to increase his income so that he can provide his children's daily needs, so he decided to borrowe a loan to buy new tires for motorcycle maintenance so that he can continue to cater for more passengers which will generate more income.

Flaviano's plan for the future is to save money to renovate his family house.

loans.use: To buy new tires for motorcycle maintenance.

location.town: San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José, está satisfecho por los beneficios que tiene al haber invertido el crédito anterior en su negocio, como no está lloviendo mucho utiliza el sistema de riego, las cosechas han sido abundantes y puede alimentar a su familia y comercializarlas para tener ingresos y cubrir otras necesidades de su hogar.
Ha decidido solicitar un nuevo crédito para  comprar abono, semilla de maíz y pesticidas, dará un buen trato al cultivo y lo cuidara de las plagas, aspira tener una buena cosecha para que su negocio mantenga la continuidad.
texts.en:
José is pleased with the benefits that he has from investing the previous loan in his business.
As it is not been raining very much, he is using an irrigation system. The harvest has been abundant and he is able to feed his family and sell the crops to have an income to cover the other needs of his home.
He has decided to request another loan to buy fertilizer, corn seed and pesticides. He will treat his crops well and protect them from pests. He hopes to have a good harvest so that his business can continue.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, corn seed and pesticides.

loans.name: Rosa Abigail

texts.es:
Rosa, necesita de un nuevo préstamo para comprar tomates, chiles, cebollas, harina, maíz, quesillo, chicharrón, granos básicos etc., para continuar vendiendo pupusas y tortillas, pues para ella es una fuente de ingresos principal.
Hoy en día su negocio está atendiendo muchos clientes nuevos, el crédito anterior le ha permitido tener recursos económicos para abastecer de materia prima su  negocio, los ingresos son de subsistencia familiar. Por el momento no ha enfrentado problemas de salud.
texts.en:
Rosa needs a new loan to purchase tomatoes, peppers, onions, flour, corn, cheese, pork, basic grains, etc., to continue selling pupusas and tortillas, because for her this is her main source of income.

Today her business is taking in many new customers.  The previous loan allowed her to have economic resources to supply the raw material for the business.  

Her revenues are for family subsistence.  At the moment she has not faced any health problems.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, peppers, onions, flour, corn, cheese, pork, basic grains etc., to continue selling pupusas and tortillas

loans.name: Maa Baman Dei Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Jema, aged 32 years, is the featured borrower of Maa Baman Dei SHG-C from the village Kandulguda of Koraput district. Her husband works as an auto driver in the village and has an inconsistent income.

Jema is standing to the left in the photograph. As a parent of two children, Jema works hard to support her family. She has an incense stick business in the village of Kandulguda. Aimed with a dream of having a decent living, Jema is working really hard to improve her business.

She along with her fellow group member has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Jema will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase a water purifier, as in their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water purifier at home will help her to safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water. 

Jema aims to start a food stall business in the future so that she will become financially strong enough to build more assets.

loans.use: to purchase a water purifier

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 36 years old, married, and has one child. To earn a living and be able to help her husband as a mechanic, she manages her own repair shop. 

She aims to increase her income so that she can improve their living condition, so she decided to  take a loan to buy more materials for the repair shop so that they can continue cater for more customers in their shop, and that will generate more income.

Eva's plan for the future is to save money from her business income to expand her business .

loans.use: To buy more materials for the repair shop.

location.town: Lower Tiparak, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Chelyn

texts.en:
Chelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy items like soap, shampoo, biscuits, chips, noodles, eggs, etc., to sell for her general store business.

Chelyn has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from raising pigs and rice retailing.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items like soap, shampoo, biscuits, chips, noodles, eggs, etc., to sell

loans.name: Maritza Esperanza

texts.es:
Maritza, opta por un nuevo préstamo para tener a su disposición materia prima para su negocio, comprara maíz, leña, gas propano, cal y bolsas para preparar la venta de tortillas y mantener a sus clientes satisfechos.
El préstamo anterior le ha sido de gran beneficio para mejorar el negocio y la atención que da a sus clientes, las condiciones económicas son favorables, con lo que puede darle a su familia un estilo de vida más digno y cancelar su deuda.
texts.en:
Maritza is opting  for a new loan to have available the raw material for her business.  She will purchase corn, firewood, propane gas, lime and bags to prepare the sale of tortillas and keep her customers satisfied.

The previous loan has been of great benefit to better her business and the care given to her customers. 

Economic conditions are favorable, so she can give her family a more dignified life style and pay off her debt.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, propane gas, lime and bags to prepare the sale of tortillas and keep customers satisfied

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a smallholder farmer based in Thika, which is a rain-fed area of Kenya where agriculture is the main economic activity of the populace. He is married and has three children. He relies on livestock and crop farming to provide for the needs of his family. On his 0.25 acre farm, he keeps dairy and poultry.  

John is seeking a loan to buy pigs and complete the construction of the cowshed on his farm. The borrowed money will be used to improve animal husbandry practices, promote diversity, and increase productivity. 

With this loan, John's goal is to improve the livelihood and the level of income of his family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and construction materials for a cowshed

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah thanks Kiva for the previous loan that enabled her to add stock to her vegetable selling business. With increased stock, she realized more profits and thus, was able to support her family needs with ease.

She is now borrowing a second Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and animal feeds to increase livestock and vegetable production. This will enable her to further add stock and increase her income.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the continued financial support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and animal feeds and hence increase vegetable and livestock production for increased income.

loans.name: Ushirika Self Help Youth Group

texts.en:
The lady in the photo at the center in gloves holding a basket is Esther, a member of Ushirika Self Help Youth Group. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training in enterprise development.

She practices mixed farming: vegetable farming and indigenous chicken rearing. Besides, she is involved in knitting sweaters. She is taking a Kiva loan to buy more knitting materials for knitting sweaters. 

This will enable her increase the stock of sweaters, hence meeting the high demand for sweaters during the current cold season. She intends to use the increased profits to construct a modern poultry house.
 
She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy knitting materials, hence increasing the stock of sweaters and then using the profits to construct a modern poultry house.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca de 32 años de edad  habita en vivienda familiar en compañía de su esposo y sus dos hijos de 14 y 1 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que con mucho esfuerzo ha sacado adelante a sus dos hijos brindándoles todo lo que está al alcance de sus manos. Blanca se dedica al negocio de ventas por catálogos con el que ha ganado un buen número de clientes que la conocen y que la recomiendan, además  recibe el apoyo del esposo con algunos gastos del hogar. Ella desea mantener por más tiempo su negocio y brindarles una mejor calidad de productos a sus clientes, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cremas para manos, lociones, jabones, etc., y además piensa incursionar ropa para damas por lo que con el monto también invertirá en la compra de prendas de vestir como, blusas y ropa interior para de esta manera mejorar los ingresos a su hogar.
texts.en:
Blanca is 32 years old and lives in a family home along with her husband and two children who are 14 and 1 years old. 

She is a hardworking woman, who, with a lot of effort has raised her two children by providing all that is at her reach. 

Blanca is in the business of sales through catalogs with which she has acquired a great number of clients who know and recommend her.  She also has the support of her husband with some household expenses. 

She wants to keep going with her business and provide better quality products to her customers.  This is why she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in: hand creams, lotions, soaps, etc.  In addition, she would like to introduce women's clothing so as such, the loan amount will also be invested in  the purchase of clothing such as blouses and underwear so that in this way she will improve earnings for her home.

loans.use: to invest in: hand creams, lotions, soaps, blouses, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing for women and children as well as invest in dairy products, which will allow her to strengthen her income-generating activities to help her family advance.

loans.name: Maa Baman Dei Shg-E Group

texts.en:
Rukmani, a 28-year-old lady, is the featured borrower of Maa Baman Dei SHG-E from the village Kandulguda of Koraput district. She is the lady standing to the right-hand side in the photograph.

Rukmani lives with her husband who owns a grocery shop and with her children. Her husband looks after all the household expenses; however, he is unable to pay the school and tuition fees of his children. So Rukmani, along with other group member, started making pickles, jams, mango jellies and pampad, and she fetched a good amount of money by selling them. This business fetched her quite a good sum of money.

Rukmani, along with her group member, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Rukmani will use her portion of the loan amount to install a hand pump, as she has to travel a long distance to bring water for household consumption purposes, and she faces difficulty to travel by foot as her right leg was partially damaged in an accident three years back.

Rukmani has a future plan to start poultry farming and hire two more assistants who will help her in this business.

loans.use: to install a hand pump for household water

loans.name: Pesey

texts.en: Pesey is a 46-year-old mother of two children from the Takeo province in Cambodia. She has run a food stall in front of a factory in the city since 2012. Her husband is 48 years old and works as a security guard. One of her two children works in a factory and the youngest one is in school. Pesey, her husband, and her working child can earn USD16 per day. She is requesting a loan to buy construction materials to renovate her food stall and buy more chairs and tables for her food stall. This loan will help her improve her business and her family’s finances. Her plans are to expand her food stall, build fences around her house, and support her child in earning higher education.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to renovate her food stall and buy more chairs and tables for her food stall

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 29 years old, married and blessed with two children who are both in primary school. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2015 to benefit from the training on enterprise development. 

Martin is a farmer growing potatoes, kale and broccoli. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy certified seeds and fertilizer to boost his farming production. He hopes this loan will help him generate more income, and hence, expand his farming business by starting a sheep farming business. He plans to use the profits to buy a sheep.

Martin is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds and fertilizer to boost farming production and to use the profits to buy a sheep for rearing.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is a smallholder farmer based in Nandi Hills, which is a rain-fed area of Kenya where agriculture is the main economic activity of the populace. He relies on livestock and crop farming to provide for the needs of his family. On his 2.5-acre farm, he keeps dairy cows and grows tea. His biggest challenge is transport.

Among Kenyan smallholder farmers, reasonably priced Indian motorcycles are the preferred means of farm transportation because of their affordability and agility. Abraham is seeking a loan to buy such a motorcycle. Through your loan, the acquired motorcycle will enable him access to formal markets in new geographical and economical regions. As a result, he will improve his income and agricultural productivity in the long run.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es:
Gloria, tiene una venta de frutas, su madre le ayudo a aprender el negocio, la respalda una experiencia de cuatro años, tiene como ventaja la buena ubicación del negocio, ella vive con su madre y un hijo, es soltera.
Ha tomado a bien solicitar un crédito para comprar uvas, papayas, piñas, manzanas, mamones, fresas, etc., tendrá un negocio más competitivo y será más fácil que sus clientes encuentren lo que están buscando, la finalidad de la inversión es atraer nuevos clientes, incrementar las ventas así como también sus ganancias.
Es una persona agradecida con Dios por darle su familia y las fuerzas para trabajar y así sacarlos adelante, lo única que ella aspira es a cuidar mejor cada día de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Gloria has a fruit selling business.  Her mother helped her learn the business.  She is backed by four years of experience and has the advantage of good business location.  She lives with her mother and son.  She is single.

She is requesting a loan to purchase grapes, papayas, pineapples, apples, lychees, strawberries, etc.  She will have a more competitive business and will be easier for her customers to find what they are looking for.  The purpose of the loan is to attract new customers, increase sales as well as her profits.

She is a grateful person, and thanks God for giving her a family and for giving her the strength to work and be able to move on.  Her only hope is to be able to take better care, every day, of her loved ones.

loans.use: to purchase grapes, papayas, pineapples, apples, lychees, strawberries, etc., so that she will have a more competitive business.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.fr: Lourdes, 26 ans, est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle vit à Port-au-Prince avec son époux et les enfants. Elle est propriétaire d’une belle boutique de produits alimentaires très bien réputée dans le quartier. Son rêve est de devenir une grande commerçante très connue dans la zone. Elle demande un microcrédit pour acheter des caisses de lait concentré et de riz.
texts.en:
26-year-old Lourdes is married with two children. She lives in Port-au-Prince with her husband and children.

She owns a fine grocery store, well renowned in the neighborhood. Her dream is to become a  great merchant well-known in the area.

She is requesting a micro-credit loan to buy boxes of condensed milk and rice.

loans.use: buy boxes of condensed milk and rice

loans.name: Neneth

texts.en:
Neneth is 40 years old and has five children. Neneth is married and has four children who are in school.

Neneth is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Neneth has been in this business for four years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Neneth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Editha works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Aiko

texts.en:
Aiko is 21 years old with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Aiko runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, sugar, home-care products and other groceries.

Aiko has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, candies, junk foods, sugar, soap, coffee and other groceries. 

In the future, Aiko would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, sugar, home-care products and other groceries

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy rice, gasoline, canned goods, soap, milk, chips, bread, etc. to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like buy and sell fish and vegetable vending.

Jocelyn dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college

loans.use: to buy rice, gasoline, canned goods, soap, milk, chips, bread, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ailene

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ailene works hard to support her family.

She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Ailene is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her bicycle transport business.

Ailene has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed

loans.name: Cecilia Margarita

texts.es:
Cecilia, vive con sus hijos y también cuida de su madre, sus hijos ya son independen y en el tiempo libre le ayudan con su negocio, no cuentan con parientes en el extranjero, su actividad económica es la venta de pizza, tiene cuatro años de dedicarse a dicha actividad y sus clientes prefieren mucho el producto que vende.
Con el préstamo podrá comprar harina, tomates, chiles, embutidos, queso y otros ingredientes importantes para elaborar pizzas y venderlas, ofrecerá a sus clientes mayor calidad y mejor atención, espera reducir las necesidades de sus clientes para continuar teniendo ingresos con los que pueda pagar el crédito.
Sueña con tener más clientes satisfechos y compartir un estilo de vida digno junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Cecilia lives with her children and also cares for her mother. Her children are already independent, and in their free time, they help her with her business. They don't have any relatives abroad.

Her business is in pizza sales. She has four years of experience working in the business, and her customers are very partial to the product she sells.

With the loan, she will be able to buy flour, tomatoes, chiles, cold cuts, cheese, and other important ingredients to make and sell pizzas. She will offer her customers higher quality and better attention. She hopes to reduce her clients' needs in order to continue having income with which she can pay off the loan.

Her dream is to have more satisfied clients, and to share a respectable lifestyle with her family.

loans.use: to buy flour, tomatoes, chiles, cold cuts, cheese, and other important ingredients to make and sell pizzas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy soft drinks

loans.name: Carolene

texts.fr: Carolene est âgée de 39 ans. Elle travaille depuis ses 18 ans dans la vente. Depuis 11 ans, elle possède sa propre boutique d’articles divers. Elle vend des produits alimentaires, des produits cosmétiques et d’autres articles très sollicités par ses clients. Elle a besoin d’un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock de produits alimentaires.
texts.en:
Carolene is 39 years old. She has been a retail merchant since she was 18.

For the past eleven years she has been operating her own grocery store. She sells food, cosmetics, and other items in high demand by her customers.

She needs a micro-credit loan to increase her food stock supply.

loans.use: buy boxes of toothpaste and hair spray

loans.name: Mlis' Group

texts.en: Mlis is a 46-year-old widowed mother living in the Bovel district of Battambang province. She has two dependent children, one of whom is in school. She has grown rice on 6.5 hectares of farmland as her main business for ages and she sells grocery items to supplement her income. Due to a lack of capital, Mlis leads a group of two to take out a new loan. This is her fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. The previous loan enabled her to improve her living conditions. This new loan will be used to pay for plowing fees and to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizers to support her rice farm. She hopes to earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To pay plowing fees and buy rice seeds and organic fertilizers to support her rice farm.

loans.name: Marie Michelle

texts.fr: Marie Michelle, 40 ans, est une jeune maman divorcée. Elle habite à Port-au-Prince avec ses quatre enfants. Elle dispose d’un petit commerce de produits alimentaires chez elle. Peu certes, mais les revenus de cette activité lui donne de quoi nourrir sa famille au quotidien. Elle est à la recherche d’un appui financier car elle souhaite augmenter son stock d’œufs.
texts.en:
40-year-old Marie Michelle is a young divorced mother. She lives in Port-au-Prince with her four children.

She has a small business selling food at home. The income from this activity is meager, but it enables her to feed her family every day.

She is seeking financial support because she wants to increase her stock of eggs.

loans.use: buy cartons of eggs

loans.name: Jonas

texts.fr: Jonas a 58 ans. Il vit en union libre et n’a pas d’enfants. Il est propriétaire d’une boutique de produits alimentaires et de bissons gazeuses. Cette activité lui permet de nourrir son foyer et de mettre un peu d’argent sur son compte bancaire pour les cas imprévus. Il demande un crédit pour acheter un stock de spaghetti et de patte de tomates.
texts.en:
Jonas is 58 years old. He lives in free union and has no children.

He owns a shop selling food and soft drinks. This activity enables him him to feed his household and put some money aside in his bank account for unforeseen circumstances.

He requested a loan to buy a supply of spaghetti and tomato paste.

loans.use: buy a supply of pasta and tomato paste

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 38 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Fe works very hard to provide for them.

Fe runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, condiments, home-care products and other groceries.

Fe has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, shampoo, soap, can goods, vinegar, oil, eggs, candies and other groceries. 

In the future, Fe would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, condiments, home-care products and other groceries

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en:
Sokhorn is a 31-year-old married grocer with two children in her care. She resides in the Takeo Province of Cambodia. She has been running her business at a home for over three years. One of her children attends school. Her husband is 31 years old and earns some income from selling recycled things. Sokhorn and her husband can make approximately $22 USD per day. 

Sokhorn would like to request a loan because she needs money to buy more groceries to sell. With this loan, she will be able to buy more groceries and improve her business. In the future, Sokhorn is going to save money to expand her business, build fences around her house, and support her children in completing high school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
El Sr Gustavo estudia la carrera de Ciencia del Deporte, está en el 3 curso, él vive con su sus padres  y le ayuda en su negocio, gracias a su trabajo puede estudiar la carrera que le gusta.
Él es una persona muy responsable que lucha para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Gustavo is studying for a degree in Sport Science and is in his third year. He lives with his parents and helps in their business. Thanks to their work he is able to study for the career he likes.

He is a very responsible person who strives to be able to grow and succeed.

He is requesting this loan so that he can use it to pay for the fees of his degree program, and in this way continue with his studies as has he has been doing.

loans.use: To pay university fees.

loans.name: Andrita

texts.en: Andrita has been into the hog raising business for more than five years. She ventures into this type of business so that she can help her husband in raising their five children. This business gives her an approximate 5,000 PHP of income. But this was made possible by the help of Paglaum MPC where she is one of its members. Recently, she received a loan of 10,500 PHP to purchase bags of animal feeds and vitamins.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Оyguna

texts.ru:
Ойгуна позитивная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она вдова. Она одна воспитывает четырех детей. Она рано вышла на пенсию по болезни. Живёт она в небольшом сельском посёлке. С детства Ойгуна мечтала стать учительницей, но так сложились обстоятельства, что она не смогла получить высшего образования из-за финансовой недостаточности в семье. 
Для того, чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание Ойгуна  занимается животноводством. Ойгуна выращивает скот, затем продаёт полученное от скота мясо и молоко. От этого бизнеса Ойгуна получает хороший доход. Её доход хватает на проживание среднего уровня. И пока у неё недостаточно средств, чтобы покрывать все имеющиеся нужды. В данный момент Ойгуна хочет отремонтировать сарай для скота и запастись кормом для скота на зиму.   Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит. Ойгуна заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, вследствие которой  улучшится качество жизни её семьи.
texts.en:
Oyguna is an optimistic and hard-working woman. She is a widow bringing up four children on her own. Because of health issues, she started receiving a state pension early. She lives in a small village. As a child Oyguna had dreamed to become a teacher, but the circumstances were such that she was not able to attend college due to her family's financial insecurity.

In order to have a reliable source of income, Oyguna raises livestock, and then sells meat and milk. She earns a decent income, sufficient for a modest life. At present she still does not have enough means to cover all the necessary expenses. At present she would like to renovate her cattle shed and stock up fodder for winter. This is why she has applied to Arvand for a loan. Oyguna thanks Arvand in advance for its support, which will lead to an improvement of her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in: a griddle for pupusas [stuffed tortillas], corn, beans, cheese, wire, outlets, florescent lights,  etc. to improve her business.

loans.name: Anne Marie Hollene

texts.fr: Anne Marie est âgée de 55 ans. Elle est veuve et a deux fils. C’est une femme courageuse  et qui a de longues années d’expérience dans le petit commerce. Elle a une épicerie à son domicile, c’est ainsi qu’elle gagne sa vie. Elle a besoin d’un microcrédit pour acheter des sacs de riz et des boites de beurres.
texts.en:
Anne Marie is 55 years old. She is a widow and has two sons. She is a courageous woman who has many years' experience in small retail commerce.

She runs a grocery store from her home, which is how she makes her living. She needs a micro-credit loan to buy sacks of rice and boxes of butter.

loans.use: buy bags of rice and boxes of butter

loans.name: Marimene

texts.fr: Marimene, 42 ans, est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle vend des articles ménagers et des lessives à domicile. Grace à cette activité, elle arrive à gagner des revenus pour faire vivre sa famille. Elle compte développer le commerce pour augmenter ses revenus. Elle est à la recherche d’un financement pour augmenter son stock de savon de lessive et détergente.
texts.en:
42-year-old Marimene is married with three children. She sells houseware products and detergents from her home.

Thanks to this activity, she manages to earn income to support her family. She intends to develop the business to increase her revenues.

She is looking for funding to increase her stock of soap and laundry detergent.

loans.use: increase her stock of laundry detergent and soap

loans.name: Marie Roselene

texts.fr: Marie Roselene âgée de 34 ans, est célibataire et sans enfant. Elle vit avec ses parents a Fontamara dans la maison familiale. Elle revend des produits cosmétiques et divers articles tels que des sous-vêtements, des ustensiles ménagers dans sa boutique. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, elle a recours au crédit. Elle a besoin d'un prêt pour augmenter son stock de sous-vêtements
texts.en:
Marie Roselene is 34 years old, and single without child. She lives with her parents in the family home in Fontamara.

In her shop she sells cosmetics and miscellaneous items such as underwear and household utensils.

In order to strengthen her business she resorts to credit. She needs a loan to increase her stock of underwear.

loans.use: increase her stock of underwear

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara es estudiante de la carrera de derecho cursando el 4to año., ella comenta que espera que cuando reciba su título pueda servir a su comunidad, prestando servicios.
Ella viene de una familia humilde y trabajadora que lucha por sus ideales sin descansar.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios, luchando por sus metas.
texts.en:
Sara is in her 4th year studying for a law degree.  She comments that she hopes that when she receives her degree she can serve her community.  She comes from a humble and hardworking family, and she fights for her ideals tirelessly.

Sara is requesting this loan to pay for her educational expenses.  This way she can continue with her studies and strive toward her goals.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Elisa

texts.fr:
Elisa est un père de famille responsable et consciencieux de 31 ans. Il est marié, et ils ont à charge un enfant de 9 ans et qui est scolarisé.
Les deux époux exercent ensemble l'activité génératrice de revenu de la famille. Il s'agit de vente des vêtements fripes et ceci depuis 2010. En général, Elisa s'occupe de l'approvisionnement et de la vente ambulante des clients tandis que sa femme tient le point de vente fixe. 
Pour pouvoir continuer à développer son activité et renforcer le fonds de roulement, il demande un crédit, et c'est son 4ème prêt  auprès de CEFOR. Les trois prêts étaient remboursés à temps sans aucunes difficultés. En outre, il a pu constituer de l'épargne.
texts.en:
Elisa is a 31-year-old responsible and conscientious father. He is married, and they have one dependent 9-year-old child who attends school.

Since 2010 the couple exercise together the family's revenue-generating activity, which is selling second-hand clothes. In general, Elisa takes care of supplies and itinerant sales, while his wife tends to the shop.

To continue to develop his business and strengthen his working capital, he is requesting a credit loan. This is his fourth loan from CEFOR. The three previous loans were repaid on time without any difficulties. In addition, he was able to build up some savings.

loans.use: buy second-hand skirts and shorts

loans.name: Honorata

texts.en:
Honorata is 66 years old, a widow and has two children of adult age. She lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She owns a cornfield which she has cultivated for seven years. 

Honorata lost hope when her cornfield was stricken by a strong typhoon, and her investment was washed away by the storm. She managed to come back, this time with the assistance of Paglaum MPC. 

Currently, she seeks another loan to start up her corn-production business. The amount of PHP 10,000 will be used to purchase bags of fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Manolita

texts.en:
Meet Manolita. She lives at Intramuros, Manila City, Philippines. Today, she focuses on managing her small buy-and-sell business where she mainly offers ready-to-wear clothes for men and women. She has been in this business for 18 long years. At times, it's hard for her to sustain her income, since customers barely come and buy clothes. But she's really hopeful that she'll be successful with this. 

Today, she asks for your helping hands for the continuation of her inventory. She would like to take a loan worth PHP 10,000 that she will use in buying greater quantities of clothes to sell. If she gains such, it would be an advantage, since people get more attracted when there are more clothes displayed than the usual. 

She really hopes that you can help her with this. She is doing this for her family, and she wants to experience business expansion. Her remaining hope relies in you. So far, she's praying that her family will always stay strong, united and kept in harmony. 

As of today, she's active in attending a weekly fellowship* that enables her to draw strength and inspiration to push towards the goal through the word of God that she studies with her colleagues. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy greater quantities of clothes to sell

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of four children, Josefina works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from vegetable vending. Josefina is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell for her fruit-vending business.

Josefina has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is busy juggling her business and house completion. She is 56 years old, married, has four children of adult age and lives in Katipunan, Dipolog, Zamboanga del Norte. 

She has been into the food-vending business and the retailing of various consumable items for 10 years now. This time, she seeks a loan product of Paglaum MPC in an amount of PHP 10,000 to purchase bags of cement, plywood and nails, and pay labor costs for her house completion.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement, plywood and nails, and pay labor costs for her house completion

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 52 years old, married, has three children of adult age and is from Dipolog-Dapitan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is a fish vendor supported by her fisherman husband. She has been into this type of business for more than 15 years. 

Evangeline hopes to live comfortably with a decent house, so she applied for a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase construction materials like bags of cement, plywood, sticks, nails and other items for house renovation.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials like bags of cement, plywood, sticks, nails and other items for house renovation

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is 36 years old, married, has six children of school age and is a resident from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She has been into a hog-raising business for quite some time that gives her income sufficient enough to send all her children to school. 

She learned about Paglaum MPC and the programs and services it offers to small-time borrowers like her. Recently, she took a loan of PHP 14,900.00 to purchase piglets and bags of animal feeds and vitamins.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and bags of animal feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rhoda is 42 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Rhoda has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Rhoda requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Rhoda has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Rhoda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie would like you to know her full appreciation and thanksgiving because her previous loan has indeed helped her in developing her business. She faithfully repaid an amount of PHP 25,000 which she had used in buying additional gowns for her inventory. 

Again, she is humbly requesting PHP 25,000 which she will utilize to purchase more gowns to sell. Preferably, her customers will likely buy more items if she has more products and designs displayed in her store. 

At some time at the future, she wants to grow her business and eventually have branches. For now, she's working hard to save enough money for her children's education. When they finish studies, it will bring great security for better lives ahead. 

She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more bridal gowns and other like products to sell

loans.name: Nieva

texts.en:
Nieva is 39 years old, married and has five children, three of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Nieva requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice bran and feeds for her pigs.

Nieva has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nieva would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice bran and feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lea is 47 years old and has two children who are in school.

She has a pedicab transport business in the Philippines. Lea requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other supplies for her business.

Lea has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Lea would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other supplies

loans.name: Rodilla

texts.en:
Rodilla is 49 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Rodilla works very hard to provide for them.

Rodilla runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Rodilla has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, coffee, juices, shampoo, soap, medicine, and other groceries. 

In the future, Rodilla would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Olga Michelle

texts.fr:
29 ans, mariée, Olga Michelle est mère de trois enfants âgés de 4 à 12 ans, tous scolarisés dans une école privée. 
Son mari est fabricant-vendeur de cire pour parquet et ciment, quant à Olga Michelle, elle exerce une activité de vente de friperie depuis qu'elle a quitté l'école il y a maintenant environ 10 ans. En outre dès son adolescence, pendant les vacances, elle faisait des petits boulots ou accompagnait et aidait sa mère dans son commerce. C'est une femme qui adore travailler.
Pour pouvoir continuer à développer son activité, augmenter les quantités des articles à proposer et à renforcer son fonds de roulement, elle demande son 4ème prêt chez CEFOR.  Le remboursement des trois autres prêts étaient  très réguliers.
Actuellement,la famille habite dans une maison appartenant à ses parents et elle est en cours d'économiser pour pouvoir construire sa propre maison, elle a déjà acquis un terrain.
texts.en:
29-year-old Olga Michelle is the married mother of three children aged 4 to 12 years, all enrolled in a private school. Her husband is a manufacturer and seller of floor wax and cement.

As for Olga Michelle, she has a business selling used clothes since she left school about 10 years ago. As a teenager during the holidays, she also held odd jobs or accompanied and assisted her mother in her business. This is a woman who loves to work.

To continue to develop her business, increase the quantity of items to offer and strengthen her working capital, she is requesting her fourth loan from CEFOR. The repayment of the other three loans was correctly done.

Currently, the family lives in a house belonging to her parents. She is currently saving to build her own house, for which she has already acquired a plot of land.

loans.use: buy jackets at 400,000 ariary (MGA) and blankets at 1,000,000 ariary

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 41 years old, married and has six children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business of farming vegetables in the Philippines. Nora requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nora has been farming vegetables for 10 years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional seeds, fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 49 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Susan is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Susan has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Virgilia is 55 years old now.

Virgilia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Virgilia requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishnets and other fishing supplies.

Virgilia has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Virgilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishnets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 29 years old and a married woman. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Estela has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Estela requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Estela has been in this business for five years. In the future, Estela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia became an entrepreneur eight years ago. She currently sells plastic wares. She started only with a small amount of capital in buying her first products. But because of her steadfast determination, she has now earned the trust of her customers. Although there are times that she struggles when there are delayed payments, she still works hard because she believes that such situations are an inevitable part of handling a business.

She is 55 years old and has only one kid. She sells different kinds of products like plastic pitchers, strainers, hangers, etc. The profit she gets from the business becomes a great help for their family, basically in terms of their daily expenses. 

Lydia is a typical mother with a typical dream. She just wants to expand her business and earn enough, for there is nothing more that she hopes, aside from her child to gain a better quality of education and then have a college degree. 

It's the reason why she wants to further improve her resources. If you would allow it, she wants to ask for an 8,000 PHP loan, which she will use for buying more plastic products to sell. With this loan, she can surely gain more income, and part of what she will gain, she will save for future investments, and part will be used for their everyday living.  

You’ll be a great blessing in advance. Thanks for your heartfelt generosity and goodness. 

Lydia meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more plastic products to sell.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Computers at the present time are used by all ages. Children at least 4 years old already know how to access it. By any means, a computer nowadays is a necessity in every field of industry. It could be work-related or just for entertainment. That’s why Remedios, one of the CCT partners, came up on an idea to put up her own computer shop.

One of her greatest dreams is to have her personal properties, and most importantly, she is striving to have her son graduate from college. Remedios knows that a business like this needs to keep pace with the flow of innovation. That’s why she applied for a loan last year amounting to PHP 10,000 that really helped her in the business. This year, the number of computers that she has can’t accommodate all the customers; she decided to apply for another loan of PHP 10,000 to expand the shop.

Despite being busy managing the computer shop, Remedios still is consistent in attending CCT group fellowships that consist of 10-15 individuals. This is where she can gain strength spiritually and where she hears testimonies from other CCT partners and is able to hear God’s word.

loans.use: to pay for a new PC for her Internet shop.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria estudia la carrera de Contaduría Publica, cursando el cuarto año de la Universidad, es una persona muy responsable, honesta y trabajadora estudia y trabaja para salir adelante y solventar los gastos de su familia.
Maria está estudiando para poder crecer y salir adelante para dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan para una mejor calidad de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y cubrir ese gasto que tiene para continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Maria is studying for a Public Accounting degree and is in her fourth year at university.  She is a very responsible, honest, hard-working person who studies and works to get ahead and take care of family expenses.

Maria is studying to be able to grow and prosper to give her family everything they need for a better quality of life.  She is requesting this loan to pay for her education and cover related expenses so she can continue.

loans.use: To pay university fees.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 45 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Helen is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Helen has been in this business for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Sonali

texts.en:
In 2010, Sonali started Mela Artisans to support under-employed artisans in India and promote their craftsmanship globally. Mela works closely with artisans who create high-quality products, promoting social uplift in their communities. 

Sonali had traveled frequently to India as a child to visit her grandmother, volunteer, and explore the country. She was amazed by the the sheer number of regional crafts, which were unique and beautiful but the artisans who made them were struggling. No longer able to earn a living wage because of the lack of local markets for their work, an increasing number of master craftsmen were being forced to give up their craft in exchange for a life of abject poverty as unskilled workers just to survive. These concerns became a call to action, leading to a collaboration between father and daughter. 

At 23, Sonali started the venture, Mela Artisans. After having studied human rights and traveled extensively in India, she felt that she needed to do something to make a change. Working in the social sector, she saw that a business was the solution. That’s why she focused on connecting markets, thereby making the artisans themselves self-sufficient. Since 2012, Sonali has placed orders with more 50 artisans groups across 10 states, and more than three-fourths are with women. Sonali hopes that this with loan, they can further their reach and support more artisans by expanding their current product line to include embroidered pillows. This will require additional training and new materials which will be covered by this loan.

loans.use: Expanding the current line of artisan products to include embroidered pillows and increase jobs for artisans in India.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay university fees.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is a single woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Riza is 30 years old, and one child is still in school.

Riza has a buying and selling of used clothes business in the Philippines. Riza requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more boxes of used clothes to sell.

Riza has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of three children, Cecelia works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Cecelia is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Cecelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
37-year-old Mary Jane earns a living by making and selling native baskets made of buli (palm). She is a married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 18, and the youngest is 3. In addition, she also runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various goods like noodles, condiments, toothpaste, soap, sugar, cooking oil, canned goods, and toiletries. Her husband has an income by being a carpenter.

She has requested a loan to buy materials like buli (palm), wicker (pliable twigs), and stocks for the store. The presence of these materials could help boost Mary Jane's sources of income and enable her to augment her daily earnings. Thus, she could provide her family with a proper diet and other basic needs, like quality education.

She is grateful for utilizing the funds that could help her sustain her livelihood, and she is determined to manage it properly for sustainable living.

loans.use: to buy materials like buli (palm), wicker (pliable twigs), and stocks for the store.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is a 62-year-old married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Dolores has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Dolores has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 44 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal product care, and other groceries.

Edna has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from buying and selling peanut butter.

She aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal product care, and other groceries.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 45 years old and single. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pig.

Jessica has been in this business for five years now, and she has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 31 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Corazon works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, junk food, home product care, and other groceries.

Corazon has been in this business for three years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, junk food, home product care, and other groceries.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 61 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, etc.

Evelyn has been in this business for five years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Herminio

texts.es:
Herminio está estudiando la carrera de radiología, por medio de su carrera quiere abrirse camino para poder ser un profesional útil a la sociedad.
Él es una persona que pone todo de sí para poder cumplir con sus metas y anhelos, y de esa forma también ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Herminio is studying toward a radiology degree.  Through his education he wants to become a useful professional in society.  He does all he can to meet his goals and dreams as well as help his family.

The loan he is requesting is to pay education fees.  He is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: To pay university fees.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia está estudiando para ser Licenciada en Ciencias de la Educación, su meta después de graduarse es la de ejercer su profesión para poder ayudar a las demás personas y a si mismo.
Pide este préstamo porque necesita pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
Leticia is studying toward an educational sciences degree.  Her goal is to graduate and exercise her professional to help other people and herself.

She is requesting this loan to pay education fees so she can continue her studies.  She is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: To pay university fees.

loans.name: Cinthia

texts.es:
Cinthia es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, esta estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, es una mujer muy sacrificada, que esta poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ser una profesional excelente que ayude a las demás personas.
Comenta que estudia mucho para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y ayudar a su familia. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de sus útiles de universidad, y de esa forma poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en: Cinthia is from the city of Curuguaty. She is studying business administration. She is a very selfless woman who is putting forth her best effort to be an excellent professional who helps other people. She says that she studies a lot in order to be able to improve her living conditions and help her family. She requests this loan to invest in buying university supplies, and in that way be able to cover that expense that she has.

loans.use: to buy university supplies.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra viene de una familia del campo muy trabajadora, su madre es la que en todo momento la apoya, está estudiando la licenciatura en administración de empresas, y su  meta es culminar su carrera y es una gran profesional, seguir estudiando especializándose.
Pone todo lo mejor de sí para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder proseguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Sandra comes from a hard-working rural family.  Her mother is the one who supports her at all times.  She is studying toward a business administration degree and her goal is to finish her education and become a grand professional while continuing her specialization.

She puts all the best of herself into growing and prospering.

The loan she is requesting is to pay university fees so she can continue with her education as she has until now.

loans.use: To pay university fees.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is a 38-year-old married woman with seven children, five of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Glenda has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Glenda has been in this business for nine years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family.

She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc.

Anabelle has been in this business for 15 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is 34 years old and married with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Lita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, biscuits, home product care, and other groceries.

Lita has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, biscuits, home product care, and other groceries.

loans.name: Gwendolyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Gwendolyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store. Gwendolyn is borrowing 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell like shirts, underwear, etc., for her buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business.

Gwendolyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shirts, underwear, etc., for her buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 55 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school, Sally works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Sally has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Sally would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 30 years old and married with three children.

She is in an agricultural business, raising a pig in the Philippines. Gina is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pig.

Gina has been in this business for five years and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Melinda works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. Melinda is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy garments and other materials needed for her tailoring business.

Melinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy garments and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Merlita is 50 years old and three of her children are still in school.

Merlita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers.

Merlita has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 54 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Susan has been in this business for four years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 35 years old and has three children. She is married and two of her children who are in school.

Milagros is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Milagros requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Milagros has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Milagros would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Sinan's Group

texts.en: A local farmer living in the Sandan district of Kampong Thom province, Sinan is 55 years old and a married mother of three dependent children, two of whom are in school and need better support for their studies. Growing rice has been her main business for 10 years already. She sometimes works for others for a fee to earn additional income. As the crop prices have declined, she can earn only about 21,500 KHR per day. To save her business, she leads a group of two members to apply for a new loan. This is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and the previous one, which has enabled her to improve living standard and support her children’s studies, was repaid successfully. This time, Sinan, the group leader, will use her loan to buy a decent latrine for her family members so that they can live healthily. She hopes that all family members stay healthy and are protected from infectious diseases.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine for her family members so that they can live healthily.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru:
Махбуба трудолюбивая и жизнерадостная женщина 45 лет. Она замужем и имеет 4 детей. У неё высшее образование. Она работает учительницей в средней школы №14. На работе её все уважают, дома дети любят и ценят её труд . Она человек  целеустремленны добрый , отзывчивый  и  любит всегда  помогать людям.
Сейчас Махбуба собирается женить своего сына. Она готовиться к свадебному мероприятию. Для этого нужно купить очень много вещей для приданного. Но у Махбубы не хватает денежных средств, которые она накопила для свадьбы. Поэтому она обратилась  в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку приданного для свадьбы.  Махбуба очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку
texts.en:
Mahbuba, age 45, is a hardworking woman with a positive attitude in life.  She is married and the mother of four children.  She has a college education and she works as a teacher in secondary school No. 14.  Everyone respects her at work. At home, her children love her and value her work.  She is a kind, sympathetic and determined person who always likes to help others.

At the moment, Mahbuba is planning her son's wedding and is preparing the wedding ceremony.  In preparation of the event, she needs to buy many things for the dower (the gift given by the groom to the bride).  But although she has started to save some money for her son's wedding, Mahbuba still doesn't have enough.  For this reason, she has turned to MDO Arvand and taken a loan to complete her son's dower.  She is looking forward to a positive outcome and she thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to pay for her son's wedding.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.ru:
Нигора позитивная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и имеет двоих детей. Живёт она в небольшом сельском посёлке. С детства Нигора мечтала стать учительницей, но так сложились обстоятельства, что она не смогла получить высшего образования из-за финансовой недостаточности в семье. Сразу после окончания средней школы Нигору выдали замуж. И так она стала домохозяйкой. Но, даже находясь постоянно  дома,  Нигора никогда не сидит без дела. Она вместе с мужем стараются делать всё возможное, чтобы обеспечивать своих детей всем необходимым.
Для того, чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание Нигора вместе со своим мужем начали свой бизнес. Они занимаются животноводством. Нигора выращивает скот, затем продаёт полученное от скота мясо и молоко. От этого бизнеса Нигора получает хороший доход. Муж Нигоры также работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Его работа приносит дополнительный доход в семью. Их совместного дохода хватает на проживание среднего уровня. И пока у них недостаточно средств, чтобы покрывать все имеющиеся нужды. В данный момент Нигора с мужем хотят купить ещё несколько голов скота для откармливания. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку скота. Нигора заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, вследствие которой  улучшится качество жизни её семьи.
texts.en:
Nigora is a positive and hard-working woman. She is married and has two children. She lives in a small rural village. Since her childhood, Nigora has dreamed of becoming a teacher, but due to the way circumstances turned out, she was unable to get a university education because her family didn't have the finances. Immediately after graduating secondary school, Nigora got married, and so she became a housewife. However, even though she's constantly at home, Nigora is never idle. She and her husband try to do everything possible to provide their children with all they require. 

In order to have a steady stream of income for their sustenance, Nigora and her husband began their own business. They practice animal husbandry. Nigora raises livestock, and then sells the meat and milk she gets from the livestock. Nigora gets a good profit from this business. Nigora's husband also works on a farm. His work brings in additional income for the family. Their combined incomes are enough to afford an average residence. Meanwhile, they do not have the money to cover all their needs. At the moment, Nigora and her husband want to buy a few more head of livestock to fatten up. Therefore, they have applied to MDO Arvand and want to take out a loan for the purchase of the livestock. Nigora thanks MDO Arvand in advance for their support, thanks to which her family's quality of life has risen.

loans.use: to buy some livestock.

loans.name: Paola

texts.es:
Paola está estudiando el tercer año de contabilidad,  por medio de su carrera quiere abrirse camino para ser un buen profesional.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar sus útiles de universidad, para poder seguir con sus estudios.
Paola pone todo de sí para poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Paola is studying her third year of accounting. She wants this degree to open doors so that she can be a good professional.

Paola is applying for this loan in order to buy equipment for university and to continue with her studies.

Paola puts in everything that she has in order to be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Nathalia

texts.es:
Nathalia vive con sus padres  y  su hermana , comenta que su madre es modista de alta costura y tiene una boutique, y su padre trabaja en la venta de comidas.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de arquitectura, y está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar los gastos de su tesis, y de esa forma poder cubrir el gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Nathalia lives with her parents and sister. She says her mother is a seamstress and has a boutique. Her father works selling meals.

Nathalia is studying for a degree in architecture. She is putting in her biggest effort in order to be someone in life.

Nathalia is applying for this loan in order to cover dissertation costs.

loans.use: to pay dissertation costs.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es:
