Adrian es estudiante de la carrera de Zootecnia, está cursando ya su último año, a la vez que estudia trabaja de forma independiente con un establecimientos ganadero.
Él está esforzándose para poner en práctica todo lo que aprendió, y de esa forma abrirse camino en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir su gasto de tesis y comprar otros materiales que tiene.
texts.en:
Adrian is studying to be a zoo technician. He is now in his first year. Alongside his studies, Adrian is working independently at a cattle business.

Adrian is working hard in order to put into practice all that he has learned, and to open doors for himself in life.

He is applying for this loan in order to pay dissertation expenses and to buy other materials..

loans.use: to pay dissertation expenses and to buy other materials.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, sugar, oils and more in order to make "bollos".

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Algunas zonas de Nicaragua no cuentan sistemas de alcantarillado, por ello MiCrédito ofrece un paquete de financiamientos para ayudarles a esas familias a mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Por esta razón, Paula solicita un crédito para construir un servicio higiénico, que le brindará mejores condiciones higiénicas en su hogar.

Ella se dedica a la elaboración de ropa desde hace más de 20 años, esto le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus 5 hijos y por ello quiere mejorar su vivienda dándole todas las condiciones higiénicas posibles. También, planea abrir un taller para ampliar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Some areas of Nicaragua do not have sewage systems. MiCrédito offers a financing package to help families to improve their living conditions.

Paula is therefore applying for a loan in order to install a lavatory, which will provide more hygienic conditions in her home.

Paula has been making a living producing clothes for more than 20 years. This has allowed her to help her five children to move forward and she wants to improve her home and provide the best possible hygiene conditions. Paula also plans to open a workshop to increase her income.

loans.use: to install a lavatory.

loans.name: Carmen Liseth

texts.es:
Algunas zonas de Nicaragua no cuentan sistemas de alcantarillado, por ello MiCrédito ofrece un paquete de financiamientos para ayudarles a esas familias a mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Por esta razón, Carmen solicita un crédito para construir un servicio higiénico, que le brindará mejores condiciones higiénicas en su hogar.

Carmen es una mujer multifacética y emprendedora, porque es ingeniera agrónoma de profesión y aun si tiene una comidería a las afueras de una fábrica, para así incrementar los ingresos económicos de su familia. Ella planea continuar invirtiendo en su negocio y ofrecerle las mejores condiciones de vida a sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Some parts of Nicaragua do not have sewage systems, therefore MiCrédito is offering financial packages to help families there to improve their living conditions. This is why Carmen is asking for a loan to build toilet facilities, which will provide better sanitary conditions in her home.

Carmen is an enterprising woman of many talents, because she is an professional agronomist but also has an eatery outside a factory so that she can increase her family's income. She plans to keep investing in her business and give her three children better living conditions.

loans.use: to build toilet facilities.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Rosaura aprendió comenzó a trabajar desde muy joven,  las necesidades económicas de su familia la obligaron a aprender costura aun cuando era adolescente, sin embargo, gracias a esto ha podido generar buenos ingresos económicos para su hogar, ya que se dedica a la confección y elaboración de vestidos de niñas por encargo, en varias zonas del país. 

Por ello, solicita un crédito para comprar telas, hilos, botones, encajes, zippers, cintas. Esto le será de ayuda porque podrá incrementar la producción de vestidos y en consiguiente aumentarán sus ingresos. Cabe destacar que, Rosaura planea  establecer lazos con personas fuera del país para abrirse mercado.
texts.en:
Rosaura learned to start working from a very young age, the economic necessities of her family obliged her to learn sewing when she was an adolescent. 
However, thanks to this she has learned to be able to generate income for his home, now she earns a living from dressmaking and making girls clothes for order, in various parts of the country. 

This is why she is asking for a loan to buy clothing, threads, buttons, lace, zippers and belts. It will be of help to her because she will be able to increase her production of clothes and consequently she will increase her income. It should be noted that, Rosaura plans to make ties with people outside the country to open up her market.

loans.use: to buy clothing, threads, buttons, lace, zippers and belts

loans.name: Jerson

texts.en:
Jerson is 48 years old, a widower with 4 school-age children and one adult child. 

He has been a rice grower for more than 10 years since he acquired the rice field he works on. He doubles his time as a father and farmer so that he can fulfill his duty as parent and provider. 

Jerson is thankful for the financial assistance of Paglaum MPC because he can avail himself of various loan products and insurances. This time, he is availing himself of another loan of PHP 10,500 to purchase bags of fertilizers and pesticides for rice field.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and pesticides for rice field.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an industrial oven and bakery supplies to give her son a better quality of life

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Nelia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Nelia is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production and vending business.

Nelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Sonia Raquel

texts.es:
Algunas zonas de Nicaragua no cuentan sistemas de alcantarillado, por ello MiCrédito ofrece un paquete de financiamientos para ayudarles a esas familias a mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Por esta razón, Sonia solicita un crédito para construir un servicio higiénico, que le brindará mejores condiciones higiénicas en su hogar.

Sonia estudio un curso técnico de secretariado cuando era adolescente, por ello comenzó a trabajar en esa área desde temprana edad; ella confiesa que gracias a esto pudo sacar a delante a sus hijos que en la actualidad son profesionales. Sandra planea continuar mejorando su vivienda y esperar su jubilación para descansar luego de una larga vida de trabajo.
texts.en:
Some parts of Nicaragua don't have sewage systems, therefore MiCredito is offering a number of loans to help these families to improve their living conditions. 
For this reason, Sonia is asking for a loan to build a hygienic sewage system, which will provide better health conditions to her home. 

Sonia studied a technical secretarial course when she was an adolescent, therefore she started working in this area from an early age. She admits that thanks to this she was able to help her children who are now professionals. 

Sandra plans to continue improving her home and is waiting to retire so she can rest after a long life of work.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet

loans.name: Ludivica

texts.en:
Ludivica is 46 years old and married with seven children. With three children in school, Ludivica works very hard to provide for them.

Ludivica runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, rice, home care products and other groceries.

Ludivica has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, beverages, shampoo, soap, eggs, oil, vinegar, and other groceries. 

In the future, Ludivica would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, rice, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a married woman. She is 47 years old and has nine children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Cynthia has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. Cynthia requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables like cabbage, carrots, potato, squash and etc to sell in the market.

Cynthia has been in this business for 7 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables like cabbage, carrots, potato, squash to sell in the market.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 60 years old, a widow, has one child and lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is in a business buying and selling various items like consumable goods, canned goods, dried fish, vegetables and spices and others. This business gives her enough profit which enables her to provide for her family's needs, knowing that she is already a widow. 

Edna is thankful for the financial services extended by Paglaum MPC to small time borrowers like her. This time, she is availing herself of a PHP 10,000 loan to purchase bags of cement, nails, plywood and sticks for house renovation. Edna hopes to live comfortably with her only child and her grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement, nails, plywood and sticks for house renovation.

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
Anselma is 42 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Anselma works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoo, chips, etc to sell.

Anselma has been in this business for one year.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoo and chips to sell.

loans.name: Ey's Group

texts.en:
Ey is 58 years old and a farmer living in Sandan district of Kampong Thom province. She is a married mother of nine children, three of whom are dependent on her. One of her children is in school and needs her to support the studies. 

She grows cassava and paddy rice as her main sources of income. Additionally, she is working as a paid worker to earn extra income. Her 12-year-old-farming business earns her only about 25,000 KHR per day as the crop has not been fertilized well and can only be sold at lower price in the market. 

Ey is leading a group of six members to request a loan. This will be her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As a group leader, she will use her loan to buy a decent latrine to keep all family members healthy. She hopes to live in safe and hygiene environment which will reduce cost of health services.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine to keep all family members healthy.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
La señora Wilma vive en casa de propiedad de su madre, ella es quien se encarga de la atención y cuidado de su madre, además es madre de tres años, es madre soltera y su padre desapareció y nunca se casó actualmente solo cuenta con el servicio de luz y agua potable, el sistema de alcantarillado no está instalado en su zona, se dedica a la elaboración de bordados de prenda de vestir con distintos logos y diseños en empastados de polleras, vestidos folclóricos y algunas otras prendas de vestir.
La señora Wilma también cuenta con una maquina artesanal realizadas por ella misma la cual le sirve para estirar la tela y pasar capas de pintura a sus costuras dando un acabado único, debido a la calidad de su trabajo es conocida en la zona donde vive y sus limitaciones está en poder atender los pedidos y expandir su producción es por ello que la señora Wilma necesita el préstamo para poder ampliar su negocio y de esta manera poder generar mayores ingresos que beneficiaran a su familia.
texts.en:
Wilma lives in her mother's house. She is responsible for the care and attention of her mother, as well as being a mother of three young children. She is a single parent, the children's father disappeared and they were never married. At the moment she only has lights and drinking water, a sewage system is not in place in her area.

She earns a living by making embroidery for items of clothing with different logos and designs on the stitching for 'polleras' (traditional skirts), folk dresses and other garments.

Wilma also has a machine she made herself which helps to stretch the fabric and put coats of paint on her needlework which gives it a unique finish. Due to the quality of her work she is well-known in the area where she lives and she is limited in being able to fill orders and extend her production. This is why Wilma needs a loan so that she can expand her business and generate more income to benefit her family.

loans.use: to buy embroidery equipment to improve her sales.

loans.name: Janela

texts.en:
Janela is 53 years old and married with six children.

She is in an agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Janela is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Janela has been in this business for 20 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Nelly is 30 years old and has five children who are in school.

Nelly has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Nelly requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Nelly has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Nelly would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Carmencia

texts.es: La señora Carmencia vive en Entre Rios, Cochabamba en casa de sus padres porque sus ingresos no le permitieron tener su casa propia, migro del departamento de Oruro hacia el trópico para buscar mejores condiciones de vida, cuando llego aquí con su familia no tenían ningún inmueble por eso trabajaron muy duro para adquirir su lote agrícola, este sacrificio conjunto dio como resultado la compra del lote, después cada uno de los integrantes de su familia decidieron cultivar una pequeña parte del terreno es así que la señora Carmencia también decidió trabajar en una pequeña superficie pero debido a la cantidad enorme de las malezas así como el ataque de plagas que cada vez fue más difícil controlar, los rendimientos de su cultivo redujeron un poco, la señora necesita un préstamo para ampliar su plantación de yuca, porque de esta manera tendrá mejores ingresos con los cuales podrá comprarse una vivienda propia y vivir más cómodamente.
texts.en:
Carmencia lives in Entre Ríos, in the Cochabamba Department. She lives with her parents because she doesn't earn enough to have her own home. She migrated from the Oruro Department in the tropical region in order to find better living conditions, and when she arrived with her family they had no home and worked very hard to be able to acquire their plot of agricultural land. 

They all sacrificed in order to be able to purchase the land, and each member of the family decided to cultivate a part of it. Carmencia also decided to work a section of the land, but, owing to the enormous number of weeds and pests that are increasingly difficult to eradicate, her earnings were reduced. 

She has requested a loan in order to expand her yuca plantation, which will provide her with better earnings so that she can buy her own home and live more comfortably.

loans.use: to expand her yuca plantation, in order to buy her own home with the increased earnings.

loans.name: Victoria Rossana

texts.es:
Victoria es una mujer de 47 años de edad, divorciada, tiene un hijo de 11 años, y su negocio es la venta de dulces y comida.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, decidida, fuerte, luchadora, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en un colegio de la ciudad, caracterizada por encontrarse en el centro de la ciudad al lado de restaurantes, oficinas, empresas y todo tipo de comercio, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre -4/12 grados centígrados.
Victoria es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hijo que estudia en la misma escuela donde ella trabaja, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de dulce y comida; ella cuenta con un anaquel tipo snack dónde oferta golosinas, dulces, galletas, etc., y vende sándwiches de huevo, carnes frías, etc., este puesto de venta se encuentra dentro de las instalaciones de una escuela muy popular y conocida, “empecé vendiendo dulces, luego vendí comida, ahora necesito incrementar la mercadería…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de mercadería. Su sueño es incrementar sus ingresos, ella desea realizar la compra de golosinas por mayor para abastecer su puesto de venta. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Victoria solicita un préstamo para la compra de golosinas por mayor para abastecer su puesto de venta y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Victoria, aged 47, is divorced and has an 11-year-old son. She works selling candy and food. She is a good mother, enterprising, determined, strong, responsible and hard-working. Her business is located in a school in the centre of the city, and is surrounded by restaurants, offices, businesses and all kinds of stores. The climate is cold and dry, and the average daily temperature is between -4 and 12 degrees Celsius.

Victoria has a dark complexion, brown eyes, long black hair which she wears in a braid, and wears traditional clothing (hat, blanket and skirt). Her mother tongue is Aymará, which she uses with her family, and she also speaks Spanish for everyday use and to conduct business. Her son goes to the same school where her shop is located, and they live in a rented home built of bricks and cement, with a tin roof and a wooden floor. It has water, electricity, gas and sewerage. 

She works selling candy and food. She has a snack stall selling candy and cookies, etc., and sells sandwiches with egg, cold meats, etc. The stall is located in a popular and well-known school.  “I started selling candy, then I sold food, and now I need to increase my stock" she says. Her dream is to improve her earnings, and for that she would like to buy candy in bulk to stock her stall. This is her first loan cycle with the foundation since she began her business three years ago. 

Victoria is requesting a loan to be able to buy candy in bulk to stock her stall and improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy candy in bulk for her stall and improve her earnings.

loans.name: Pamela Elisa

texts.es: Pamela es una joven universitaria de 22 años. Actualmente se encuentra cursando el octavo ciclo de su carrera de enfermería. Ella decidió estudiar esta carrera porque le gusta ayudar a las personas y a cuidarlos. Comente que ya se encuentra trabajando en una posta médica. Además de ser una joven muy aplicada en sus ratos libre le gusta salir con sus amigas a jugar vóley. Ella solicito el préstamo para poder pagar sus pensiones de la universidad- ya se encuentra a un año de terminar sus estudios. Se siente muy agradecida con las personas de Babyloan por creer en ella.
texts.en:
Pamela, aged 22,  is a young university student. She is currently in her eighth semester of a nursing degree. She chose to study nursing because she likes helping people and caring for them, and she is already working in a medical post. 

As well as being hard-working and studious, in her free time she likes to play volleyball with her friends. She is requesting a loan to pay her university fees, as she has one year left to complete her studies. She is very grateful to Babyloan for believing in her.

loans.use: to pay for university costs.

loans.name: Pierina De Los Angeles

texts.es: Pierina es una joven universitaria de 19 años de edad. Actualmente se encuentra cursando el quinto ciclo de la carrera de Ingeniería de Sistema e Informática. Ella decidió estudiar esta carrera por que le encanta analizar los efectos de la globalización y la informática en la vida cotidiana de las personas. Comenta que quiere especializarse en Diseño y construcción de redes de computadoras. Ademas de ser una joven muy aplicada en sus ratos libres juega voley con sus amigas. Ella solicito el préstamo para poder pagar sus pensiones de la universidad. ya se encuentra a dos años de terminar sus estudios
texts.en:
Pierina is a young university student of 19 years old. She is currently in her fifth semester of a degree in Systems and Computer Engineering. She decided to study this degree as she loves analysing the effects of globalisation and information technology on people's daily lives. She says that she would like to specialise in the design and construction of computer networks. 

As well as being a very hard-working young woman, she plays volleyball with her friends in her spare time. She is requesting a loan so that she can pay for her university fees; she is now two years away from finishing her studies.

loans.use: to pay for her university fees.

loans.name: Bilma

texts.es:
Bilma es una mujer de 32 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 7, 10 y 14 años y una hija de 12 años, y su negocio es la fabricación de porta documentos.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, decidida, comprometida, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en la zona ‘16 de julio’ área central situada al este de la ciudad, reúne a gran parte de los edificios administrativos, comerciales y sedes de organizaciones sociales. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Bilma es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al mismo negocio, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la fabricación de porta documentos, los porta documentos son accesorios que se utilizan para cubrir o forrar los documentos, como; carnet de identidad, pasaporte, brevete de chofer, etc., actividad que fabrica en su domicilio para comercializarlo de forma ambulante en diferentes ferias y comercios de la ciudad, “iniciamos el negocio con mi esposo fabricando folders para archivador tamaño oficio y carta, mi esposo fabricó la máquina para sellar los bordes…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que no cuenta con competencia, la desventaja es que no es un producto muy requerido pero tiene temporadas altas. Su sueño es incrementar sus productos para la temporada de inicio de clases en universidades, ella desea realizar la compra de materiales plásticos y pegamento para la fabricación de porta documentos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Bilma solicita un préstamo para la compra plásticos y pegamento para la fabricación de porta documentos para el inicio de clases universitarias.
texts.en:
Bilma, aged 32, lives with her partner and has three sons, aged 7, 10 and 14 and a daughter, aged 12. She works making document covers.

She is a good mother, enterprising, determined, committed, reliable, responsible and very hard-working. She is a street vendor in the central '16 de julio'  area on the eastern side of the city, where many of the administrative and commercial buildings are located, as well as the seats of social organizations. The climate is cold and dry, and the average daily temperature is between zero and 12 degrees centigrade.

Bilma has a dark complexion, brown eyes, long black hair worn in a braid, and a robust physique. She dresses traditionally (hat, blanket and skirt), and her mother tongue is Aymará which she speaks with her family. She also speaks Spanish for everyday use and in her business. Her husband works in the same business, and they live in a home built of bricks and cement with a tin roof and a wooden floor. It has water, electricity, gas and sewerage. 

She works making document folders, which are used to hold or cover documents such as identity cards, passports, driver's licenses, etc. She works itinerantly, visiting the different fairs and business in the city. “My husband and I began the business making folders for files in legal and letter size, and my husband made the machine for sealing the edges" she says. The advantage of her business is that she has no competition, but the disadvantage is that it is not a product much in demand, although it has its peak seasons. Her dream is to increase her stock of products for when school and university classes begin, and wants to buy the plastic materials and glue necessary to make document covers. 

This is the first loan cycle that Bilma has requested in the ten years that she has been running her business. She is requesting the loan to buy the necessary plastic materials and glue for making document covers.

loans.use: to buy plastic and glue to make document covers for when university classes begin.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario es una mujer de 38 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 13 años, y su negocio es la venta de artículos de primera necesidad en su  tienda de barrio. El préstamo que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de panetones para su negocio por temporada de navidad. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque no tuvo problemas. 
Rosario es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja en el transporte y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Actualmente su negocio funciona correctamente, las ventas son diarias y los horarios de atención bastante flexibles, “trabajo arduamente en mi negocio, atiendo a mis clientes con amabilidad porque deseo continuar por varios años con mi actividad…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para reabastecer de forma constante los víveres de su negocio. Su sueño es que su negocio crezca, ella desea realizar la compra de artículos y alimentos de primera necesidad como; azúcar, arroz, aceite, fideo, etc., para abastecer los anaqueles de su negocio. Este préstamo es su 2 secuencia dentro de la institución en 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Rosario solicita un préstamo para la compra de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad para abastecer su tienda de barrio para ayudar con los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Rosario is a 38-year-old woman, with 2 children aged 8 and 13. Her business is selling staple goods in her neighbourhood convenience store. She invested her previous loan in buying stock of panettone for her store during the Christmas season. She paid her fees on time as she had no problems.

Rosario has a dark complexion, brown eyes, long black hair which she ties up, short stature and a robust physique. Her mother tongue is Aymará which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish in general culture and to do business.

She shares her life with her partner who works in transport and with their children who study in school. They live in a rented room built with bricks and mortar, with a corrugated iron roof and wooden floor. They have drinking water, electricity, gas and sewerage. 

At the moment her business is running correctly, she makes sales every day and her business hours are quite flexible. "I work arduously in my business. I attend to my clients with kindness as I want to keep doing this job for many years..." she says. 

The advantage of her business is that she has sales every day. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to keep restocking her business supplies. Her dream is to grow her business. She hopes to be able to buy staple items and food such as: sugar, rice, oil, noodles etc. to stock the shelves of her business. This loan is her second loan sequence with the institution in 5 years that she is using for this business.

It is for these reasons that Rosario is asking for a loan to buy food and staple items to stock her neighbourhood convenience store to help with her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy convenience food and staple items to stock her small neighbourhood store.

loans.name: Prince

texts.en:
Prince is 24 years old, married and supports a family of one children. He has been operating in motorcycle spare parts supply in the area for the last 16 years earning KES.25,000 per month. 

Prince has applied for his first loan of KES.25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply in the area of business for more income gain. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to improve his life and business. His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply in the area of business for more income gain.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is managing a small store in their village. She is 40 years old, married and had two children. Her spouse is a tricycle driver. They both earn income for family's sustenance. 

She is planning to increase merchandise to sell that is why she is asking for additional capital of P15,000 to buy grocery items (canned goods, breads, eggs, soft drinks and biscuits) to sell. This will help increase capacity of sales in her business. She will save additional revenue for education purposes.

loans.use: to buy grocery items (canned goods, breads, eggs, softdrinks and biscuits) to sell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is aged 42 years, married to Simion and she supports three children.She has been selling sugarcane in the market for the last 20 years and the business earns her KES 5,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops so as to get a better harvest for family use and sell the surplus in the market.  

She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to enable her supply more litres of milk daily to clients. Her hope is to expand her agricultural sector and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops so as to get a better harvest for family use and sell the surplus in the market.

loans.name: Jailly

texts.en:
Jailly is 39 years old and married with four children. With four children in school, Jailly works very hard to provide for them.

Jailly runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like spices, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Jailly has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Jailly would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like spices, beverages, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
She is Lourdes, 46 y/o, from General Trias, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Jony, a seaman and has a small general store and a food stall not only to make her busy but also to augment their income to provide for her two children who is in College and Elementary respectively. She is seen on her photo with her food stall.

Even before her husband worked as a seaman, Lourdes has been operating her general store for fifteen years already. And recently she added a food stall just across her store. It has been a great help support her husband in earning a living. She buys from wholesaler essential food items such as canned goods, coffee, biscuits, beverages, toiletries and sells them at retail price. She also prepares dishes for working people who wants to buy cooked food either to eat at her stall or take them home to their families to save time and money especially for a family of two or three members only. 

Lourdes would like to request for a Php 50000 loan to buy large quantities of grocery items to add to her store and buy ingredients like chicken, pork, veggies, seasonings, gas needed to cook dishes for her food stall. She believes it will help grow her business  and thus meet their daily needs and assist her children's schooling.

She dreams that someday her small eatery could grow into a restaurant. She wants both her children to finish college.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for groceries like canned goods, instant noodles, coffee, eggs, beverages for her store and cooking ingredients as well needed for her food stall.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 60 years old and has seven children.  Josefina is widowed and has one child still in school.

Josefina is in the agricultural business, farming vegetable in the Philippines. Josefina requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Josefina has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina is 35 years old and married with two children. Both of whom are in school, Rina works very hard to provide for them.

Rina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Rina has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Rina would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Florenda is 28 years old and has two children who are in school.

Florenda has a food vending business in the Philippines. Florenda requested a PHP 6500 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Florenda has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Florenda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Ma. Lita

texts.en:
Ma. Lita is 52 years old, married with four children, one of whom in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, chips, noodles, spices, etc.

Ma. Lita has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, chips, noodles, spices, etc

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is an aggressive entrepreneur strongly dedicated to the mixed mode of farming. She comes from the Nkubu area of Kenya, where she lives with her family. Her family is composed of her husband (of 25 years) and their three children. 25 years ago, Sophia started farming from scratch. Today, her 0.5 acre plot of land holds one dairy cows, 3 calves, two heads of poultry and over twenty trees and a well. She makes a decent living from her farming profits. 

To grow her farm business, Sophia is seeking a loan to buy one beef cow. With your investment, Sophia will be able to fatten the cow before she sells beef meat to the large meat processing companies in her area hence acquiring more income. She will also benefit from selling animal skin which fetches a high amount of money. 
 With the loan that you make today, you will be able to improve Sophia’s life and her beef farming business!

loans.use: To buy a beef cow for future profit

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is aged 31 years and a married lady. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training on enterprise development. 
She is involved in crop farming e.g grows maize, beans and potatoes which she sells to the locals in the market. She also works as a casual laborer in a farm plantation to supplement her income. 

She is borrowing the Kiva loan to buy manure and seedlings to increase crop produce.  This will enable her increase stock hence be able meet her customers demands.
She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.  She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy manure and seedlings hence increase crop produce to enable her meet customers' demands.

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Sok is 32-year-old farmer living in Bakan district of Pursat province and a married mother of three children, two of whom are dependent on her. She has been growing rice as the main source of income for ages. The crop has been threatened by pests and drought, which is the main challenge for her to earn income to support her family. 

This is the third time of her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she repaid back the past loan completely. Based on that useful loan, she has better support her family’s needs. Now she is leading a group of two to get a new loan, Sok will use her loan to build a proper house to live. She hopes to expand her business bigger so that she can earn more income to improve living standard and send children to school.

loans.use: to build a proper house to live.

loans.name: Hermosa

texts.en:
Hermosa is so grateful and encouraged that she has continually received support and paid her loan faithfully used for her ornamental plants and flowers business. He farm means a lot to her for this is where she sourced her and her family's daily needs.

She trusts that she can again avail of a 50,000 loan which she will use to buy fertilizer and farm inputs (seedlings), pots, wires and nets she needs for  growing her ornaments to sell. She prays that God will continue to bless your heart as you continue to help small businesses like hers.

Hermosa hopes for her ornamental plants farm business to flourish and grow. She prays for continuous abundance on her life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertilizer, wires and nets for her ornamental plants and flowers business.

loans.name: Sreyoun

texts.en:
Sreyoun(pictured with youngest son) is 38 years old, married with five children and lives in the Takeo province in Cambodia. She is a vegetable seller and she has been in this business since 2012. Her husband is a 38-year-old construction worker and three of her five children are in school. Together, she and her husband earn USD22 each day. 

Sreyoun has decided to take out a loan because she needs finances to buy a motorcycle to transport vegetables to sell at a market in the city. This loan will help her have enough finances to afford the motorcycle and improve her business. In the future, she wants to save money to build a new house and support her studying children to earn higher education.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to transport vegetables to sell at the market in the city

loans.name: Rychel

texts.en:
Rychel is 36 years old and has eleven children. Rychel is married and has ten children are presently in school.

Rychel is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rychel requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rychel has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Maristela

texts.en:
Maristela is 34 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Maristela is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Maristela has been in this business for 4 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.en:
Nargiz is 56 years old. She lives in Khelvachauri with her husband, 4 children and a daughter-in-law. The family runs an agricultural business. They have plot of land, where they grow different kinds of fruits and citrus. In addition they have cows. The family gets only seasonal income and Nargiz decided to start a business to have stable income.


The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan to start trading in clothes. She will purchase a stock of clothes and resell at a higher price. This will increase her income and she will be able to improve the living conditions of her family. Nargiz awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trading in clothes

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a rural smallholder crop farmer in Eldoret area of Kenya. He is married and has 2 children. Besides crop farming, James also does dairy, poultry and tree farming for extra income.  The key lesson he has taken away from 20 years of being in crop farming is predicting weather patterns.

James is seeking a loan to buy farm implements. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy modern tools that will enhance the effectiveness of his work on the farm. 
With your loan, having the right tools will improve the quality of work and the quantity of yields. Income generated from the farm will help him to take care of his family's financial needs and grow his business.

loans.use: to buy farm tools and implements to make his work more effective

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more maize and beans for sell.

loans.name: Sinoeun

texts.en:
A resident living in Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, Sinoeun is 40-year-old mother of three dependent children, one of whom is in school. In order to support her family’s living, she grows rice and cassava as the main sources of income. Meanwhile, she is raising pigs and chickens to supplement income as well. She has been involved her businesses for 35 years. Unfortunately, her crop was destroyed by pests and her livestock are being sick. These cause her to earn about 35,000 KHR per day. 

Now, she is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to save her business and this is the third time of her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The previous loan has enabled her to improve her living standard better. Anyway, the new loan will use to buy cassava and rice seeds, organic fertilizers and pay for labor fees. She hopes to that she can expand her business bigger so that she can earn more income to update the standard of living.

loans.use: To buy cassava and rice seeds, organic fertilizers and pay for labor fees.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply it to various homesteads for more income gain

loans.name: Jennyvi

texts.en:
Jennyvi is 29 years old and has three children. Jennyvi has live-in partner and two of her children are in school.

Jennyvi is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Jennyvi requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Jennyvi has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jennyvi would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Arlinda

texts.en:
Arlinda is 47 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap, milk, etc.

Arlinda has been in this business for 3 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap, milk, etc

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 49 years old and has six children who are in school.

Jocelyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is an individual client aged 40 years  and is a permanent resident of Mpirigwa in Mityana district. He deals in brewing alcohol (local brew), which business he started the business in 2000 to get income to meet his family financial obligations. But he is challenged with price fluctuations and the government taxes his now looking forward to increase his capital using the loan in order for him to expand his business. 

He will buy ingredients in form of bananas and sorghum to facilitate the process of brew processing using the loan money. He appreciates UGAFODE support. Pictured is Paul and the UGAFODE Credit staff.

loans.use: To buy ingredients like sorghum and bananas for making the local brew

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
La socia Karina se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de pollipapas y salchipapas,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de pollipapas y salchipapas.La socia solicita el credito para comprar papas,salchichas y aceite.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Karina continues to make a living through her business of selling "pollipapas" (chicken and fries) and "salchipapas" (sausage and fries).  She has had several years with this business and it is going very well.

Karina's dream is to increase her business of selling "pollipapas" and "salchipapas".  She asks for the loan in order to buy potatoes, sausages, and oil.  She is happy for the loan and promises to complete her repayments.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, sausages, and oil.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma who is in her early 30s is married with two children one of them is in school and the other one is still small. She has been running a retail shop for two years now.  She works from 06am to 10pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Fatuma’s 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase on the shop inventory and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully.   She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support.  She used the profit to pay for school fees, to repay loan and household expenses.   She will use this loan to increase on the shop inventory.  She dreams of building her own house.  

Fatuma will make sure she pays back her loan at the loan scheduled time.

loans.use: to increase on her shop inventory.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 39 years old man. He is married and they have three children. He operates a retail shop and has been in the business for 10 years. 

This is her fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya which he intends to purchase additional stock of sugar, cooking oil, salt, rice, soap and other toiletries for his shop. 

Francis will use the profit from her business to open new business. 

His hopes and dreams for the future is to open other business and complete his children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of sugar, cooking oil, salt, rice, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more bricks for sale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 48 years old married with three children. She lives is a urban community near Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

She makes and sells cakes in her community to earn a living and has been doing this for two years.

Margaret needs a loan to buy flour, oil and flavour for her business and also a new stove and copper and cement to improve her home. She hope to pay for her children school fees with the profits she makes with her business, also helps cover for her family's daily expenses.

She has been a SPBD member since 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: A loan of $9,200 helps Margaret buy a bag of flour, oil, flavour and a new stove including copper and cement to improve her home.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a very hard working  married woman charged  with the responsibility of taking care of two children and all attend school in Hoima Uganda.

She ventured into the selling of men's clothes alongside farming,whereby she anticipates to generate a lot of income to support her family. She hopes to expand her business and also educate her children. She is seeking for a loan facility to buy more clothes for sell. sell.

loans.use: to buy more men's clothes for sale

loans.name: Dile

texts.en:
Dile wants to buy a dairy cow; she plans on expanding the livestock so that her adult children pursue the activity and make an income of it. 

Dile is in her late 50s and a married mother of three. She is has been in the agriculture and livestock activity for the past ten years. Currently, she has one cow and sells part of the raw milk and a calf/year, 30 chickens and about 20 dynym agricultural lands where she has used it mostly for orchards such as persimmons, peaches, plums and grapevines.  In the spaces between the orchards she plants seasonal veggies to be used by the family. 

Dile’s’ income comes from the rural activity, while her husband receives a disability income of $1400/month.

loans.use: to expand her livestock by adding one more cow; to provide work for her unemployed adult children

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a 57 years old man. He is married and they have four children. He sells cows as well as farming and has been in the business for 38 years. 

This is his fifth loan with VisionFund Kenya. He intends to use the loan to purchase cattle for selling. 

He will use the profit from her business to educate his children as well as service the loan. 

His hopes and dreams for the future is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for selling

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a direct selling business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to purchase additional items like lotion, perfume, etc., to sell for her direct selling business.
Helen has been in this business for 3 years. Helen earns more income from raising pigs and general store.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like lotion, perfume, etc., to sell

loans.name: Chelangat

texts.en:
This is Chelangat a dairy farmer in Kericho. She is married with children. She has been involved in a women group where they get to learn on better animal husbandry. She has been keeping animals as a source of income and she sells the milk produce to a co-operatives in her village. The income she receives she uses it to educate her children and provide for her household. 

She wants to expand her dairy farm and with a Kiva LOAN she will buy one cow and build a cow shed.

loans.use: to buy one cow and build a cow shed

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar lives in Vanadzor town with her husband and 24-years-old son who is a musician. Gohar and her husband, for already 20 years, have been involved in a retail business. Specifically they are selling clothing and vegetables in nearby regions and villages. Using their own car, Gohar and her husband purchase new stock from Yerevan town and sell to their customers in Lori region. 

The reason why Gohar asks this loan is to purchase new stock of clothing supplies, fruits and vegetables to sell to customers and also purchase new tires for the car to transport goods to customers. 

Gohar has now been approved for a loan within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.
Please help this hardworking woman and her family to sustain their business activity and earn income for their living.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing supplies, fruits and vegetables to sell to customers and also purchase new tires for the car to transport goods to customers

loans.name: Malfrey

texts.en:
Malfrey is a 51 years old married woman with four children. She live in a rural community near Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

She operates a small tailoring business sewing varieties of cloths and sells it in her community to earn living. She has been doing this for seven years.

She requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine for her business. She plan to use her profit to help covers for her family's weekly expenses and also provide better education for her children.

She has been a SPBD member since 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: A loan of $6700 helps Malfrey buy a new sewing machine for her clothing business.

loans.name: Slaiman

texts.en:
Slaiman, a capable man, was born in Jordan 1994. Single and lives with his parents in Baqaa, he is a university student majoring in Information Technology, and he well known among friends and students.
He works beside his education in well-known hyper market as storage administration to save his daily pocket money, and to complete his education.  

Slaiman lacks sufficient funds to pay his tuition fees, and he is an ambitious man, so he did not want to stand up without doing anything, therefore he requested a loan to help him pay for his university fees and achieve his dreams. He hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to help him pay for his university fees in IT

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 54 years old, married with six children, four of whom in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell.

Ma. Luz has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Helen is 40 years old married with six children. She lives in a rural community outside of Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

She owns and operates a small general store selling varieties of food items and household items, and has been doing this for two years.

Hellen requested a loan to buy building materials to improve her home. she hope to provide a better education for her children with the profits she makes with her business and also helps covers for her family's daily expenses.

She has been a SPBD member since 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: A loan of $5700 helps Hellen buy materials to improve her home.

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es: El señor José Andrés propietario de una taquería se dedica todas las tardes a la venta de tacos y hog-dogs es una persona que se esmera todos los días para seguir adelante con su familia. José Andrés agradece a la institución por la ayuda que le ha brindado y solicita un nuevo crédito para invertir en su negocio y comprar nuevo equipo, una carreta mas para seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en: José Andrés is the owner of a taco stand. He works every afternoon selling tacos and hot dogs. He is a person who works hard every day to get ahead with his family. José Andrés is grateful to the institution for the help it has offered him and asks for another loan to invest in his business and purchase new equipment, an additional cart, to continue growing his business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional food cart to sell his tacos and hot dogs.

loans.name: Shareef

texts.en:
Shareef is a 23-year-old single man from Khanyounis, which is both a city and a Refugee Camp in city,the besieged Gaza Strip, where unemployment is very high. He has been transporting goods using his rickshaw . Shareef buys the products wholesale and resells them for a small profit margin. 

Shareef has taken out a USD loan from FATEN, which will help him to buy more products to resell. Shareef has a small business buying products wholesale and reselling them for a small profit margin. As part of this business, he must buy items in bulk (large quantities) and deliver them to his customers using his personal vehicle. 

Shareef’s loan will enable him to buy more inventory and goods to resell, and eventually increase the size of his business and his income.
Shareef appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more products to resell and deliver using his vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks such as rice, wheat, cooking oil, snacks, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia is 59 years old and widowed with nine children. She earns a living with a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Eulalia has been fattening pigs for 15 years and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Eulalia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 33-year-old married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He deals in motorcycle transport and at the same time does farming, growing seasonal crops.

He is faced with hardships of limited capital that hinder expansion and growth of his business. Besides that, he has hopes of expanding his business to new areas in order to obtain more profits.

Julius needs a loan to buy iron sheets and timber for his house construction.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets and timber for his house construction.

loans.name: Heam's Group

texts.en:
Heam is ages 65 years old and a married mother of nine children, living in Kampong Cham province. Growing sesame and weaving cotton scarves are the sources of her family’s income. She has been involved in these businesses for more than five years. The high cost of labor fee and the depreciated of the smoking tobacco’s price on market are the main challenges of her business. 

These cases cause her to have not enough funds to do farming for this season, so she decides to apply for a new loan via VisionFund. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to pay for labor and plowing fee to increase the productivity of her farming. 

For Heam, this is her third loan cycle with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, and those previous loans have helped her to have a better living condition. About this new loan, she hopes her crop will be well growing and return her more profit.

loans.use: to pay for labor and plowing fees to increase the productivity of her sesame farming.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Nurije

texts.en:
This is Nurije and she is a vulnerable ethnic Egyptian Albanian who lives in the suburbia of a city in the central Albania.  Nurije is very poor and she is the mother of three children. She receives a monthly pension of $82 in addition to the agricultural products she sells at the local market.  In the land she owns which is only 800 square meters, she has planted 30 olive groves from which she sells about 100 kg olives per grove and also in the half of it, she’s got grapevines from which she sells 200 kg grapes. She also plants some veggies for the family use. 

Nurije is seeking your financial help to dig a water well to water the plantations and orchards.

loans.use: to dig a well to water the plantations

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
At just 24, Gloria is already juggling her time between raising two young children, aged 5 and 3, and working a part-time job, and, as if that is not enough, she is now going into the food business. She is hardworking and focused on giving her children a better life.

Gloria is requesting a Kiva loan to buy equipment: a refrigerator, a microwave, and a gas stove, and also to also buy foods. With this loan she will be able to launch a takeaway food business.

"I want my children to have better chances than I did," says a hopeful Gloria.

loans.use: to buy a fridge, a gas stove, a microwave and food stocks.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a mixed-farmer from the Nkubu area of Kenya. He is married and has two children, who are one and eight years old. Charles practices dairy and poultry farming for a living. Also, with the help of his wife, he runs a small retail shop that sales basic household goods. 

Charles' big challenge is the high prices of agricultural inputs. He is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer, certified seeds, herbicides, and pesticides. The impact this loan will have on Charles' life is improved health of his crops, and extra income at the end of the season. Income from this investment will help Charles generate enough money to meet his family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply

loans.name: Nafisa

texts.ru:
Нафиса жизнерадостная и ответственная женщина. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Вместе со своей семьёй Нафиса живёт в сельской местности. Сама Нафиса работает швеёй. А муж Нафисы занимается дехканством. Они очень любят своих детей, и стараются обучать их от всего своего сердца, потому что они желают видеть образованных детей. Но зарплата, которую они получают, недостаточна для покрытия всех имеющихся нужд в семье. 
 В данное время Нафиса вместе со своим мужем хотят отремонтировать дом, где они живут, чтобы улучшить условия для проживания. Но собственных средств у них недостаточно. Для этого Нафиса обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов и установку пластиковых окон и дверей. Она надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Nafisa is a cheerful and responsible woman. She is married and has three children. Nafisa and her family live in a rural location. Nafisa herself works as a seamstress, and Nafisa's husband is a farmer. They really love their children and are trying to educate them with all their hearts because they want to see their children well educated. But the salaries that they receive are insufficient to cover all of the family's needs.

At the present time Nafisa and her husband want to renovate the house where they live in order to improve their living conditions. But they do not have sufficient funds of their own. Nafisa has therefore applied to Arvand and wants to take a loan to buy construction materials and to install vinyl windows and doors. She hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for its support.

loans.use: to install new windows and doors.

loans.name: Sonia Monica

texts.es:
Sonia es una mujer de 27 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 9 años y 2 hijas de 1 y 7 años, y su negocio es el tejido y venta de ropa de bebé.
Ella es buena madre, decidida, constante, dedicada, optimista, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘16 de julio’ dónde se lleva a cabo la feria comercial más grande del país, los días jueves y domingo desde tempranas horas de la mañana, feria en la que se puede encontrar cualquier tipo de cosas que se necesite. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Sonia es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos; los 2 mayores estudian en la escuela y los 2 menores aún no se encuentran en edad escolar, viven en un cuarto propiedad de la familia construido de adobe con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es el tejido y venta de ropa de bebé; ella compra diferentes tipos de lana y confecciona pantalones, chompas, gorros, y todo tipo de prendas para bebe. Una vez que ha cumplido con la cantidad de prendas, se dirige a la feria y vende de forma ambulante, “confecciono ropa de bebé y la vendo de forma ambulante en lugares estratégicos, la demanda crece y necesito grandes cantidades de lana…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que ella diseña y confecciona modelos innovadores, la desventaja es la competencia con mejores precios. Su sueño es establecer una empresa, ella desea realizar la compra de diferentes tipos de lana por mayor para contar con material constante de trabajo y vender por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Sonia solicita un préstamo para la compra de lana por mayor para producir  y vender ropa de bebé en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Sonia is a 27-year-old single woman, she has 2 boys ages 4 and 9 and two girls ages 1 and 7, and her business is knitting and selling baby clothing. 

She is a good mother, determined, reliable, dedicated, optimistic, responsible and very hard-working. Her business is located in the 16 de julio zone where the largest commercial fair of the country is held on Thursdays and Sundays from the very early hours of the morning. In this fair, one can find whatever type of things that one needs. It has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 0-12 degrees centigrade. 

Sonia has dark skin, dark eyes, long black hair she wears braided, is short, has a slender physique, she dresses traditionally (hat, shawl and pollera [traditional Andean skirt]), her native language is Aymará which she speaks with her family and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the business she does. She shares her life with her children. The older two go to school and the younger two aren't of school age yet. They live in a room owned by the family, built of adobe with a roof of metal sheeting and cement floor, which has running water, electricity, domestic gas, and sewer services. Her business is knitting and selling baby clothing. She purchases different types of wool and makes pants, sweaters, hats, and all sorts of clothing for babies. Once she has finished with a quantity of clothing, she goes to the fair and sells as a street vendor. "I make clothing for babies and I sell as a street vendor in strategic locations. Demand increases and I need a large quantity of wool..." She says. The advantage of her business is that she designs and makes innovative models, the disadvantage is the competition with better prices. Her dream is to establish a business. She wants to purchase different types of wool in bulk to have constant working material and to sell in bulk. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 15 years that she has done this work. 

For these reasons Sonia asks for a loan to purchase wool in bulk to make and sell baby clothing in greater quantity.

loans.use: to purchase wool in bulk to make and sell baby clothing in greater quantity.

loans.name: Zegjine

texts.en:
Zegjine wants to build a storage room where she can put all the agricultural products and other tools and things used in the village. She is a rural mother of three and is in her mid fifties. Zegjine has been selling pomegranates and grapes for 18 year to make a living. In addition, her family receives some disability pension in the total amount of $172/month for her husband and the mentally challenged sister-in-law who lives with them. 

She’s got some dynyms of agricultural land where she has planted mostly pomegranates and grapes, and the rest of the land is rented out to some other villagers for about $150/dynym per year.  

“I wanted to plant some more and do some more rural activity, but my husband is not capable this of due to his disability,” said Zegjine to the loan officer who reached out to her.

loans.use: to build a storage room for the agricultural products and tools

loans.name: Laxman Nayak Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Ambicka is aged 32 years. She is a hardworking, generous and dutiful lady and the featured borrower of Laxman Nayak SHG-A from the village Ramagiri of Koraput district. The lady standing to the left is Ambicka. 

She lives with her husband, who is a carpenter, and a 5-year-old daughter who is continuing her education in a secondary school. Ambicka has been engaged in an appliqué business for the past three years. She has been successful in her business so far. The appliqués and other handicraft items made by Ambicka are very popular in her locality, and she has a pretty high amount of customer base. 

Ambicka, along with her group member, Chanchhala, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Ambicka will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase a water purifier, as the water source in her locality is highly polluted and most of the villagers suffer from jaundice, which is the result of using the water source. In this way, Ambicka will be able to safeguard her family's health and lead a healthy life.

Ambicka has a dream to open a big showroom where she can display her craft items to customers in a better way.

loans.use: to purchase a water purifier

loans.name: Laxman Nayak Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Chandrama, aged 49 years, is the featured borrower of Laxman Nayak SHG-B from the village Ramagiri of Koraput district. Chandrama is standing to the left in the photo. She lives with her husband, who is a farmer engaged in potato cultivation, and her two daughters of whom one has already gotten married, and the other one has been helping her in the sewing business for the last three years. 

Chandrama has undergone very tough times due to her prevailing financial crisis, but somehow she was able to overcome those tough days due to her strong willpower and determination.

Chandrama, along with her group member, Samari, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Chandrama will use her portion of the loan amount in order to build a septic tank and a toilet so that she will not have to go outside the house in order to attend nature's call and promote safety and hygiene.

Chandrama wishes to purchase a cow and start a milk selling business in the future.

loans.use: to build a septic tank and a toilet

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Doña Olga de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y a la compra y venta de productos reciclables(hierro y aluminio), se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 10 años y con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Olga, 50 years old, lives in her own house with her family. She works selling clothing and buying and selling recyclable products (iron and aluminum). She has done this work for 10 years and with what she gets from her earnings, she manages to cover some of the household expenses. She is asking for a loan to purchase more clothing in bulk to be able to have more income.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Carlos Adalberto

texts.es: Carlos  tiene 28 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su pequeña hija de 3 años y medio  de edad. Carlos se gana la vida por medio de la compra y venta de teléfonos y accesorios tales como: cargadores, carcasas, memorias USB, baterías, etc. De esta forma lleva el sustento a su hogar y mantiene el equilibrio económico. Carlos anteriormente obtuvo un crédito para invertir  en su negocio con el cual compro mayor cantidad de productos y además  no contaba con vitrinas para dar mejor vistosidad  a sus accesorios, gracias al crédito su negocio  mejoro y su clientela aumento en buen numero, por lo que él se encuentra satisfecho y agradecido por la ayuda brindada, ya que el negocio significa mucho para Carlos debido a que es su principal fuente de ingresos económicos los cuales  le sirven para sacar adelante a su pequeña hija. Carlos con el propósito de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y adquirir una mayor comodidad en el hogar solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para comprar: arena, cemento, hierro, etc., para poder iniciar la construcción de un cuarto dormitorio en su vivienda.
texts.en: Carlos is 28 years old and lives in his own house with his little daughter who is 3-and-a-half years old. Carlos earns his living through buying and selling phones and accessories such as chargers, cases, USB drives, batteries, etc. In this way, he brings sustenance to his home and maintains the economic equilibrium. Carlos previously got a loan to invest in his business with which he purchased a greater quantity of products and in addition he didn't have display cases to give more visibility to his accessories. Thanks to the loan, his business improved and his clientele increased a good amount, so he is satisfied and grateful for the offered help, since his business means a lot to Carlos, being his primary source of income which serves him to get his little daughter ahead. Carlos, with the goal of improving his living conditions and getting more comfort in his home, asks for another loan from FUSAI to purchase sand, cement, metal, etc. to be able to begin building a bedroom on his house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, metal, etc. to be able to begin building a bedroom on his house.

loans.name: Lesly Yesenia

texts.es: Lesly de 38 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y carteras su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, tiene muchos clientes fijos por la calidad de sus productos y los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito para la comprar de mas ropa y carteras por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y así poder tener mejore ingresos.
texts.en: Lesly, 38 years old, is a single mother who lives in her own house with her three children. She works selling clothing and handbags. Her business is located near her home in a heavily trafficked area. She has many regular customers for the quality of her products and the good prices. She is asking for a loan to purchase more clothing and handbags in bulk to be able to continue with her sales and, so, to be able to have more income.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing and handbags in bulk.

loans.name: Violetas Group

texts.es:
Violetas lleva por nombre un grupo integrado por 7 mujeres que día a día da lo mejor de sí para brindar estabilidad a su familia, la zona donde se encuentra ubicado el grupo es productora de caña por lo que al recorrer la zona se aprecian los sembradíos de este fruto, al igual que otros productos alterativos como el limón, el maíz, el frijol y la papaya. Los integrantes del grupo y sus actividades son:

Alicia – Venta de Tamales, Tortillas Y Masa.
Agustina – Venta de Comida 
Yanet – Venta de Perfumes 
Dianey, Carmen – Venta de Zapatos 
Natividad – Venta de Cosméticos 
Andrea –Venta de Antojitos
 
Doña Alicia es una gran mujer, siempre tiene una sonrisa en el rostro; ella es madre de una joven de 19 años y un chico de 15 quienes dependen económicamente de ella. Desde hace 30 años Alicia aprendió el secreto de su madre para preparar tamales rancheros, huecos, de elote, de coco, de plátano y de rajas; desde entonces se ha dedicado a elaborarlos y venderlos. De igual manera, se dedica a la venta de masa y de tortillas hechas a mano. “Cuando era niña me gustaba estar cerca de mi mamá cuando hacia tortillas; siempre le decía que quería un 'sapito' porque sus tortillas siempre se inflaban".

Para que sus clientes puedan disfrutar los ricos tamales, doña Licha, como le conocen en la comunidad, se pone e acción a partir de las 5 de la mañana, preparara la masa, el chile, la carne, asa y limpia las hojas que envuelven los tamales, prepara las vaporeras e inicia la preparación de los mismos. Mientras los tamales se se cocen con el vapor, Licha elabora tortillas, picaditas y vende masa para aprovechar bien su tiempo.
