Finalmente, a la 1 de la tarde, los tamales están listos para ser vendidos. Licha vende hasta 400 tamales únicamente los martes y sábados; las tortillas y la masa las vende de lunes a domingo, por día vende 300 tortillas y 20 kilos de masa.

Con sus ganancias, solventa los gastos del hogar, la educación de sus hijos recientemente logró reparar su refrigerador y remodelar su cocina, pero también reinvierte en sus actividades las cuales son parte fundamental de su vida. El nuevo préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de maíz, leña y una vaporera. “Gracias por confiar en nosotros, con los préstamos incrementaremos nuestra actividad”.

*La fotografía fue tomada en la pequeña cocina donde doña Licha prepara sus tamales y tortillas todo ello en su fogón, ella es quien viste playera gris, es la primera de derecha a izquierda.
texts.en:
Violetas is the name of a group made up of 7 women who day to day give their best selves to offer their families stability. The area where the group is located is a sugar cane production area for which when going around the zone, one can see these plants, and also other products such as lemon, corn, beans and papayas. The members of the group and their businesses are:

Alicia – tamales, tortillas and dough sales
Agustina – food sales 
Yanet – perfume sales 
Dianey, Carmen – shoe sales
Natividad – cosmetics sales
Andrea –snack sales
 
Alicia is a great woman, she always has a smile on her face. She is the mother of one young woman, 19 years old, and a boy of 15, who depend on her economically. Thirty years ago, Alicia learned her mother's secret to prepare tamales in rancho, hueco, corn, coconut, banana and sliced styles. From then she has worked making and selling them. Also, she works selling dough and tortillas made by hand. "When I was a girl, I liked to be near my mom when she made tortillas. I always told her I wanted a "toad" because the tortillas always swell up."

So that her customers can enjoy her delicious tamales, Licha, as she is known in the community, starts to work at 5 in the morning, preparing the dough, the chili, the meat, roasting and cleaning the leaves which wrap the tamales, preparing the steamers and beginning the preparation. While the tamales are steaming, Licha makes tortillas, picaditas and sells dough to use her time well. Finally, at 1 in the afternoon, the tamales are ready to be sold. Licha sells up to 400 tamales only on Tuesdays and Saturdays. She sells the tortillas and dough Monday to Sunday, and sells 300 tortillas and 20 kilos of dough daily. 

With her earnings, she covers the household expenses, her children's education, and recently managed to repair her refrigerator and remodel her kitchen, but she also reinvests in her businesses which are a fundamental part of her life. The new loan will be invested in the purchase of corn, firewood, and a steamer. "Thank you for trusting us, with the loans we increase our business."

*The photo was taken in the small kitchen where Licha makes her tamales and tortillas, all of this on her wood fire. She is the one wearing a grey t-shirt, she is the first on the left.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, and a steamer.

loans.name: Nancy Jesusa

texts.es:
Nancy es una mujer de 39 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 17 años, y su negocio es la venta de pollo a la broaster.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, constante, activa, comprometida, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘villa El carmen’ este lugar surge por la existencia de una vertiente de agua, en esta zona existían grandes plantaciones de árboles de Kishuara, que fueron plantados por los colonos y, que en la actualidad quedan unos cuantos árboles que los mantienen como un recuerdo. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Nancy es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hijo que estudia en la escuela y ayuda en el negocio, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de pollos a la broaster (pollo condimentado y frito en aceite). Actividad que realiza de lunes a domingo en un cuarto habilitado como cocina, dónde sus clientes se acomodan sentados en sillas a disfrutar de su comida. “Inicié mi negocio con la ayuda de mi hermana que me incentivó a independizarme, mi hijo ayuda y trabaja conmigo gran parte del día...” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que su hijo le ayuda y trabaja constantemente, la desventaja es la competencia del lugar. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante amplio para vender comida a más clientes, ella desea realizar la compra de una máquina freidora para reemplazar la que tiene porque se encuentra averiada. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Nancy solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina freidora para continuar con su negocio y ayudar a su hijo a estudiar.
texts.en:
Nancy is a 39 year old woman. She has a 17 year old son and her business is selling broaster chicken. She is a good mother, enterprising, independent, stable, active, committed, responsible and very hardworking. She runs her business in the ‘Villa El Carmen’ area. This place exists because of a water spring. There were big groves of Kishuara trees that were planted by colonists. Now there are some trees left that are kept as a reminder. It has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies in the day between 0-12 degrees centigrade.

Nancy has dark skin, brown eyes, long. black hair she wears tied back, short stature, and a robust build. Her mother tongue is Aymará, which she speaks in her family, and she speaks Spanish in the general culture and for her business. She shares her life with her son, who is in school and who helps with the business. They live in a rented home built of brick and cement with a sheet metal roof and a wood floor. It has potable water, electricity, gas and plumbing. Her business is selling broaster chicken (seasoned chicken fried in oil). She does this activity Monday through Sunday in a rented room with a kitchen. Her customers sit on chairs to enjoy her food. “I started my business with the help of my sister who motivated me to go off on my own. My son helps and works with me a big part of the day,” she remarks. The advantage of her business is that her son helps her and works constantly. The disadvantage is the competition in the area. Her dream is to open a spacious business to sell food to more customers. She wants to buy a fryer to replace the one she has because it is broken. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 5 years that she has been developing this activity. 

This is why Nancy is asking for a loan to buy a fryer to continue with her business and help her son go to school.

loans.use: to buy a fryer for her business and help her son go to school.

loans.name: Laxman Nayak Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Lili is a hardworking woman of 32 years from Jeypore. She is married and a mother of four children (two sons and two daughters). Her children are in different grades. Lili studied till grade 4. They live in a small village called Ramagiri in the district of Koraput, Odisha, India. The lady standing to the left in the photo is Lili.

Lili's husband is a farmer who has agricultural land where he grows different types of crops and vegetables. He plants and grows good quality crops. He has many years of experience in this line of work. He has very good personal references for his moral character and behavior, and he sells good quality crops at a cheaper price compared to other sellers. That's why his customers like him. 

Lili, though a housewife, helps her husband in his agricultural activities.

Lili, along with her fellow group member, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Lili will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase sand, cement, gravel, iron rods and a commode to build a toilet. Building a toilet will help her in protecting herself and her family from harmful diseases and will enable her to stay healthy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, gravel, iron rods and a commode to build a toilet.

loans.name: Laxman Nayak Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Forty-seven-year-old Mangaldei is a married woman and a mother of six children. Mangaldei is standing to the right-hand side in the photograph. Her elder daughter is married. The younger daughter reads in grade 10, and her four sons are involved with some income-generating work. 

She lives with her husband and their one daughter and four sons in the remote village of Ramagiri in Koraput district. Mangaldei belongs to an ultra-poor family, and that is why she cannot afford to have a latrine in her house. She goes outside to the field for defecation and urination. She has been affected by severe infection due to open defecation and is undergoing treatment for the same.

Mangaldei, along with her group member, Kusuma, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Mangaldei will use her portion of the loan amount to build a toilet so that she will be able to avoid further infections and lead a healthy life free of diseases.

loans.use: to build a toilet

loans.name: Laxman Nayak Shg-E Group

texts.en:
Sabita, aged 41 years, is the featured borrower of Laxman Nayak SHG-E from the village Ramagiri of Koraput district. She is married and the mother of eight children, out of which five daughters are married. She lives with her three sons who are engaged in certain income-generating activities. Her husband works as a plumber abroad and sends money monthly for meeting the expenses of the family. 

Sabita is engaged in selling bangles, cosmetic items like nail paint, eye shadow, lip liner, moisturizer, perfumes and other ladies utility items in her store. The lady standing to the extreme right in the photo is Sabita.

Her family has no latrine. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a latrine. She, along with her other two group members, has requested a loan amount of 54,000 INR. Sabita will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

She hopes that by building a toilet, she will be able to lead a healthy and hygienic life, which will prevent her from unnecessary medical expenses.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Nancy Maricela

texts.es:
La  señora Nancy tiene 24 años de edad, es una joven soltera, vive en una comunidad de  Trojes al Oriente de Honduras, Su actividad principal es la Caficultura, actividad con la que cuenta con 5 años de experiencia.

Doña Nancy esta actividad es su fuente los ingresos y con ella cubru sus gastos familiares y compromisos, es una persona muy conocida en la Aldea por ser muy responsable y muy dedicado al trabajo, con el préstamo espera poder fertilizar su finca y esto le ayudara  a que le generen mayores ingresos en el hogar.

Uno de sus sueños es poder mejorar su finca y en las proximas cosecha obtener mejores resultados.


Trojes, Honduras – Junio del  2015.
texts.en:
Nancy is 24 years old, is a single young woman, and lives in the community of Trojes al Oriente in Honduras. Her primary work is coffee growing, and she has 5 years of experience in this work.

This work is Nancy's source of income and with it, she covers her family expenses and commitments. She is a person very well-known in the town as being very responsible and dedicated to her work. With the loan, she hopes to be able to fertilize her farm and this will help her to generate more income in her household. 

One of her dreams is to be able to improve her farm and in the next seasons get better results. 

Trojes, Honduras – June  2015.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her business.

loans.name: Arrieta Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas es un hombre de 50 años de edad, dedicado a la cría y venta de ganado y porcino, un medio por el cual ha logrado un gran avance como familia y empresario.

Actualmente se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el cual comprara cerdos, lechones, alimento, cemento para hacer unos cuantos arreglos en el punto de venta.

Su sueño es seguir trabajando para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, ya que su estado no es el mejor.

Aporte a la vida de este hombre, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Tomas is a 50-year-old man, who works raising and selling cattle and pigs, a means through which he has managed a great advance as a family and a businessman. 

Currently he is asking for a loan with which he will purchase pigs, piglets, feed, and cement to make a number of repairs to the sales point. 

His dream is to continue working to improve the condition of his house, since its current state is not the best. 

Contribute to this man's life, grant him a loan.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, piglets, feed, cement to make a number of repairs to the sales point.

loans.name: Los Intis Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LOS INTIS, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Paucartambo departamento de Cusco.
La socia Segundina tiene 42 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es casada ,la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de cultivo de cereales, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas entre otros.
Los socios en general se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Los Intis communal bank. The bank is located in Paucartambo province, in Cusco department.

The member, Segundina, is 42 years old, has 3 children and is married. She alternates her daily work with the business of growing grains. The member has had this business for a good while, which is going well for her thanks to the determination that she puts into her business each day. The member wants to be able to continue working so, in this way, to continue supporting her family. 

The member asks for the loan to purchase seeds and other things.

The members in general are grateful for the granted loan and promise to make their established payments.

The person whose face is covered is not part of the communal bank.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and other things.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La prestataria, de 39 años, tiene un hijo de 16, siguió tratamiento por TBC entre 2009 y 2012. Al concluir el tratamiento, fue invitada por Socios En Salud a participar en talleres de formación del programa de Generación de Ingresos. Antes de participar, ella ya tenía dos máquinas de coser en su taller, pero, con apoyo de Socios En Salud, compró una tercera máquina recubridora, para acabados de ropa. 

Su negocio prosperó y actualmente tiene siete máquinas, con las que confecciona chaquetas y sweaters, entre otras prendas. El negocio le está siendo rentable, por lo que le gustaría seguir ampliándolo. Con este nuevo préstamo comprará mayor cantidad de materiales para su producción textil. El nuevo préstamo hará posible el incremento mensual de sus ganancias y su mercancía.
texts.en:
The borrower, age 39, has a 16 year old son.  She received treatment for TB between 2009 and 2012.  Upon finishing the treatment, she was invited by Partners in Health to participate in training workshops in the Generation of Income program.  

Before participating, she already had two sewing machines in her shop.  However, with support from the Partners in Health, she bought a third cover stitch machine for clothing finishes.

Her business prospered, and she currently has seven machines.  She uses the machines to make jackets and sweaters, among other garments.  The business is profitable for her.  Therefore, she would like to continue expanding it.  With this new loan she will buy a greater quantity of materials for her textile production.  The new loan will make the monthly increase in her earnings and her merchandise possible.

loans.use: to buy textile materials to make clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair and maintain his vehicle, given that it is currently in bad shape.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
Eliana es una mujer de 25 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es emprendedora, decidida, constante, comprometida, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la feria de ‘barrio lindo’ que es un mercado popular, grande donde se encuentran todo tipo de articulos para el hogar, cuenta con diferentes bloques, tiene estacionamiento y guardias de seguridad, la feria abre los miércoles y sábados de cada semana. De clima cálido sub tropical muy húmedo con una temperatura que varía entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Eliana es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello largo negro lacio, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus familiares que trabajan, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, prendas como; pantalones, cinturones, poleras manga corta, bermudas, y otros. Labor que realiza todos los días de la semana durante el día en un puesto de venta en la calle al aire libre. “ya estamos sobre la temporada de invierno y mis clientes me exigen ropa abrigada, necesito cubrir esa necesidad de mis clientes…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la ropa de segunda mano se vende constantemente, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de ropa de invierno por mayor. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de ropa propia, ella desea realizar la compra de ropa abrigada de segunda mano por mayor, para abastecer a sus clientes por la demanda de la época. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Eliana solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano abrigada por mayor para sus clientes de la temporada de invierno.
texts.en: Eliana is a 25 year old woman. Se is single and has no children. Her business is selling second hand clothes. She is enterprising, decisive, constant, committed, responsible and very hardworking. She has her business in "Barrio Lindo" which is a popular and big market where one can find all types of household items. It has many blocks, parking and security guards. This market opens Wednesdays and Saturdays of each week. The weather here is warm and subtropical, with temperatures ranging between 21 to 35 degrees Celsius. Eliana is dark skinned, with brown eyes, straight long black hair, thin. Her native language is guarani, which she speaks in her town and Spanish as general culture and for her job. She shares her life with her relatives who work. They live in their family home, built in brick and cement with corrugated iron roof and cement floor, with running water, electricity and sewerage. Her business is selling second hand clothes such as pants, belts, short sleeve t-shirts, capri shorts and others. She works every day of the week in her place of sale on the street, in the open air. "We are almost starting the winter season and my customers are requesting warmer clothes. I need to fulfill my customers' needs...", she comments. The advantage of her business is that second hand clothes are sold constantly; the disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy winter clothes at wholesale prices. Her dream is to open a clothing store. She wants to buy warm second hand clothes at wholesale prices to fulfill her customers' demands this season. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the two years she has been working in this business. These are the reasons why Eliana is requesting a loan to buy warm second hand clothes at wholesale prices for her customers this winter season.

loans.use: to buy warm second hand clothes at wholesale prices for her customers this winter season.

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es: Don Gonzalo, tiene 50 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 4 hijos, vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Taulabe, Comayagua. Don Gonzalo anteriormente tenía una pulpería y hace 8 años decidió por vender dulces, rosquillas, tustacas y alboroto de maíz. Esta actividad la realiza a orillas de la carretera, ofreciendo a las personas que transitan  por el lugar. Ha obtenido varios prestamos en ODEF para tener su negocio y actualmente solicita otro por 12,000 lempiras con este va comprar mas producto de rosquillas,  tustacas,dulces, alborotos de maíz para revender. Su plan es poner otros negocios para aumentar los ingresos y tener solvencia económica con su familia.
texts.en: Don Gonzalo is 50 years old, married, and has four children. He lives in a hamlet in Taulabe municipality, Comayagua. In the past, Don Gonzalo had a grocery store and then eight years ago, he decided to sell sweets, biscuits, doughnuts, and popcorn. He does this by the roadside, offering his goods to people passing through the area. He has received various loans from ODEF to support his business, and he is now requesting another loan of 12,000 lempiras to buy more products such as sweets, biscuits, doughnuts, and popcorn to resell. His plan is to set up more businesses to increase his income so that he and his family are financially solvent.

loans.use: to buy products such as sweets, biscuits, doughnuts, and popcorn to sell.

loans.name: Komiljon

texts.ru:
Комилчон настоящий трудяга. Он воодитель маршрутного такси. Его работа заключается в том что он каждый день возит людей по маршруту город Худжанд - город Душанбе и обратно. Комилчону повезло в жизни. В свои 38 лет, он счастливый муж и отец четверых детей. У него есть постоянное место работы. Комилчон с юных лет имеел большой интерес к воздению машин и уже тогда он знал что его профессия будет связанна с машиной.
   Комилчон решил сделать ремонт дома и обустроить аппартаменты, как удобно его семье. Но денег не хватила на стройматериалы. Комилчон обратился за финансовой поддержкой, чтобы приобрести недостающие стройметериалы и завершить ремонт. Вы можете поддержать Комилчона.
texts.en:
Komiljon is a genuine hard worker. He is the driver of a fixed-route taxi van. His work comprises carrying people each day on a route from the city of Khujand to the city of Dushanbe and back. Komiljon is lucky in life. At 38 years old, he is a happy husband and the father of four children. He has a permanent job. From a young age Komiljon was always very interested in driving and even then he knew that he his profession would be related to cars.

Komiljon has decided to renovate his house and fit out the rooms to suit his family. But he did not have enough money for the construction materials. Komiljon has applied for financial support in buying the missing materials and completing the renovations. You can support Komiljon.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and complete his renovation.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix continúa con su actividad de comercio de ganado ovino. El préstamo que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de ovejas. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque no tuvo problemas en el comercio. Su negocio continúa siendo la principal fuente de ingresos de su familia y este no puede crecer debido a la falta de pasto de la zona que en temporada de invierno es casi nula. Una práctica común es el alquiler de tierras para el uso del forraje, que a largo plazo el costo es mayor que la compra de la tierra, “el alquiler de la tierra es muy caro, prefiero invertir en la compra de tierra que en el largo plazo me traerá mejores beneficios…” comenta. la ventaja de su negocio es que su ganado cuenta con demanda debido a la buena lana que produce, la desventaja es la falta de tierras donde crezca forraje para alimentar el ganado. Su sueño es ampliar su establo y volverlo de primer nivel, él desea realizar la compra de un terreno de tierra para sembrar pasto para alimentar a su ganado. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 29 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Felix solicita un préstamo para la compra de un terreno de tierra para sembrar pasto para alimentar a su ganado.
texts.en:
Felix continues with his business activity of selling sheep.  He invested the loan that he got in the purchase of sheep.  His payments were punctual because he did not have problems in the business.  His business continues being the main source of income for his family.  It is not able to grow due to the lack of pasture in the area, which in wintertime is almost non-existent.

A common practice is to rent land to use for fodder.  In the long term the cost is greater than buying the land.  “The rent for the land is very expensive.  I prefer to invest in the purchase of land, which in the long term will bring me better profits,” he says.

The advantage of his business is that his sheep are in demand because of the good wool that they produce.  The disadvantage is the lack of land where fodder grows to feed the livestock.

His dream is to expand his stable and to make it first rate again.  

He wishes to buy land to plant pasture to feed his livestock.  This is the second cycle of loans with the institution in the 29 years that he has engaged in this business activity.

It is for these reasons that Felix is requesting a loan to buy land to plant pasture to feed his livestock.

loans.use: to buy land to plant pasture to feed his livestock.

loans.name: Ana Dianira

texts.en:
Ana has a business selling tortillas in the market for her family's subsistence. Thanks to the support that the institution has offered her with the previous loan, her family's conditions have improved considerably.

She has asked fro another loan to purchase corn, firewood, lime powder and bags; she will have the basic materials to continue making tortillas and meet her customers' demands. She has faith that sales will continue.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, lime powder, and bags; she will have the basic materials to continue making tortillas.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 39-year-old boutique proprietor. She is the mother of two children. Her husband provides additional income.

She has been in this business for the last 5 years. She loves and enjoys it. This marks her first loan, to finance her business, from Vision Fund Kenya.

She will use the requested loan to purchase Africa print clothes to resell during the Muslin festive season. She will use the profit to expand her boutique.

In the future, she hopes to grow her business into several boutiques.

loans.use: to purchase Africa print clothes

loans.name: Maa Durga Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Mirmala is a 35-year-old lady full of life and enthusiasm. She lives with her husband and a daughter in Somabartota village of Koraput district. The lady standing to the right is Mirmala. 

Her husband works as a laborer in a nearby factory. Mirmala is the featured borrower of Maa Durga SHG-D and is engaged in vegetable cultivation. She grows okra, bitter gourd, ridge gourd, pointed gourd and cauliflower in her field, which is taken on lease.

Mirmala, along with her group member, has requested a loan of amount 36,000 INR. She will use her portion of loan amount to purchase a high-yield variety of seeds, organic manures and pesticides for her farming business so that she will be able to get a good amount of harvest and earn a pretty good income.

She has future plans for renovating her old house and purchasing a new cow so that she can start her dairy business simultaneously with her vegetable farming.

loans.use: to purchase a high-yield variety of seeds, organic manures and pesticides

loans.name: Maa Durga Shg-E Group

texts.en:
Moti, a 38-year-old lady, is the featured borrower of Maa Durga SHG-E. Moti lives with her husband and two sons in Koraput district. She is standing to the right-hand side in the photograph. 

Her husband works as a school bus driver, and Moti owns a ladies corner where she sells saris (traditional Indian dress), bangles, cosmetics, talcum powder, fashion accessories, etc. The amount that she earns from this business is used in meeting the household expenses.

Moti, along with her group member, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR to purchase more varieties of materials so as to diversify her business and gain a larger segment of customers so as to get a larger margin of profit.

Moti aspires to build a house for her family and hire a tutor for her two sons so that they will be able to get a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of materials so as to diversify her business and gain a larger segment of customers

loans.name: Pedro De Jesus

texts.es:
Pedro, vive en casa propia junto a su familia integrada por su esposa e hijos, con edades de 10, 15 y 20 años de edad, tiene como actividad económica la comercialización de cerdos y además administra una tienda de productos de la canasta básica, su negocio funciona desde hace más de 10 año y lo inicio con capital propio, trabaja todos los días en un horario de cinco de la mañana a seis de la tarde.
Con el propósito de mejorar su negocio solicita un crédito para comprar cerdos, de esta manera tendrá capacidad de venta para atender a nuevos clientes y mejorar sus ingresos, espera administrar bien el crédito para obtener buenos beneficios.
Las aspiraciones de Pedro son ampliar su negocio y ganar popularidad en su localidad.
texts.en:
Pedro lives in his own house with his family, made up of his wife and children, ages 10, 15 and 20. He has as his business the sale of pigs, and in addition he has a store selling basic pantry items. His business has been operating for more than 10 years and he began it with his own capital. He works every day from five in the morning to six in the evening. 

With the goal of improving his business, he asks for a loan to purchase pigs, in this way he will have sales capacity to serve new customers and increase his income; he expects to manage the loan well to get good benefits. 

Pedro's aspirations are to expand his business and gain popularity in his area.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, in this way he will have sales capacity to serve new customers and increase his income.

loans.name: David Leonardo

texts.es:
David es un hombre de 31 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo recién nacido de seis meses, y su negocio es la fabricación y venta de adhesivos artesanales.
Él es buen padre, emprendedor, dinámico, activo, constante, optimista, responsable y muy trabajador. su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘6 de agosto’ área central donde lado a lado conviven empresas públicas y privadas, como; restaurantes, galerías comerciales, cines, heladerías, edificios de departamentos familiares, universidades y todo tipo de comercio, de clima templado con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-26 grados centígrados.
David es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el quechua que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica al mismo negocio, viven en una propiedad de sus suegros construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con el servicio de energía eléctrica, agua potable y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la elaboración de adhesivos artesanales; que son Pegatinas, Calcomanías, Stikers, para la decoración de uñas, la fabricación es hecha a mano, utilizando la técnica de micro pintura, “los diseños más comunes son flores y mariposas en diferentes colores y formas, para que el cliente pueda llevar obras de arte en sus manos y pies...” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con demanda de salón de belleza y clientes particulares, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de material de trabajo como; Ácido orgánico, Acetato, Éter, etc. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y estabilizarlo, él desea realizar la compra de material de trabajo para la fabricación de adhesivos artesanales. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que David solicita un préstamo para la compra de material de trabajo para la elaboración de adhesivos artesanales para estabilizar su negocio.
texts.en:
David is a 31-year-old man, he lives with his partner, has a new-born son who is 6 months old, and his business is making and selling craft adhesives. 

He is a good father, enterprising, dynamic, active, dependable, optimistic, responsible and very hard-working. His business is located in the 6 de agosto zone, a central area where public and private businesses exist side by side, such as restaurants, commercial galleries, movie theaters, ice cream shops, family apartment buildings, universities and all sorts of commerce. It has a temperate climate with temperatures that vary during the day between 18-26 degrees centigrade. 

David has dark skin, dark eyes, short black hair, is short, has a thin physique, his native language is Quechua which she speaks with his family and he speaks Spanish due to the general culture and the business he does. He shares his life with his wife who works in the same business. They live in a property owned by his in-laws, made of brick and cement with a roof of metal sheeting and a wooden floor, which has electricity, running water and sewer services. His business is making craft adhesives, which are stickers, transfers and nail decals. He does the production by hand, using micro-painting technology. "The most common designs are flowers and butterflies in different colors and shapes, so that the customer can wear works of art on their hands and feet..." he says. The advantage of his business is that it has the demand of a beauty salon and individual customers, the disadvantage is the lack of capital to purchase working materials such as organic acid, acetate, ether, etc. His dream is to expand his business and stabilize it. He wants to purchase working materials to make craft adhesives. This is his first loan cycle with the institution in the 1 year he has been doing this work.

For these reasons, David asks for a loan to purchase working materials to make craft adhesives to stabilize his business.

loans.use: to purchase working materials to make craft adhesives to stabilize his business.

loans.name: Jose Rumaldo

texts.es:
José, utiliza los créditos como una herramienta para mantener la continuidad de su negocio de aagricultura y crianza de cerdos, manifiesta que actualmente está teniendo mejores ingresos con los que puede ir cubriendo las necesidades que surgen en su hogar, sus clientes se encuentran satisfechos y por el momento no ha tenido dificultades que le impidan trabajar.
Nuevamente solicita un crédito que utilizara para comprar insumos agrícolas y pagar obreros para realizar sus trabajos de siembra de granos básicos, espera que los resultados sean tan positivos como anteriormente.
texts.en:
José uses loans as a tool to keep his agriculture and pig-raising business going. He says that he is currently earning a higher income, which he can use to cover his household expenses. His clients are satisfied and so far, he has not experienced any problems that have prevented him from working.

José is again requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs and pay labourers to work planting basic grains. He hopes that the results are as positive as last time.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and pay labourers to work planting basic grains.

loans.name: Chhun Leang's Group

texts.en:
Chhun Leang is a 44-years-old mother who is living in a remote area located in Kampong Cham province. She has one child who is in school.

For more than five years, selling grocery items is the main source of her family’s income. She also grows smoking tobacco to sell and earns additional income to complement her family’s needs.

Unfortunately, her grocery business is not doing well during the rainy season because of the slippery road in front of her house. This is an obstacle for her to earn income and support her family.

Chhun Leang is leading a group of four to apply for a new Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy more kinds of grocery items to sell and attract more customers. This loan is the second loan cycle for her group and her family’s living has improved through the past loan.

She hopes to earn more money and be able to keep sending her child to school.

loans.use: to buy more kinds of grocery stock to attract more customers.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase brick, cement, and sand to build a large water basin.

loans.name: Yahuar -Cusco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “YAHUAR -CUSCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Madeliene ella es soltera y tiene 19 años ; La socia trabaja en su negocio de farmacia, la socia tiene una farmacia donde trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de farmacia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar medicamentos.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de le reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de internet, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de farmacia.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Yahuar- Cusco communal bank. This bank is located in Cusco district, which is part of Cusco province and Cusco department.

The member is Madeliene, she is single and is 19 years old. The member works in her pharmacy business, she has a pharmacy where she works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm. She already has had this business for several years and it is going very well for her. The member's dream is to expand the pharmacy business. The member asks for a loan to purchase medicines. 

The member who is attached to the group photo took the photo after the meeting because she had asked permission due to work reasons.

The other members work at an internet business, a clothing sales business, a grocery store business and a pharmacy business. 

The member is grateful to those who are part of this dream through this platform and promises to make her payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase medicines.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily, 32, is married to Joel, and she supports three children. She has been offering M-Pesa (a mobile phone-based money transfer service) to clients for the last eight years and the business earns her 15,000 KES per month. She has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase ATM machines for different banks and mobile phones to enable her to offer better and faster services to clients. She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and purchase a dairy cow for milk production so she can supply milk daily to clients and educate her children. Her hope is to expand her business sector and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase ATM machines for different banks and mobile phones.

loans.name: Emilya

texts.en:
Emilya has been involved in clothing sales for 15 years. She sells clothing from her house in Vanadzor, Armenia. Emilya lives alone because her only son works abroad. She likes her work and her customers. She always tries to keep her stock updated so her customers can have a variety of choices. 
Emilya has now been approved for a loan from SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. She asks lenders to help her to purchase a new stock of clothing to sell to customers. 
Emilya hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing to sell to customers

loans.name: Maa Hingulai Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Jyoti is 35 years old and a married woman. She is the mother of two children. She lives with them in miserable conditions in Kanagan village of Koraput district where this group exists. Jyoti's husband is the sole breadwinner of the family, and his income is very limited. He does not bring home enough to cover the needs of the family. 

The house where Jyoti and her family live lacks a toilet, and they depend upon the open field for defecation and urination. She wants to improve the living condition of the family. Jyoti is the one standing to the left in the photograph.

Unfortunately, she doesn't have enough money to do that. For this reason, she, along with her group member, Rajeswri, applied for a loan amount of 36,000 INR, from which she will use her portion of the loan amount in order to purchase a commode and some steel water pipes which will facilitate the water supply.

Jyoti looks forward to providing her family a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a commode and some steel water pipes

loans.name: Maa Hingulai Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Minakshi is 24 years old and is from the village Kanagan of Koraput district. She is standing to the left in the photograph. Her being a single parent is not easy, but through God's grace, she is able to overcome the challenge that goes with being a single mom. She has dedicated herself in raising her only child who is still in the elementary level in school. 

Minakshi is thankful that she has a general store business that really helps her earn to provide for their daily sustenance. A general store in the village is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Minakshi did not let the unfortunate incident she experienced deter her from becoming self-sufficient and successful in life.

The only thing that she lacks is a proper bathroom, which was damaged by the cyclonic storms last year. She, along with her group member, Lakshmi, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Minakshi will use her portion of the loan amount in order to renovate her bathroom to bring it to a better condition. She will install a new commode and renovate the rooftop of her bathroom.

Her only dream is to see her only child get a college education and be a professional someday.

loans.use: to install a new commode and renovate the rooftop of her bathroom.

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: Oun is a 25-year-old married factory worker with a dependent child in her care living in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a factory for over one year. Her husband is 27 years old, and he works as a construction foreman. Oun and her husband can earn about 17 USD per day. Oun is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work and for family use. This loan will help her have enough finances to buy a motorcycle, which will improve her traveling conditions. In the future, she is going to save money to renovate her house and support her child to go through high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work and family use

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and hens, and feed for them.

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LAS HORMIGUITAS.
La socia Tania continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de ladrillos, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de ladrillos entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por  el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus  cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Tania is a member of the communal bank called "Las Hormiguitas". Tania is still earning her living through her business of selling bricks. She is a responsible and diligent person. 

Tania continues to sell bricks to her clients that ask for them, which is how she is supporting her family. She is asking for the loan to buy bricks and other items. She is very grateful for the loan and she promises to fulfill her set re-payments.

loans.use: to buy bricks and other items.

loans.name: Morena Guadalupe

texts.es:
Morena, sabe la importancia de los créditos para ir mejorando su negocio, está solicitando un nuevo crédito para poder realizar la compra de fardos de ropa usada y nueva surtirá el inventario que ofrece a sus clientes, espera seguir contando con su fuente de ingresos familiar.
Agradece a Padecomsm y a los inversionistas kiva por el préstamo anterior, con dicho apoyo logro atraer nuevos clientes y abrir un nuevo punto de ventas, sus ingresos están mejorando y le permiten subsistir junto a su familia y cancelar con puntualidad las cuotas de la deuda.
texts.en: Morena understands the importance of loans to continue to improve her business. She is asking for a new loan to purchase bundles of old and new clothes to build up stock to offer her customers. She hopes to be able to continue to count on this as a source of income for her family. She is grateful to Padecomsm and Kiva investors for the previous loan.With this support, she was able to attract new customers and open a new sales location. Her income is improving allowing her to get by with her family and repay her debt on time.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of new and used clothing to build up stock to offer her customers .

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier es un hombre de 43 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 1 hija de 15 años, y su negocio es la encuadernación de textos.
Él es buen padre, emprendedor, constante, independiente, activo, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Max Paredes’ muy conocida por su feria mañanera; mujeres que se dedican al comercio por las mañanas, venden todo lo referido a prendas de vestir, desde abrigos hasta zapatos, todo de su propia confección y fabricación. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Javier es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al mismo negocio y con su hija que estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica, agua potable y alcantarillado. Su negocio es el servicio de encuadernado, él realiza encuadernados a tesis de universidades, cuadernos de colegios, actas de instituciones, registros de contabilidad, etc., actividad que realiza en su domicilio durante la semana, “tengo contrato con una facultad para encuadernar todos sus textos y necesito comprar cuerina y cartón…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con contratos, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de materiales de trabajo como, cuerina, cartón, pegamento, etc. Su sueño es amplia su tienda debido a que tiene bastantes pedidos, él desea realizar la compra de materiales de trabajo para la encuadernación de libros para cumplir con su contrato pendiente. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por  esos motivos que Javier solicita un préstamo para la compra de material de trabajo para la encuadernación de libros para cumplir con su contrato pendiente.
texts.en:
Javier is a 43 year old man who lives with her wife. They have one daughter who is 15 years old, and his business is in the binding of texts.

He is a good father, entrepreneurial, consistent, independent, active, responsible and hardworking. His work is done in the region 'Max Paredes', which is well known for its morning show of women who engage in trade during the mornings. They sell everything related to clothing, from coats to shoes, all of their own making and manufacturing. This area has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 0-12 degrees Celsius.

Javier is of dark complexion with black eyes and short brown hair, short stature and a thin physique. His mother tongue is Aymará which he speaks with his family, and he speaks Spanish in general culture and for his business. He shares his life with his wife who makes a living in the same business, and with his daughter who studies in school. They live in their own home made of adobe with a tin roof and electric energy, potable water and sewage. His business is in the service of bookbinding. He makes bindings of university theses, college notebooks, records of institutions, accounting records, etc., which he does at home during the week. "I have a contract with a faculty to bind all of their texts and I need to buy imitation leather and cardboard", he says. The advantage of his business is that he has contracts, and the disadvantage is that he lacks the capital for the purchase of work materials such as imitation leather, cardboard, glue, etc. His dream is to expand his store because he has enough orders. He wants to purchase work materials for the binding of books in order to fulfill his pending contract. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the 5 years that he has been doing this activity.

It is for these reasons that Javier is requesting a loan for the purchase of works materials for the binding of book in order to fulfill his pending contract.

loans.use: to purchase work materials for book bindings to complete his pending contract.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LAS HORMIGUITAS.
La socia Victoria continua  con el negocio de venta de ladrillos, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de ladrillos entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por  el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus  cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Victoria belongs to the communal bank "Las Hormiguitas". Victoria is still earning a living through her business selling bricks. She is a responsible and diligent person.
Victoria continues to sell bricks to her clients when they order them, which is how she supports her family. She is asking for a loan to buy bricks and other items. Victoria is grateful for the loan and promises to fulfill all her set repayments.

loans.use: to buy bricks and other items.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia Paulina pertenece al banco comunal LAS HORMIGUITAS, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Paulina sigue con su negocio de materiales de construcción, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua vendiendo  ladrillos, cementos y bloquetas, la socia vende a sus clientes  que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de bloquetas entre otros.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the "Las Hormiguitas" communcal bank, which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name. Paulina continues with her business selling construction materials. She is grateful for the loan granted and is committed to making her loan repayments on time. She continues selling bricks, cement, and cinder blocks.

Paulina sells to her customers who request her materials, in order to support her family. She is requesting the loan to buy bocks and other materials.

loans.use: to buy blocks.

loans.name: Maa Hingulai Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Pratima is a 35-year-old separated woman who lives in a small village in the Koraput district of Odisha state, India.The lady standing to the right in the photo is  Pratima. She married a farmer and from this relationship, has two children. Her children are all adults and one still lives with her. Pratima has a store in her home and sells all types of grocery and general store products like rice, sugar, oils, detergents, fruits and vegetables and other items. She works everyday from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. and sometimes even later. 

Pratima, along with her group member, Lakshmi, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Pratima's portion of this loan will be used to buy a hand pump. The water supply in her area is very erratic and irregular for which she faces a lot of difficulties to complete her household chores. Installation of a hand pump will increase her convenience. She is in need of your help.

loans.use: to buy a hand pump

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
El socio  pertenece al banco comunal LAS HORMIGUITAS, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Rafael  continua dedicándose a realizar transporte de  materiales de construcción, el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a  este negocio el cual leva bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio  solicita el crédito para la compra de  cemento entre otros.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the communal bank Las Hormiguitas. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Rafael continues to dedicate himself to the transport of construction materials. He takes good time engaging in this business which is doing well thanks to the effort he puts in each day to his business. He wants to continue working for in this way he can continue to support his family.

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of cement, among others.

loans.use: for the purchase of cement among others.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LAS HORMIGUITAS.
La socia Roxana  continúa con su negocio de venta de ladrillos, la socia se siente agradecida por  el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus  cuotas establecidas, la socia continua vendiendo  a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cementos entre otros.
texts.en:
Roxana belongs to the communal bank "Las Hormiguitas". Roxana is still earning a living through her business selling bricks. She is very grateful for the loan and promises to fulfill her set repayments. 

Roxana continues to sell to her clients when they order, which is how she supports her family. She is a responsible and diligent person. She is asking for the loan to buy cement and other items.

loans.use: to buy cement and other items. .

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, iron, cement, sand and gravel to begin building the walls of her home.

loans.name: Norma Maribel

texts.es:
Norma ha decidido a solicitar un nuevo crédito para comprar maíz, leña y gas, para preparar la venta de tortilla y pupusas, el propósito de la nueva inversión es continuar trabajando y mejorando el servicio que ofrece a sus clientes.
La ayuda que tuvo con el crédito anterior le ha dado un resultado positivo, cuenta con nuevos clientes, mejores ingresos y un estilo de vida más digno. Agradece el apoyo recibido.
texts.en: Norma has decided to apply for a new loan to purchase corn, firewood, and gas, for preparing tortilla and pupusas for sale. The proposal of the new investment is to continue working and improving the services that she offers to her customers. The help of the previous loan has given her positive results, and she now counts on new customers, better income, and a more decent style of life. She is grateful for the support she received.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, and gas, for preparing tortilla and pupusas for sale

loans.name: Jinna

texts.en:
Jinna hails from the town of Maribojoc, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (variety store) business.  She sells various merchandise ranging from biscuits, noodles, and canned goods to powdered soap, shampoo, seasonings and beverages.  

Jinna is a 43-year-old married woman with four dependents. Her oldest child is 17 years old and the youngest is 12. She has been running her sari-sari store for six years now. She needs additional capital to sustain her on-going livelihood. 

She is asking for a loan to buy soft drinks and liquor. With these, she will be able to provide a better variety of stocks to choose from, which will attract more buyers to come shop at her store. Her daily earnings would improve, and she would then be able to settle her obligations and expand her business as well.

Jinna is determined enough that she can improve her sari-sari store to become spacious enough to accommodate more customers and to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and liquor

loans.name: Genibeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Genibeth works hard to support her family.

She has an entertainment business offering videoke and video game stations in the Philippines. She also earns income from food vending. Genibeth is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy another karaoke machine for her entertainment business.

Genibeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy another unit of karaoke machine for her business

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria, requiere de un nuevo crédito para poder pagar los costos de remodelación del local en que está ubicado el comedor, así como también repara algunas mesas y sillas, el objetivo es atender con mejor comodidad a sus clientes y mantener estabilidad económica.
Al invertir el crédito anterior pudo contar con la materia prima necesaria para seguir elaborando la comida para venderla, anteriormente solo vendía almuerzos hoy ha incluido la venta de desayunos debido a la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Candelaria requires a new loan to pay for the remodeling costs of her cafeteria, as well as to fix some tables and chairs. The objective is to attend her customers with improved comfort, and to maintain economic stability.

By investing the previous loan, she could purchase the necessary raw ingredients to continue preparing food for sale. Before she only sold lunches, but now she has included breakfast sales due to the demand of her clients.

loans.use: to repair the cafeteria and some tables and chairs

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Brenda is 40 years old and has three children who are presently in school.

Brenda has a fishing business in the Philippines. Brenda requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Brenda has been in this business for six years. She would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Melinda works hard to support her family.

She has a bakery business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from a water refilling station. Melinda is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients like flour, sugar and other materials for her food production.

Melinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like flour, sugar and other materials for her food production

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 52 years old and married with six children. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines, and she is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pig.

Beverly has been in this business for 14 years and also earns income from weaving. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Soy's Group

texts.en:
Soy, a farmer living in the Chhloung district of Kratie Province, is 52 years old and a married mother of four children, two of whom are in school. Her main business is growing cassava. Meanwhile, she also grows soybeans to earn supplemental income. 

Because she lacks capital, she has applied for this loan, which her second time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She repaid her past loan successfully, and it has enabled her to better support her family’s needs. This time, she will use her loan to buy soybean seeds for her additional business, to increase her crop products. She hopes that the crop generates more output than before, so that she can earn more income to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to buy soybean seeds for her additional business, to increase her crop products.

loans.name: Dúo Elim De Cañadas Group

texts.es:
DUO ELOHIM
Es conformado por doña Nohelia, ella reside en San Juan Sacatepéquez  desde ya varios años, motivo por lo cual es conocida en el lugar como una persona  comerciantes o negociantes, doña Nohelia líder del grupo, se dedica  a la repostería desde ya varios años, ella viaja diariamente al mercado  de la localidad para lograr vender sus pasteles y ofrecer en su casa a toda hora diferentes tipos de pasteles, en esta ocasión solicita capital para la compra en cantidades mayores de harina, azúcar, huevos, leche,  y así mismo otros ingredientes para su negocio, espera que la puedan ayudar con el crédito solicitado.
texts.en:
DUO ELOHIM consists of Doña Nohelia, who has been living in San Juan Sacatepéquez since many years ago and is known in the region as a merchant or a businesswoman. She is the leader of the group. 

She has worked in confectionery for a long time. She travels daily to the local market to sell her cakes, and also offers different types of cakes at her house at all hours. This time, she applies for the loan to purchase a greater quantity of flour, sugar, eggs, milk, and other ingredients for her business. She hopes that she could receive the help of the loan requested.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making cakes for sale

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is married and works hard to support her family. She does business buying and selling cashew nuts in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to replenish her stock of cashew nuts to sell.

Leonisa has been in this business for five years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cashew nuts to sell

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en:
Jenefer is 26 years old and single with three children, two of whom are currently in school. Jenefer works very hard to provide for them.

Jenefer runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, and cooking oil.

Jenefer has been in this business for two years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
José, tiene un negocio de venta de madera fina como cedro, roble, pino etc., además fabrica diferentes muebles, trabaja todos los días, de esta manera puede generar ingresos para cumplir con sus obligaciones, vive con su esposa de 30 años y sus hijos de 10 y 7 años de edad, viven una misma casa y todos colaboran en el negocio.
Invertirá el crédito en la compra de madera, repuestos para el equipo, barniz, entre otros materiales importantes para mantener la carpintería equipada, fortalecerá el negocio para aumentar la productividad de muebles y atender a sus clientes, espera que las demandas sean mayores para que las ganancias que genere le sirvan para cancelar la deuda.
Las aspiraciones son ampliar su negocio para tener una fuente de ingresos permanente para ayudar a sus hijos a que culmine una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
José has a business selling fine wood such as cedar, oak, pine, etc. He also makes different pieces of furniture. He works every day to earn money to meet his commitments. He lives with his 30-year-old wife and his children aged 10 and 7. They live together and all help out with the business.

José will invest the loan in buying wood, spare equipment parts, varnish, and other important materials to keep the carpentry workshop well-stocked. He will strengthen the business to increase the production of furniture and attend his customers. He hopes that his orders will increase so that he can pay off his debt with the profits he makes.

His dreams are to expand his business, so as to have a permanent source of income to support his children to study at university.

loans.use: to buy wood, spare equipment parts, varnish, and other important materials to keep the carpentry workshop well-stocked.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is 28 years old and married with three children. With two of her children in school, Marichu works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like rice, canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Marichu has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like rice, canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 55 years old and married, with three children who are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Alma is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy piglets and materials to repair a pigpen.

Alma has been raising pigs for one year and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money, so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy piglets and materials to repair a pigpen.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 52 years old and widowed with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store, like eggs, beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Fe has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like eggs, beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement and sand to plaster the walls of her home.

loans.name: Gerarda

texts.en:
Gerarda caters cosmetology services including manicure and pedicure services. She is a 55-year-old married woman with four children. Her youngest child is 14 and the other three children are already grown up.

She has been in the cosmetology business for more than 20 years now and is in need of capital to finance her source of income.

She is asking for a loan to buy materials like nail polish, cuticle remover, cotton and nipper. With these materials, she could provide quality services and be able to attend her customers' requests on time.

This would enable her to settle her obligation as well as augment her income, which would help her to start investing in another possible business venture. Thus she could continue to send her youngest child to school and provide better living conditions.

In the future, Gerarda is planning to open up a sari-sari (variety) store to become more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy materials like nail polish, cuticle remover, cotton and nipper

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 31 years old with one child.

Marissa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Marissa has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 16 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Marissa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 27 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Jonalyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Jonalyn has been in pig fattening for one year and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa is a married woman with three children. Melissa is 33 years old and two of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Melissa has a mat weaving business in the Philippines.She has been in this business for 5 years. Melissa requested a PHP 6,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like used garments or fabric for her business.

In the future, Melissa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like used garments or fabric for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una sala de belleza ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 5 años y gracias a su trabajo es como ha podido salir adelante con los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella esta solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para la compra de cremas, shampoo, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
This young woman, whose face is pixelated because she is 25 years old and lives in a high-risk area, has had a beauty salon located near her home for the past 5 years. Thanks to her hard work she has been able to deal with the household expenses. The woman lives in her own home with her partner. 

She is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL to buy lotions, shampoo, hair clips and scissors, among other things that she needs. This will allow her to create more income and will help her to have more economic stability.

loans.use: to buy lotions, shampoo, hair clips and scissors, among other things.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es: Ernestina de 29 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, una niña de 11 años y un varón de 4 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se desempeña desde hace siete años como agricultora en cultivo y venta de maíz y frijol el cual lo distribuye en los alrededores de su comunidad y con sus vecinos, además su compañero de vida se desempaña como electricista logrando aportar a la economía familiar por medio de su trabajo. Con el crédito anterior Ernestina logro encementar el piso de su casa pero el monto no le alcanzo para repellar las paredes por eso está solicitando un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para invertirlo en cemento y arena para afinar las paredes de su hogar y así vivir en una casa más bonita y segura espera contar nuevamente con la ayuda de este crédito y continuar con la mejora lo más pronto posible.
texts.en: Ernestina is 29 years old. She lives with her life partner and their two children, an 11-year-old girl and a 4-year-old boy. Ernestina is a hard working woman who has served for over 7 years as a farmer cultivating and selling corn and beans which she distributes in the outskirts of her community and among her neighbors. In addition, her life partner works as an electrician who provides economic support for the family through his work. Ernestina completed the cementing of the floor in her home with the previous loan, but the amount was not enough to complete the repair of the walls. Because of this she is seeking a new loan from FUSAI to invest in the cement and sand needed to repair the walls of her home so that she can live in a more attractive and safe house. She hopes she can again count on the help from this loan to continue with the improvements as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase cement and sand to repair the walls of her home.

loans.name: Danis Esau

texts.es:
Danis, se mantiene  trabajando en el taller de reparaciones de electrodomésticos y llevando el sustento diario a su hogar, lo ha logrado con la ayuda de créditos, manifiesta que su nueva situación económica le permite cumplir con todos sus compromisos.
Necesita de un nuevo crédito para comprar una res que tiene el valor de $300.00 el resto le servirá para cancelar el capital pendiente del crédito anterior, cree que de esta manera seguirá ampliando su negocio y progresando junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Danis is still working in the electronic appliance repair shop and taking the daily sustenance to his home. He has been able to do this with the help of loans. His new economic situation allows him to fulfill all of his commitments. 

He needs a new loan to buy a cow that costs $300.00. The rest of the loan will be used to pay off the pending capital from a previous loan. He believes that in this way he will continue expanding his business and improving alongside his family.

loans.use: to buy a cow that costs $300.00 and pay off the pending capital from a previous loan.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new griddle to make pupusas.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia es una gran mujer, que trabaja con mucha dedicación y esmero con el afán de brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida, ella cuenta que a Dios gracias con el apoyo que recibió del crédito logro realizar la remodelación de su casa y su familia ya tiene un hogar más digno, pero Cecilia no es conformista y para mejorar sus ingresos ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un nuevo crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de un toro  para criarlo y luego venderlo. Cecilia guarda las esperanzas de conseguir el crédito para seguir prosperando y construir otra casa.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a great woman, who works with a lot of dedication and hard work to provide her family with better living conditions. She says that thanks to God, with the support she received from her previous loan, she was able to renovate her home and her family now have a better place to live.

However, Cecilia is not complacent, and to increase her earnings she has made the decision to request a new loan which she will invest in buying a bull to raise and then sell. Cecilia hopes that she will be granted the loan so that she can continue to proper and build another home.

loans.use: to buy a bull to raise.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 53 years old, married, and a mother of six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training on enterprise development. 

She practices mixed farming, especially vegetables farming and dairy. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy onion seeds to boost her vegetables production and earn more income. This will enable her to support her children’s education by paying school fees and buying study materials. 

Patricia is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds to boost her vegetables production and earn more income to support her children's education.

loans.name: Karen Milena

texts.es: Karen es una universitaria de 29 años de edad que inició su vida comercial en el colegio donde estudiaba, su mamá quien también se dedica a esta misma actividad, le propuso que vendiera a sus compañeras diademas, cintas, moñas, hebillas, pulseras, cadenas y fue todo un éxito, desde entonces, continuó con su negocio pero con un surtido mucho mayor como prendas de vestir y calzado.  Semanalmente asigna un espacio para ofrecer a sus clientes las mercancías, ella cuenta con una buena base de clientes a quienes les brinda facilidad de pago. En realidad su carisma y compromiso han permitido que día tras día gane más participación entre sus conocidos y amigos, por eso está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en la compra de jeans, suéteres y calzado.  Para Karen su prioridad es terminar sus estudios e inaugurar su almacén, así mismo con el fruto de su trabajo comprar una vivienda y ofrecerle una buena educación a sus dos hijas.
texts.en: Karen is a 29-year-old university student who began her commercial life at the high school where she studied. Her mother is works in the same field. She suggested that Karen should sell headbands, belts, bows, buckles, bracelets and chains to her friends, which was very successful. Since then she continued with her business, but with a greater variety of products such as clothing and shoes. Each week she establishes a space to offer her customers the merchandise. Karen counts on a good customer base to whom she provides easy ways to pay. Currently, her charisma and commitment have allowed her to gain more participation from her acquaintances and friends each day. Because of this she is applying for her first Kiva loan through the intermediary Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to invest in the purchase of jeans, sweaters and shoes. For Karen, her priority is to complete her studies and to open a store herself. Likewise, with the fruit of her labor she will purchase a home and provide a good education to her two daughters.

loans.use: to purchase jeans, sweaters and shoes.

loans.name: Tupo Kiliba Group

texts.fr: Intéressé par sa famille, Sadi s'est lancé dans la riziculture. Il constate que la récolte lui facilite la scolarisation de ses enfants.
