Vu les difficultés financières qu'il a actuellement, il sollicite ce crédit pour prendre en charge les travaux de sarclage et l'achat des engrais. Il a pour perspective de financer la scolarité de ses enfants, acheter une parcelle, améliorer son habitat et démarrer  une activité commerciale. Président du groupe TUPO KILIBA, il tient sur la photo un carnet rose.
texts.en: After gaining an interest for this work from his family, Sadi started up his own rice-growing venture. Harvesting this grain allows him to send his children to school. Given the financial difficulties he currently faces, he is requesting this loan in order to pay for the labor to hoe his fields and to purchase fertilizer. His goal is to pay for his children to go to school, purchase a plot of land, improve his household and start up a commercial business. He is the president of the Tupo Kiliba Group. He is the man in the photo holding the pink card.

loans.use: to pay for labor to hoe the fields and purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Kiliba 15 Group

texts.fr: Joseph, président du groupe KILIBA 15, a appris la culture du riz de ses parents. Très souvent buté par l'insuffisance de moyens, les maladies du paddy et le manque de marché pour la vente;il souhaite améliorer son foyer dans l'avenir grâce à cette activité. Il est sur photo entouré de deux autres membres du groupe.
texts.en: Joseph, the president of the Kiliba 15 Group, learned how to cultivate rice from his parents. He very often encounters difficulties such as a lack of capital, crop blights and a lack of buyers for his produce. In the future, he hopes to be able to improve his household thanks to this activity. He is the man in the photo standing between two other group members.

loans.use: to maintain their land, purchase fertilizer and phytosanitary products, as well as pay for labor costs

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra es una mujer de 46 años de edad, divorciada, tiene 2 hijos de 16 y 26 años, y su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, buena oyente, optimista, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘Sirari’ caracterizada por su intensa actividad económica que generó el asentamiento de los mercados más grandes de innumerables galerías y locales comerciales. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados. 
Sandra es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello largo negro lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hijos; el mayor trabaja y el menor estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio, de lunes a domingo en horas del día, “mi tienda es la que alimenta a mi familia, si mi ventas mejoran mi familia también mejora…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas diarias y clientes continuos, la desventaja es la falta de capital para surtir con mercadería variada su negocio. Su sueño es mejorar sus ingresos para que su hijo estudie, ella desea realizar la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 13 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Sandra solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería variada para surtir su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos para que hijo estudie.
texts.en:
Sandra is 46 years old, divorced with two sons aged 16 and 26. She runs a business selling foodstuffs and staples in her neighborhood shop. She is a good mother, enterprising, a good listener, optimistic, patient, hard working and responsible. 

Her business operates in the Sirari neighborhood, characterized by intense economic activity generated by the arrival of large markets, countless  shopping malls  and commercial premises.The daytime temperatures vary between 21 and 35 centigrade in the hot sub tropical climate. 

Sandra is brunette, with brown eyes, tied long black hair, of short stature and medium build.Her mother tongue is guaraní which is spoken in the area, generally she speaks Spanish and uses it in her business. She shares her life with her sons; the elder works and the younger is at school. They live in their own house built of brick and cement with a corrugated metal roof and concrete floor. The house features drinking water, electricity and sewerage.

Sandra makes a living selling foods and staples from her neighborhood shop which opens during the day seven days a week. " My shop feeds my family and if my sales improve then so does my family" remarks Sandra. The advantage of her business is that it features regular customers and daily sales. However  the lack of capital to invest in stocking up with merchandise disadvantages her business. 

Sandra's dream is to improve her income so that her son can study. She wants to stock up with merchandise for her business. This is the first time that she has asked the institution for a loan in 13 years of trading.Sandra is asking for loan to purchase merchandise to stock up her business so she can improve her income and allow her son to study.

loans.use: to buy a variety of merchandise to stock up her business and improve her income so that her son can study.

loans.name: Rosaly

texts.en:
Rosaly is 43 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

In the future Rosaly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Marilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Marilyn is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo,  tiene la edad de 46 años, esta casado y actualmente vive con su esposa y dos hijos. Él tiene pensado comprar productos necesarios para la asistencia de café los cuales serían abono, herbicidas, fungicidas y además pagar mano de obra que la actividad implica, la experiencia que tiene en esta actividad es de más de 20 años, el pretende mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia por medio de las ganancias económicas que se van a obtener por la venta del producto y también fortalecer la producción del café. Él actualmente  ha recibido varios créditos de FUDECOSUR, nunca antes había trabajado con otros Bancos Estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés mucho más baja.
texts.en: Eduardo is 46 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and two children. He is thinking of purchasing the products he needs to assist his coffee crops like manure, herbicide, fungicide and pay for labor to care for his crops. He has more than 20 years of experience in this business, He wants to improve his family's quality of living through the financial profits which he will receive with the sale of his product and also strengthen his coffee production. He has had several previous loans from FUDECOSUR, but has never worked with the State banks. FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with better conditions and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to look after his coffee crops.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs for her pig fattening business.

Leonora has been in this business for 5 years. Leonora earns additional income from food vending.

Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Jerusalem Group

texts.fr: Aidé par les membres de sa famille, Gombe a commencé la culture du paddy en 2005 sur un champ de petite superficie. cette activité attire son enthousiasme pendant la période de la récolte car il gagne beaucoup d'argent; toutefois il y a constat de manque d'eau, du vol de semences par les oiseaux et l'absence de gardiens. Le groupe JERUSALEM dont, il est président, compte lever le défi en devenant le premier producteur de paddy dans le secteur où il oeuvre . À la longue, ils vont varier les semences et produire en quantité comme en qualité. Ils sont sûrs que cela procurera la joie à leurs familles et les enfants pourront cette fois-ci aller à l'école. Sur photo, Gombe tient dans ses mains un carnet rose.
texts.en: Assisted by members of his family, Gombe started up his own rice paddies in 2005 on a small plot of land. His enthusiasm for this work really shows during the harvest season because he can earn a lot of money. However, he still lacks water, birds eat his seeds and he doesn't employ any security. The Jerusalem Group, of which he is its president, wants to rise to the challenge and become the top rice producer in the local area. Over time, they will plant various different seeds and grow quality produce in greater quantities. They are sure that this will make their families happy and their children will finally be able to attend school. Gombe is the man holding the pink card in the photo.

loans.use: to pay for the labor costs to hoe the fields, transplant and harvest some of the crops, as well as purchase phytosanitary products and fertilizer

loans.name: Marysella

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Marysella, 26 years old, with three dependents. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2014. She has undergone enterprise and financial management training offered by HiH EA.

Her economic activity is maize and beans farming. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer that will in turn increase her harvest and hence increase sales. Therefore, her living standard will be improved so that she will be able to educate her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders and will repay her loan in good time.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs (e.g., fertilizer) to improve productivity which will enable her to educate her children

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es: La señora  Beatriz Elizabeth se dedica a la venta de tamáles, paches,como también vende cosméticos en general, colchas, trastos varios desde hace 25 años y es vendedora ambulante de su colonia.  Su sueño es poner un local en su casa, para no caminar mucho.  Sus ventas han crecido pero le hacen falta varias cosas que comprar como el tomate, papa, especies, hojas de tamal para la elaboración de los tamales y el dinero que tiene no le alcanza, por tal motivo necesita otro préstamo porque tiene varios pedidos que entregar y en grandes cantidades.
texts.en: Señora  Beatriz Elizabeth has made a living selling tamales and paches, meat- or vegetable-filled corn cakes wrapped in a leaf and steamed, as well as cosmetics, quilts, and other items for the past 25 years. She sells these goods on a mobile basis in her town. Her dream is to set up a premises in her home, so that she doesn't have to walk as much. Her sales have risen but she needs to buy certain items such as tomatoes, potatoes, spices and laves to make tamales, and she doesn't have enough money for this. For this reason, she needs another loan because she has various large orders she needs to fulfill.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make tamales to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 23 years old, single, and has one child.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Mercy requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Mercy has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Rechel

texts.en:
Rechel is 31 years old, married, and has four children, all of whom attend school. Rechel works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy rice, canned goods, and other groceries.

Rechel has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Rechel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy rice, canned goods, and other groceries

loans.name: Twebaguma Group

texts.fr: Jadis, Kabanga était vendeur d'articles d'habillement, sa boutique a été pillé systématiquement pendant la guerre de 1998. Il s'est converti en riziculteur en l'an 2000 car c'est une activité très pratiquée dans le milieu. Cela lui a permet de relever les défis au niveau de sa famille avec le peu de sou qu'il lui restait encore. Pourtant ses moyens sont encore insuffisants pour financer personnellement toutes étapes de son activité. Il projette exploiter une superficie de 5 hectares, gagner le marché de grands consommateurs de riz pour écouler aisément le produit à partir duquel il pourra scolariser ses enfants jusqu'au niveau universitaire et vivre dans de bonnes conditions. Il préside le groupe TWEBAGUMA et porte un chapeau rouge sur photo.
texts.en: Before, when Kabanga sold articles of clothing, his shop was systematically pillaged during the war of 1998. He became a rice farmer in 2000, as it is a popular business in the area. This allowed him to meet the challenges of supporting his family with the little money he had left. But his income is still insufficient to finance all the stages of his business by himself. He plans to make use of five hectares of surface area, and generate a market of large rice consumers to buy his product. From this he will be able to send his children to school up to university, and live in good conditions. He presides over the TWEBAGUMA group and wears a red cap in the photo.

loans.use: to buy phytosanitary products, and hoeing/gardening/harvesting supplies.

loans.name: Emma Aracely

texts.es: Emma Aracely es originaria del área de san Martin Jilotepeque y desde hace más de diez años vende calzado plástico como lo son botas plásticas, Tarugos plásticos, ginas para damas y una extensa variedad de calzado plástico para niños. Solicita el crédito debido a la temporada de invierno ya que es una época en que la gente compra calzado de plástico para protegerse de la lluvia, ella aprovecha siempre esa temporada para surtir aún más su negocio y aumentar sus ingresos para seguir dando a sus hijas estudio y sueña con que se lleguen a graduar y por ello es que lucha diariamente junto a su esposo. Ha sido usuaria de Fape y ha demostrado buen record de pago.
texts.en: Emma Aracely is originally from the area of San Martin Jilotepeque. She has sold plastic footwear such as wellington boots, clogs and women's sandals, and a wide variety of plastic shoes for children for over ten years. She is requesting a loan because it is winter, a season during which more people buy plastic footwear for protection from the rain. She always takes advantage of this season to fill her stand with more stock and boost her earnings, so that she can continue to pay for her daughters' education. She dreams that they will be able to graduate, and  this is what she works towards every day alongside her husband. She has taken out loans from FAPE [Kiva Field Partner] before and has a good repayment record.

loans.use: to buy plastic footwear.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
Rodrigo es un hombre de 64 años de edad, soltero, tiene un hijo de 19 años, y su negocio es la producción y comercio de helado.
Él es buen padre, optimista, solidario, paciente, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Santiago de la caya’ sitio caracterizado por encontrarse sobre una ladera de la ciudad, donde las calles son pendientes y empinadas. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Rodrigo es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hijo que se encuentra realizando el servicio militar, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica, agua potable y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la elaboración de helados; él aprendio el oficio de sus padres, sus inicios fueron con un capital mínimo y con el tiempo fue creciendo su cartera de clientes que solicitaban mayor cantidad, actualmente trabaja con la ayuda de su hijo, el mismo solo sale los fines de semana porque el resto del tiempo se encuentra en el cuartel, en el futuro el seguirá los mismos pasos de su padre, “mis clientes constantes son, escuelas y colegios, también estamos entrando a las universidades…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con contratos, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de una motocicleta para distribuir su producto. Su sueño es que su hijo se haga cargo del negocio y contrate empleados, él desea realizar la compra de una motocicleta para distribuir sus helados para que su hijo se haga cargo del negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por  esos motivos que Rodrigo solicita un préstamo para la compra de una motocicleta para distribuir sus helados para cumplir con sus contratos pendientes.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is 64 years old and the single father of a 19-year old son. He earns his living making and selling ice cream. He is a good father--positive, solid, patient, responsible and very hardworking. He works in the Santiago de la Caya area in a part of the town known for its steep sloping streets. The climate is cold and dry with a daily temperature that varies between 0 and 12C. 

Rodrigo is dark skinned with brown eyes and short black hair. He is short and slender. His mother tongue is Aymará which he uses at home, but he also speaks Spanish for cultural and business purposes. His son lives with him and is doing his military service. They live in their own home built of adobe with a corrugated sheet roof. It has electricity, drinking water, and a sewage system.

Rodrigo learnt how to make ice cream from his parents. He started his business with a small amount of capital, but as time went by his customer base grew and more ice cream was ordered. His son helps him with the business at weekends as the rest of the time he is in the barracks. In the future he wants to follow in his father's footsteps.

Rodrigo's regular customers are schools, colleges, and universities. One advantage of his business is that he has contracts in place, but a disadvantage is his lack of capital to buy a motorcycle to distribute the ice cream. His dream is for his son to take over the business and hire staff.

Rodrigo is seeking a loan to buy a motorcycle for delivering  his ice cream orders. This is his first loan with the institution in the 15 years he has had his business.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle to deliver his ice cream orders

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in all colors of paint, base coat paint, hammers, solvent, oxy-acetylene welding equipment, catalyst, etc.

loans.name: Générosité Group

texts.fr: Chimana est commerçante, conseillère la banque communautaire «Générosité», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 58 ans, mariée, mère de 10 enfants dont 4 étudient et 6 sont mariés. Elle est vendeuse des pagnes de première qualité  dans un  marché de la place depuis son jeune âgé. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de ses parents. Elle va acheter 15 pièces de pagnes super wax. Elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Chimana is a business owner, a counselor for the community bank "Générosité," (Generosity), and a client of IMF Hekima. She is 58 years old, married, and mother to 10 children, 4 of whom are students and 6 of whom are married. She has sold high quality loincloths in a local market since she was young. She started her business with funds from her parents. She will buy 15 pieces of super wax loincloths. She hopes to increase her capital, feed her children, and send them to school. Finally, she thanks Hekima for the support afforded to unbankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 15 pieces of super wax loincloths.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy loincloths, dresses, shoes, singlets, and undergarments.

loans.name: Jorge Antonio

texts.es: Jorge es un hombre de 28 años de edad que siempre busca la manera de salir adelante, es por ello que hace doce años se dedica al cultivo de pipián y maíz. Él vive junto a su esposa  y sus tres hijos de 12, 7 y 5 años de edad. Jorge desea aumentar la siembra en su negocio pero  ya que con el capital propio no alcanza a invertir para aumentar  sus cultivo y poder cumplir la demanda de sus clientes con la que cuenta,  ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito  a FUSAI el cual le permita invertir en insumos para la actividad del cultivo de maíz y pipián tales como:  abono, pesticidas, fertilizantes, etc. para poder aumentar su producción en el negocio y cumplir con la demanda de productos que sus clientes solicitan y de esta forma obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Jorge is a 28-year-old man who always looks for ways to move forwards. This is why, twelve years ago, he began growing pipian squash and corn. He lives with his wife and three children aged 12, 7 and 5. Jorge wants to plant more crops, but since he doesn't have enough money to do this, and to meet his customers' demands, he has made the decision to request a loan from FUSAI. He wants to invest this in inputs to grow corn and pipian, such as compost, pesticides, fertilisers, etc. to increase his business output and meet the demand for products requested by his customers and as a result, boost his earnings.

loans.use: to invest in compost, pesticides, fertilisers, etc. to increase his business output.

loans.name: Illary - Chaska Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “ILLARY CHASKA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Diana Mercedes ella es casada y tiene 50 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja como profesora del nivel primario, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un negocio para vender la ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz y azucar para su casa.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de zapatos, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are members of the "Illary Chaska" communiy bank, located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

One member is Diana Mercedes. She is 50 years old, married, and has two children. She works as a primary school teacher, from 8am to 2pm. She has had the job for eight years, and it is going very well. Her dream us to have a business selling clothing. She is requesting the loan to buy rice and sugar for her home.

The members in the smaller photographs within the group photo had their pictures taken after the meeting as they were unable to attend for work reasons. 

The other members of the group make a living selling shoes, clothing, groceries, and meals in a restaurant.

Diana Mercedes is grateful to those who have contributed to her dream by giving to Kiva, and is committed to making her loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar for her home.

loans.name: Sauvetage Group

texts.fr: Cathy est une femme d’affaires, présidente de la banque villageoise Sauvetage, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 39 ans, mère de 3 enfants tous vont à l’école. Elle est vendeuse des divers médicaments modernes dans une pharmacie dans la ville depuis 4 ans. Elle commença son busines avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle va acheter des antibiotiques, des sérums et anti inflammatoires. Elle souhaite accroitre son activité, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Cathy is a businesswoman, the president of the banque villageoise Sauvetage ("Rescue"), and a client of IMF Hekima. She is 39 years old and a mother to three children, all of whom go to school. She has sold various modern medications in a pharmacy in the city for 4 years. She started her business with funds from her husband. She will buy antibiotics, serums, and anti-inflammatory drugs. She hopes to increase her business, feed her children, and send them to school. Finally, she thanks Hekima for the support afforded to unbankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy antibiotics, serums, and anti-inflammatory drugs.

loans.name: La Réponse Group

texts.fr: Karungu est commerçante, membre de la banque communautaire «La Réponse», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 45 ans, mariée, mère des 7 enfants qui tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse des souliers usagés dans un marché de la ville depuis 19 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari, qui est couturier. Elle va acheter 300 paires de souliers. Elle souhaite augmenter son capital scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Karungu is a business owner, a member of the community bank "La Réponse" (The Response), and a client of IMF Hekima. She is 45 years old, married, and a mother to seven children, all of whom are students. She has sold used shoes in a village market for 19 years. She started her business with funds from her husband, who is a tailor. She will buy 300 pairs of shoes. She hopes to increase her capital, feed her children, and send them to school. Finally, she thanks Hekima for the support afforded to unbankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 300 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José tiene 25 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto a su madre de 53 años de edad quien es madre soltera. José agradece a su madre por haberle dado la vida y además le da las gracias por haberlo sacado adelante en sus estudios, por lo que ahora es él quien mantiene la economía del hogar. José tiene un pequeño negocio de crianza y venta de cerdos y también destaza desde hace cinco años por lo  cual se ha convertido en  su principal fuente de ingresos. José debido a que es un negocio rentable que le genera buenas ingresos económicos ha decidido aumentar la producción  su negocio por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de: cerdos, vitaminas concentradas, suero, etc., para de esta forma aumentar las ventas y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: José is 25 years old, and lives at home with his mother who is 53 years old and a single mother.  José is grateful to his mother for having given him life and moreover, he gives her thanks for helping him in his studies, so now it is he who maintains the household economics.  For the past five years, José has had a small business raising and selling pigs and he also butchers them, and this has become his main source of income.  Due to the fact that his business is profitable and generates good economic income, José has decided to increase his production, which is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of pigs, concentrated vitamins, serum, etc. and in this way, increase his sales and have better earnings.

loans.use: to invest in pigs, concentrated vitamins, serum, etc. and in this way, increase his sales and have better earnings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheeting, wooden poles, pins and screws to build a hallway in her home.

loans.name: 09-Jun-21 Group

texts.es:
Delia es una mujer de 33 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijas de 2 meses, 7, 10 y 12 años, y su negocio es la venta de verduras.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, fuerte, luchadora, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en un mercado muy conocido en el centro de la ciudad; uno de los más tradicionales donde se encuentran todo tipo de productos como; verduras, frutas, abarrotes. Consta de varias cuadras de la calle al aire libre conformada por varios puestos de venta, que gentilmente las caseritas y caseritos van a atenderlos con mucho esmero. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Delia es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, usa coronas en los dientes, complexión física robusta, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (al centro da de lactar a su bebé). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al transporte y con sus hijas que estudian en la escuela y la menor es recién nacida, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Debido a la necesidad de pagar los gastos posnatales de su hija recién nacida, formó una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de papa, venta de ropa de segunda mano, servicio de construcción, artesanía en yeso, venta de salteñas, venta de huevo, venta de víveres y venta de comida, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocio. Su negocio es la venta de verduras, como; tomate, zanahoria, zapallo, brócoli, lechuga, etc., en un puesto de venta fijo al aire libre durante todos los días de la semana, “aprendí el oficio de mi madre, toda mi vida me he dedicado a la venta de verduras…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes fijos, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de verduras por mayor. Su sueño es tener un auto dónde poder trasladarse desde su casa a su puesto de venta, ella desea realizar la compra de verduras por mayor para obtener mejores beneficios para pagar los gastos de su bebe recién nacido. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 23 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Delia so0licita un préstamo para la compra de verdura por mayor para obtener mejores beneficios para pagar los gastos de su bebe recién nacido.
texts.en:
Delia is a 33 year old woman who lives with her partner and has 4 daughters, aged 2 months, 7, 10 and 12 years. Her business is selling vegetables. She is a good mother, enterprising, strong, tenacious, stable, responsible and very hard-working. She runs her  business in a very well-know market in the centre of the city; one of the most traditional ones where all types of products can be found, such as: vegetables, fruits and groceries.It has several outside streets with a variety of stalls the sellers attend gently, with a lot of care. It is a cold and dry climate with temperatures that vary by 0-12 degrees centigrade during the day.

Delia has a dark complexion, brown eyes, long black hair that she wears plaited, short stature and robust physique. She wears crowns on her teeth and her usual style of dress is traditional (sombrero, blanket and "pollera" which is a traditional skirt). Her mother tongue is Aymará which she speaks with her family and she speaks Spanish culturally and to do business (she goes to the centre to feed her baby). 

She shares her life with her partner who works in transport and with her daughters who study at school. They youngest girl is a newborn. They live in a rented room built with bricks and mortar, with a tin roof and wooden floor, that has drinking water, electricity, gas and sewerage. 

As she needs to pay the postnatal costs of her newborn daughter, to ask for a loan and improve her business, she started a group of people with businesses such as; selling potatoes, selling second-hand clothing, construction services, plaster craftwork, selling Salteñas (savoury pastries), selling eggs, selling supplies and selling food. Delia's business is selling vegetables, such as; tomatoes, carrots, squashes, broccoli, lettuce etc. She sells them from a permanent open-air stall every day of the week. "I learned the trade from my mother, I have spent all my life selling vegetables..." she says.

The advantage of her business is that she has regular clients. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy wholesale vegetables. Her dream is to have a car to take her from her home to her stall. She wants to buy vegetables at the wholesalers to get better deals to pay the costs of her newborn baby. 

This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 23 years that she has worked at this job. This is why Delia is asking for a loan to buy wholesale vegetables to get better deals so she can pay the costs of her newborn baby.

loans.use: to buy wholesale vegetables to help support her newborn baby.

loans.name: Confiance Group

texts.fr: Alphonsine est une femme d’affaires célibataire, trésorière de la banque villageoise Confiance, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 39 ans, mère de  2 enfants tous vont à l’école. Elle est propriétaire d’un salon de coiffure dame non loin du marché central depuis 10 ans. Elle commença son busines avec de fonds reçu de son petit ami. Elle va s’approvisionner en produit cosmétiques et de maquillages. Elle souhaite accroitre son activité, acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Alphonsine is a single businesswoman, treasurer of the "banque villageoise" (village borrowing group) called Confiance (Confidence). She is a client of MFI Hekima, aged 39, and the mother of two children, both attending school. She has owned a beauty salon for ladies not far from the central market for 10 years.

Alphonsine began her business with funds she received from her boyfriend. She is going to stock up on cosmetics and make-up. She hopes to grow her business, buy a plot of land, and feed and educate her children. In closing, she would like to thank Hekima for the support it brings to entrepreneurs who are not served by the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to stock up on cosmetics and make-up

loans.name: Noeme

texts.en:
Noeme is a married woman, 55 years old, with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Noeme has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy cloth, thread, and linen and pay for maintenance of her business.

Noeme has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread, and linen and pay for maintenance of her business.

loans.name: Rudylen

texts.en:
Rudylen is 74 years old, married, and has four children. 

To earn a living, she engaged in a sari sari store business. She aims to increase her income because of the increasing needs of her children. 

She needs to boost her stock in her store. So, she decided to buy more items to sell, so that she can sell more goods that will generate more income.

In the future, Rudylen plans to save money out from her business income to sustain the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

location.town: San Vicente, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Cesarina

texts.en:
Cesarina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 39 years old and has two children who are in school.

Cesarina has a dried fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more fish to sell.

Cesarina has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Rechie

texts.en:
Rechie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 40 years old and has two children who are presently in school.

Rechie has a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more dry goods products to sell, like toys and accessories.

Rechie has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more dry goods products to sell, like toys and accessories.

loans.name: Noé Rigoberto

texts.es:
Noé es un hombre que para brindarle a su querida familia una mejor calidad de vida, se esmera día con día para poder obtener sus ingresos y tener a su familia en mejores condiciones de vida, el actualmente tiene 32 años de edad, vive en una comunidad denominada Panajachel, Noé cuenta que afortunadamente que con el crédito anterior le fue muy bien porque logro realizar la inversión en su negocio y ahora ya cuenta con más materiales para darle a sus clientes un mejor servicio; pero Noé nuevamente se ve a la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para comprar dos puertas que necesita para su casa que recientemente finalizo de construir.
El gran sueño de Noé con poder construir una casa más grande para que su familia viva mejor.
texts.en:
Noé is a man, who in order to provide his dear family with a better quality of life, strives day to day to get income and for his family to have better living conditions.

Noé is 32 years old, and he lives in a community called Panajachel. Noé says that fortunately the previous loan went very well for him because he managed to invest in his business. He now has more materials to give his customers better service.

However, Noé once again sees the need to request a loan to buy two doors that he needs for his house, which he recently finished building.

Noé's big dream is to be able to build a bigger house so that his family can live better.

loans.use: to buy doors for his house.

loans.name: Nhom 5 - Dinh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Quy, pictured first to the left, is a 61-year-old farmer who makes about $24 per month. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1999. Her household is listed as a low income family in village and could not afford to have a sanitary latrine. 

With a portion of this loan, Quy will be able to buy materials to build a hygienic septic tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap. Those facilities would help her family improve their health and living conditions, while affording safety for them (particularly at night and during rainstorms). In addition this will provide convenience, cleanliness and privacy for all family members, while contributing to the environmental protection of the community.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap.

loans.name: Nhom 3 - Dinh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Huong, pictured first on the right in the first row, is 40 years old. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 2000. Her family works in the agricultural sector and has three children who are still in school.

Huong is fully aware of the fact that using a degraded double-pit latrine comes with risks of adverse effects on the health of her family members and her community, as well as environmental contamination. However, she has not yet been able to construct a septic tank latrine due to a shortage of funds. With this loan, Huong will install a sanitary toilet that will improve the quality of life for all of her family members, and will help her family and community avoid diseases and infections that are commonly associated with unsanitary toilets.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine, with a device for hand-washing with soap.

loans.name: Nhom 2 - Dinh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Hong, pictured first from the left, is 60 years old. She earns approximately 26 USD monthly. Her husband passed away years ago. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1990. Her family is classified as a poor family and can not afford to have a sanitary latrine. A portion of Nhom 2 - Đinh Hoa group's loan will help Hong, as well as other group members, to build a sanitary toilet and a hand-washing device with soap. This will help to improve her family's hygiene and health and contribute to the sanitary improvement of her community.

With the help of the local Women's Union in this campaign, Thrive Network can ensure the repayment rate up to 99%.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap.

loans.name: Nhom 4 - Dinh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Quyen, pictured first on the right, is 45 years old. She has two children who are currently in school. Her family works in agricultural production, and is listed as a poor family in her village. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1994. Quyen is fully aware of the fact that using a degraded double-pit latrine has risks of potential adverse effects on the health of her family members, her community and environmental contamination. However, she has not yet been able to construct a septic tank latrine due to a shortage of funds. With this loan, Quyen will build a sanitary toilet that will improve the quality of life for all of her family members and help the community avoid diseases and infections commonly associated with unsanitary toilets.

With the help of local Women Union in this campaign, Thrive Network can ensure the repayment rate up to 99%.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand washing with soap.

loans.name: Nhom 7 - Dinh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Hoa, pictured second on the right in the first row, was born in 1973 and works as a farmer. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 2001. She is married and has three children who are currently in school. Her family is classified as a poor family and could not afford to have a sanitary latrine. 

With a portion of this loan, Hoa will be able to buy materials to build a hygienic septic tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap that will improve her family's quality of life and health by helping them to avoid diseases and infections commonly associated with unsafe latrines. In addition this will provide convenience, cleanliness and privacy for all family members, while contributing to the environmental protection of the community.
With the help of local Women Union in this campaign, Thrive Network can ensure the repayment rate up to 99%.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Nhom 6 - Dinh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Nhung, pictured first from the right in the first row, is 34 years old. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 2002. Her husband is paralyzed on the left side of the body so she has to work hard to raise their two little children who are currently in school. 

Nhung is fully aware of the fact that using a degraded double-pit latrine has the risks of potential adverse effects on the health of her family members, her community and environmental contamination. However, she has not yet been able to construct a septic tank latrine due to a shortage of funds. With a portion of this loan, she will be able to buy materials to build a hygienic septic tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap. Those facilities would help her family improve their health and living conditions, while affording safety for them (particularly at night and during rainstorms).

 In addition this will provide convenience, cleanliness and privacy for all family members, while contributing to the environmental protection of the community.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand washing with soap.

loans.name: 15 De Septiembre Group

texts.es:
Gludmil es una mujer de 31 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 8 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, amable, optimista, paciente, sincera, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘15 de septiembre’ caracterizado por los orígenes de sus pobladores; tribus ayoreas nativas del lugar y mineros relocalizados de occidente se apropiaron del área e iniciaron la manufactura y el comercio, de clima cálido sub tropical muy húmedo, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Gludmil es de tez trigueña, ojos pardos, cabello largo rojizo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (la cuarta de la izquierda, viste blusa celeste con rayas blancas, pantalón negro, al lado de la de blusa fucsia). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al mismo negocio y con sus hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela y el menor comienza el kinder, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Debido a su impulso de superación formó una banca de personas con negocios como; panadería, venta de empanadas, venta de refrescos hervidos típicos, venta de queso, artesanía en yeso, confección de tejidos y venta de salteñas, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano de forma ambulante; cada día ella junto a su pareja se dirigen a centros comerciales y mercados de la zona, cargados de sacos llenos de su mercadería. Levantan un par de sombrillas y arman un puesto de venta, los transeúntes del lugar se transforman en clientes y compran sus prendas continuamente, “nuestros precios están muy por debajo de las tiendas de moda o la ropa nueva de marca y tratamos de vender lo mejor…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que los precios de sus prendas son muy competitivos, la desventaja es la falta de capital de inversión y la competencia. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de ropa y zapatos, ella desea incrementar su capital de trabajo y realizar la compra de zapatos de segunda mano por mayor para ofertar mayor variedad a sus clientes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Gludmil solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa y zapatos de segunda mano por mayor y con los beneficios pagar los gastos escolares de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gludmil is 31 years old. She lives with her partner and she has two children, ages five and eight. Her business is selling second-hand clothing. She is a good mother, kind, optimistic, patient, sincere, responsible, and very hard working. 

She carries out her business in the “15th of September” neighborhood, which is characterized by the origins of its inhabitants—Ayoreas tribes who are native to the area and relocated miners. They appropriated the area and initiated manufacturing and commerce. It has a warm, sub-tropical climate, with a temperature that varies during the day between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade. 

Gludmil has olive skin, brown eyes, and long, reddish brown hair that she wears tied back. She is short of stature with a medium build. Her maternal language is Guaraní, which she speaks at home; she speaks Spanish with the general public and for her business. She is seen fourth from the left, wearing a sky-blue blouse with white stripes and black pants, next to the lady with the fuscia blouse.

She shares her life with her partner, who works at the same business, and with her children; the oldest is studying in school and the youngest is starting kindergarten.  They live in their family house, which they own. It is built of brick and cement, with a corrugated iron roof and a cement floor. It has potable water, electricity, and sewage service.

Her drive to get ahead led her to form a bank of people with businesses such as baking, selling empanadas, selling traditional boiled beverages, selling cheese, making plaster crafts, weaving fabric, and selling meat pies. Their goal is to request a loan and improve their businesses.

Her business is selling second-hand clothing as a street vendor. Every day, she and her husband go to the zone’s commercial centers and markets, where they put up umbrellas and set up a sales stand. Passers-by become customers and constantly purchase their garments.  “Our prices are much lower than those of the fashion shops or new brand-name clothing, and we try to sell the best..”, she comments. Her business’s advantage is that her clothing prices are very competitive; the disadvantages are the lack of investment capital and the competition. 

Her dream is to open a clothing and shoe store. She wants to increase her working capital and make a purchase of second-hand shoes at wholesale, in order to offer greater variety to her customers. This is the first loan cycle with the institution in the four years that she has been doing this work.

These are the reasons that Gludmil is requesting a loan: to purchase second-hand clothing and shoes at wholesale, and to pay her children’s’ school expenses with the profits.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothing and shoes at wholesale, and pay her children's school expenses with the profits.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
As a parent of one child, Jessica works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a repair shop.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production/vending business.

Jessica has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
Remy, 49, is married and has six children, four of whom are still in school. For the past 25 years she has woven mats to earn a living in the Philippines.

Remy is applying for a 15,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy additional fibers for her business. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fibers to weave into mats

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es: María Eugenia tiene 37 años es soltera y vive en la ciudad de México, es una mujer con una enorme autonomía y convicción, se siente orgullosa porque es responsable con sus obligaciones económicas, su mayor sueño es convertirse en madre y su principal motivación es su madre, quien depende de ella por su estado de salud. Ella inicio hace 4 años un negocio de venta de calzado europeo para tener una estabilidad económica y ser independiente económicamente. Ella solicita un préstamo de  MXN 10,000 para poder comprar un volumen grande de zapatos con sus proveedores y tener una oferta mayor con sus clientes. Ella agradece a todas las personas que confían en ella y la apoyaran en su negocio
texts.en:
María Eugenia, 37, is single and lives in Mexico City. She is a very confident and independent woman. She feels proud, because she is responsible with her economic obligations. Her biggest dream is to become a mother and her main motivation is her mother, who depends on her due to her state of health. 

Four years ago she started a business where she sells European shoes so she can be economically stable and financially independent. 

She is requesting a loan of 10,000 Mexican pesos to buy a large amount of shoes from her suppliers and to provide her customers with a better deal. She is grateful for all the people who believe in her and who support her through her business.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of shoes from her suppliers.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is hardworking 26 year old farmer from a rural home in the Siongiroi area of Kenya. He makes a living doing dairy farming. He enjoys his job of dairying because it generates regular food and income for his growing family. The only big challenge troubling his mind is lack of diversity in his business.

Robert is seeking a loan to start commercial poultry farming. He intends to use this loan to buy traditional breeds of chicken that are adapted to local conditions. He wants to take advantage of the growing demand for poultry products in the market.

Robert will use the income that he hopes to earn from poultry farming to look after his family’s well-being and his children’s education. He also wants to continue investing in poultry to make it bigger and more profitable.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is 54 years old and has nine children. Shirly is married and two of her children are currently in school.

Shirly is in the agricultural business, farming vegetable in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Shirly requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos is a 43-year-old married man from Badian, Cebu. He has three children ages 15, 13 and 11 years old. His wife takes good care of their children at home while he work hard to give provide their needs through driving a “trisikad” or “pedicab”, a cycle rickshaw (a vehicle with three wheels that is moved by foot pedals).

Carlos is asking for a loan for the repair of his “trisikad”. Aside from repair, he needs an amount to buy fertilizer for his crops. In the future, Carlos is aiming to have better earnings for his family's progress.

loans.use: to pay for repair of his trisikad (a vehicle with three wheels that is moved by foot pedals)  and also buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Mwende

texts.en:
Mwende is a 54-year-old woman. She is divorced and has four children. 

She operates a retail shop and has been in the business for 15 years. 

This is her fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya. She intends to use the loan to purchase stocks of detergents, sugar, cooking oil, rice, maize flour, etc. 

She will use the profits from her business to restock her business. 

Her hope and dream for the future is to expand her shop to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of detergents, sugar, cooking oil, rice, maize flour, etc

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
Agripina is a married woman with five children. Agripina is 50 years old and one of her children is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Agripina has a buy-and-sell firewood business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. Agripina requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell.

In the future, Agripina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Roselie

texts.en:
Roselie, 59, is married and has four children. For the past seven years she has worked hard preparing and selling food in the Philippines.

Roselie has applied for a 11,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy more ingredients for her food sales business. She is saving money to put back into her business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her food sales business.

loans.name: Ardiana

texts.en:
Ardiana is a married woman with five children. Ardiana is 48 years old now and a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ardiana has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. Ardiana requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed for her business.

In the future, Ardiana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 60 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc.

Adelaida has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a 41-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies for her business.

Marissa has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her food sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement and sand to construct a trough and a laundry.

loans.name: Dúo Yolanda Group

texts.es:
Dúo Yolanda
Este dúo está formado por doña María Azucena, ella tiene 37 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de ropa para dama, caballero, niño y niña así como la venta de cosméticos, desinfectantes y regalos en su negocio que ella le puso por nombre variedades Heidy en honor a su hija mayor, desde  ya hace varios  años, ella está solicitando el crédito para la compra de ropa para dama, caballero y niños así como para la inversión de cosméticos, su mayor deseo es seguir surtiendo su negocio y tener las variedades posibles para el servicio de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Duo Yolanda includes María Azucena, who is 37 years old and works selling clothing for ladies, gentlemen, boys, and girls, as well as cosmetics, disinfectants, and gifts. She sells them in her business, that she named “Heidy’s Varieties” in honor of her eldest daughter, several years ago. 

She is requesting the loan in order to purchase clothing for ladies, gentlemen, and children, as well as to invest in cosmetics.  Her biggest desire is to continue stocking her business and having as many varieties as possible in order to serve her customers.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Naditha

texts.en:
Naditha is 47 years old, married and has two children. For the past thirteen years she has raised chickens to earn a living in the Philippines.

Naditha has borrowed and successfully repaid three prior loans from Kiva's field partner NWTF. She is now applying for a 10,000 PHP loan to buy feed and other supplies for her chickens. She is working and saving to build up her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her chickens.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 42 years old and married with three children who are in school. Marife works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation) to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap, milk, spices, etc.

Marife has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Marife would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap, milk, spices, etc

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a married woman with two children. Julia is 62 years old now and is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Julia has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. Julia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Julia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Amorlina

texts.en:
Amorlina is married and has sold vegetables for the past eight years to earn a living in the Philippines. She has applied for a 12,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

Amorlina is working hard to build her vegetable business so as to secure her family’s future.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 28 years old and has six children. Julie is married and four children of her children are in school.

Julie is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Julie requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Julie has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Julie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 31-year-old woman. She is married and has three children. 

She is a dairy farmer as well as a crop farmer, a business she has worked in for the last eight years. It has been profitable. 

This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya. She intends to use the loan to buy animal feed. 

She will use the profit from her business to educate her children. 

Her hope and dream for the future is to see her children complete their education and settle well.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita works hard to support her family. Angelita is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 7 years now.

Angelita requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks like coffee, canned goods, soft-drinks, cereals, beers, etc. to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Angelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks like coffee, canned goods, soft-drinks, cereals, beers, etc. to sell

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a hardworking 37-year-old farmer based in Kachibora village, in the Kitale area of Kenya. She is blessed with a lovely family. She makes a living raising sheep and poultry.

Regina is seeking a loan to buy chickens. With a 10,000 KES loan through Kiva's field partner Juhudi Kilimo she will buy more of them to add to the ones she already has. Her dream is to scale up her poultry business and have it as one of her main sources of income.

In order to achieve this, she has partnered with other local farmers to form a group so that they can access co-guaranteed loans. Income generated from the poultry farm will enable her to repay the loan on time, and she will use the additional amount to meet her family's basic needs and educational costs.

loans.use: to buy more chickens to add to the ones she already has.

loans.name: Jordan Johel

texts.es: Jordán  Joel  está soltero,  tiene la edad de 19 años y actualmente vive con sus padres y hermanos. El con el crédito va comprar los insumos para la asistencia de su cafetal, tales como el abono, herbicidas, y todo tipo de producto necesario para su buena producción. El hace un tiempo atrás se dedica a esta producción de café con su padre, él tiene como meta poder obtener de su  café una  muy buena cosecha para aumentar sus ganancias económicas y ayudar al bienestar de su familia. El espera poder salir adelante con los pagos de su crédito y ser una persona que se supera día a día. Él es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR, nunca antes había trabajado con otros Bancos Estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho mas baja.
texts.en: Jordán Johel is single. He is 19 years old and he currently lives with his parents and siblings. With this loan he will purchase supplies to attend to his coffee, such as fertilizer, herbicides and other types of products that are necessary for good production. He has spent some time working on this production of coffee with his father. He has a goal of being able to obtain a very good harvest of coffee in order to increase his economic earnings and to help support the wellbeing of his family. He hopes to be able to get ahead with his loan payments and to be a person who strives everyday. This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has never worked with other State Banks before, but FUDECOSUR has provided this loan with ease and with a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to attend to his coffee plantings.

loans.name: Selly

texts.en:
Selly lives in the village of Bingwa, found in the Rift valley province of Kenya, which is primarily a maize and dairy farming region. She is blessed with a lovely family. To help her hubby provide for the family, Selly ventured into farming a decade ago. Over the years, she has brought tremendous growth to the business. Today, she keeps dairy cattle and poultry and grows maize, among other crops. She is also invested in other personal businesses for additional income. 

Selly enjoys dairy farming the most. She is seeking a loan to purchase an additional dairy cow in a bid to keep increasing the quantity of the farm's milk production. The money Selly will make from selling the additional milk will help her to repay the debt and pay for her children's education, which is her highest expense. Selly stated, "I will buy a cow that will produce more milk for sale. This will increase my family's monthly income." 

Help out this enterprising Kenyan woman with a loan today!

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia, 42 years old,  is married and has five children, two of them in school. Nelia has an agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Nelia has been in this business for 7 years and has previously borrowed 3 times from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Nelia would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna and her family live and work on a small farm in the mountainous Kapsowar area of Kenya. She makes a living raising dairy cows and growing various crops. Anna sells her farm produce at a local market near her home. 

Anna's biggest challenge was lack of access to finance as there are no banks where she lives. The deficit in financial products and services has had a negative effect in the productivity of rural enterprises in the area. Through Juhudi Kilimo, Anna is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs necessary to increase her farm’s productivity. She will spend the borrowed money to buy improved seeds, fertilizers and other important supplies that control weeds and pests. With your lending, Anna will be able access capital to buy important farm inputs that will increase her farm’s productivity and family's income.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
Rosa, de 36 de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, está casada, su esposa trabaja como seguridad en una empresa, tienen dos hijos de 17 y 14 años de edad, el primero estudia bachillerato y el otro noveno grado.  

Rosa, se dedica a realizar oficios domésticos en casa ajenas desde hace 20 años, la necesidad de generar ingresos la llevo a tomar la decisión de trabajar de esta manera; también se dedica a la agricultura junto a su padre.

Rosa, necesita el dinero para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, herbicidas y para pagar mano de obra que le ayuden a trabajar; actualmente, está cultivando 10,500 metros cuadrados de cultivo de maíz junto a su padre y una de sus hermanas, con el préstamo podrá comprar lo necesario y asegurar una buena cosecha.  

Los sueños de Rosa son, poder ver a sus hijos preparados académicamente y seguir trabajando para darles lo necesario.
texts.en:
Rosa is 36 years old and she studied until the 7th grade. She is married and her husband works as a security guard for a business. They have two children who are 17 and 14 years old. The oldest is in high school and the other is in 9th grade. Rosa has worked performing housework in other homes for 20 years. The need to generate income made her make the decision to work this way. In addition, she works in agriculture together with her father.

Rosa needs this money to purchase agricultural inputs such as fertilizer and herbicides, and to pay for manual labor that will help her work. Currently, she is cultivating 10,500 sq. meters of corn, together with her father and one of her sisters. With the loan she will be able to purchase what is necessary and to be assured of a good harvest. Rosa's dreams are to be able to see her children prepared academically and to continue working to give them what they need.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs such as fertilizer and herbicides, and to pay for manual labor that will help her work.

loans.name: Chanthea

texts.en:
Chanthea is a 32-year-old married factory worker with two small children, who lives in a village in the Takeo province in Cambodia. She has worked in a  factory since 2013. Her husband is 32 years old and also works as a factory worker. One of her two children attends school. Both Chanthea and her husband make USD15.5 each day. 

Now she would like to apply for a loan through KREDIT MFI to buy piglets to fatten to sell. With this loan, she will be able to improve her family’s finances. In the future, Chanthea hopes to have enough finances to build a new house and support her two children to earn higher education.

loans.use: to buy piglets to fatten and then sell

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es: Alfonso de 42 años de edad  vive con sus dos hijos,  una niña de 12 años de edad  y un niño de 9 años de edad por quienes se ha esforzado día con día en su trabajo para brindarles sus estudios. El presta sus servicios de seguridad a una empresa aledaña a su municipio de donde vive y con lo que gana le sirve para darles a sus hijos lo que necesitan en el hogar. Alfonso con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertirlo en ladrillos, cemento, arena, hierro,  grava para la construcción de dos cuartos dormitorio ya que actualmente la casa que tiene es de lámina y no le genera una mayor seguridad para su familia.
texts.en:
Alfonso, age 42, lives with his two children, a 12-year-old girl and a 9-year-old boy, for whom he has worked very hard every day at his job, in order to provide them with their education. He provides security service to a business that is next to the municipality in which he lives; and with what he earns, he is able to give his children what they need at home. 

Alfonso, with the desire to improve his living conditions, is requesting a loan with FUSAI. It is for the purchase of bricks, cement, sand, iron, and gravel for the construction of two bedrooms, as currently, the house that he has is made of metal sheeting, and does not provide much security for his family.

loans.use: to invest in bricks, cement, sand, iron, and gravel for the construction of two bedrooms.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks such as; coconuts; pumkins; tomatoes; bananas, etc

loans.name: Benilda

texts.en:
Benilda is thankful for the continuous aid granted to her for the regular maintenance of her tricycle unit. It helped her provide safe and consistent service to her passengers. She values her transportation business so much for this is her only means of making a living.

She hopes that once again you could grant her a PHP 19,000 loan to pay for the needed maintenance of her tricycle. It is important that her tricycle is properly maintained to assure her of an efficient service and consistent income. She is thanking God and you for your good heart for supporting her livelihood.

Benilda's simple dream is to sustain her transportation business and add one more tricycle. She prays for good health and long life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the regular maintenance of her tricycle.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 47 years old and married. He owns a small farm in Kapsowar area of Kenya where he lives and works with his family. He practices dairy and horticultural farming for a living.

Moses is seeking a loan to start commercial poultry farming. He intends to use this loan to buy traditional breeds of chicken that are adapted to local conditions. This loan will give him roughly 50 head of poultry to kick-start the poultry business.

With the growing demand for poultry products in the market, Moses expects to make money without much hassle. Income generated from this investment will be used by Moses to meet his family’s needs, repay the loan and grow the business.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Ururabo Sub Group

texts.en:
Consolee is a group leader; aged 35.She is married with 4 children aged between 9 and 17 years, all of them go to school. The group is called URURABO means “Flower” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. 

She sells food stuffs and has been running in a business for 6 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas,beans and cassava for sell.  The profits from the business will be used to expand in her business and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more bananas,beans and cassava for sell.

loans.name: Philemon

texts.en:
Philemon and her family live and work on a small farm in the fertile Moiben division of Kenya. He makes a living doing dairy and maize farming. He enjoys his work of producing and selling food. The key lesson he has taken away from many years of crop farming is the importance of using quality inputs to get yields of high quality and quantity.

Philemon is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer to enhance his farm’s productivity and yield quality harvest.
With your loan, having quality agricultural inputs will increase Philemon’s chances for a successful harvest.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, like improved seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jumber

texts.en: Jumber is 51 years old. He lives in Batumi with his two children. Jumber's wife works in Turkey and sends him money to cover his everyday expenses. Jumber decided to start a taxi business. The Startup program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan and purchase a car. Once the car is purchased, Jumber will serve local people as a taxi driver and will generate a stable income. Jumber will provide better living conditions to his children.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start a taxi business.

loans.name: Winfrida Honolatusi

texts.en:
Winifrida volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, leading life skills sessions for students in the nearby secondary school to improve their learning performance. She engages herself in a charcoal selling business. 

She completed her first loan on time and she managed to expand her business and now she is requesting for a second Kiva loans. Winifrida will use the profit she will earn to support her parents with everyday needs such as food, clothing and health care.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal in bulk.

loans.name: Chhit's Group

texts.en:
Chhit, aged 60, is an older man who lives in Mondulkiri province. He is the father of six dependent children. Chhit can earn income to support his family’s living costs by growing cassava on a two-hectare area: this is his family's main source of income. He sometimes works for others for a fee in order to supplement the farm income. 

Chhit had no choice but to sell his cassava at a low price because insects were destroying his crop. In order to save his business, he decided to request a loan of 2,000,000 KHR. This is Chhit's second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and he has completely repaid his previous loan. 

As the group leader, Chhit will use his loan portion to buy seed and fertilizer to support his cassava farm. He can then harvest good outputs to sell at the market. He hopes that he can earn more income to improve his family's living standard to a much higher level than before.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer to support his cassava farm

loans.name: Shareefah

texts.en:
Shareefah`s story is one of an ambitious and patient woman. She is a 43 year old married with one child. 
Shareefah used to work with her mother in clothes shop, after she got experience in this field she then made the choice to open her own business which is used clothes shop to be able to provide for her child the life and education, and to help her husband in the life expenses, and support him.

And because she hopes to be one of the success stories, she needs to expand her work therefore she applied for a loan to help her develop her shop to buy new supplies and new clothes to sell.  Shareefah needs your support to achieve her dreams

loans.use: to buy new supplies and new clothes to sell

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is from Jarash. He is 26 years old and single.
Mohammad is studying Geology and Environment Science, and he is working beside his education as a cashier to save his daily expenses.

Lately his family faced financial problems prevent Mohammad from pay for his university. Because of that he decided to apply for an education loan to help him pay the university fees. He hopes this loan will enable him to have a good job with high salary.
