loans.use: To pay for his university fees in Geology and Environment Sciance

loans.name: Ortuk

texts.en:
Ortuk is a hardworking man. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1946 and is living in a village with his big family. He is married and has four children. His sons are working in Russia and earn enough money to ensure their family. But unfortunately this year's unstable economy of Russia influenced their earnings. They couldn’t send enough money to their parents. Ortuk is a farmer and keeps livestock and plants agricultural products. 

He and his wife are old. His wife had a fit and needs to be treated. Ortuk applied to IMON asking for a loan to buy medicines for himself and his wife. He hopes to make repayment from his income of gained harvest. He hopes to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders kindness.

loans.use: to buy medicines for himself and his wife

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 33-year-old lives in Southern Ghour and married woman with six children. Fatima is a responsible, welcoming and pleasant woman and she is working hard to help her husband in the household expenses. She started her business which is selling clothes and accessories. 

She has applied for a loan in order to improve her business and buy new products to sell, to increase income. Please help Fatima to meet her goals, she needs your support.

loans.use: to improve her business and buy new products to sell

loans.name: Dila

texts.en:
This is Dila feeding one of the adorable piglets with cucumber skins!
Dila is in her late fifties and is a rural mother of three, with 25 the oldest and 17 the youngest.  The loan that she is requesting from you will be used to build a stable for the pigs and to build a henhouse. She’s got some land around her house where she has planted around 50 olive groves, plums, persimmons and grapevines and sells fruits and other products such as olive oil and pickled olives and homemade red wine. In addition to this, she’s got about 60 chickens from which she sells eggs and of course, one saw, selling about 20 piglets a year. Her husband makes an income of $220/month.

loans.use: to build a stable for the pigs and a henhouse

loans.name: Rosa Ana

texts.es: Rosa tiene 57 años de edad, es casada y vive en el Estado de México. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y tenaz, siempre está pensando de que innovar para obtener ingresos extras y mejorar su situación económica, además es una amante de la cocina y tiene un excelente sazón, por esta razón Rosa puso un negocio donde ella prepara y vende los alimentos, con este negocio ella quiere lograr obtener estabilidad económica. Su principal obstáculo para catapultar su negocio es la falta de mobiliario y de publicidad. Con un préstamo de MXN 30,000 Rosa podrá comprar suficientes mesas, sillas y cubiertos para su negocio, remodelar su local y también podrá anunciarse en varios lugares importantes de su región. Su mayor sueño es ver felices y realizados a sus 3 hijos, está muy orgullosa de su perseverancia. Rosa agradece mucho a todas las personas que la apoyen en su crecimiento económico y que se interesen por su causa.
texts.en:
Rosa is 57 years old, married and lives in Mexico. She is a hard working and tenacious woman who is always thinking about how to innovate in order to earn extra income and improve her economic situation. 

She also loves cooking and has an excellent sense of taste. For this reason Rosa began a business where she prepares and sells food, and with this business she hopes to improve her financial situation.   

Her main obstacle in growing her business is a lack of furniture and advertising.  

With a loan of 30,000 Mexican Pesos she will be able to buy tables, chairs and cutlery for her business.  She will also be able to restyle her premises and advertise in the various important places in her region.  

Her main dream is for her three children to be happy and fulfilled; she is very proud of their determination. 

Rosa is very thankful to all of the people who will help in her economic development and take an interest in her cause.

loans.use: to buy furniture, restyle and advertise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for making jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy raw material for the production of traditional clothing.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a direct selling tupperware and personal collection products business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase more products from tupperware to sell to her customers for her direct selling tupperware and personal collection products business.

Filomena has been in this business for 21 years. Filomena earns more income from food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Filomena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products from tupperware and personal collection to sell to her customers

loans.name: Madelyn Vanessa

texts.es:
Madelyn, de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, debido a la situación de inseguridad en el país fue sus abuelos no le permitieron seguir en la universidad, porque tenía que viajar muy lejos, está soltera, vive con sus abuelos desde su infancia porque sus padres viajaron al extranjero.   

Madelyn, es empleada en una ferretería, tiene cuatro años de experiencia en ventas, su tío es el dueño de la ferretería, ella inicia a trabajar porque su tío tenía necesidad de una empleada en ventas, fue así como ella empezó a aprender acerca de las ventas.- La distancia que recorre en bus desde su casa hasta su trabajo es de 15 kilómetros diarios y su horario es de 8:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m. 

El crédito lo necesita para iniciar con una tienda de productos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar y pan; su abuela vende en el mercado y ella quiere colocar la tienda ahí en su tienda, ella lo atenderá los días sábados y domingos que no trabaje en la ferretería.  

Madelyn, espera tener su negocio propio para poder emplear a otras personas.
texts.en:
Madelyn, 22 years old, studied until receiving her diploma. Due to the insecure situation in the country, her grandparents did not allow her to continue to the university because she had to travel very far. She is single and lives with her grandparents since infancy because her parents traveled abroad.

Madelyn is a hardware store employee. She has four years of experience in sales. Her uncle is the owner of the hardware store. She started working because her uncle was in need of a sales employee. That is how she started to learn about sales. 

The distance she travels by bus from her house to work is 15 kilometers a day, and her work schedule is 8:00am to 4:00pm.

She needs the loan to start a store of basic products like rice, beans, sugar and bread. Her grandmother sells in the market, and she wants to set up a store there. She will tend to it every Saturday and Sunday that she does not work at the hardware store.

Madelyn hopes to have her own business in order to employ other people.

loans.use: to start a store with basic products such as rice, beans, sugar and bread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 33 years old, married and supports a family of three children. She has been practicing farming for the last four years earning KES12,000 per month. 

Mary has applied for her first loan of KES25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply in the area for more income gain. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply in the area for more income gain.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia is 54 years old, married and has five children to provide for. She wants to help her husband who works as a gasoline boy and earn an income to provide her children's daily needs. She is engaged in a sari sari store business. It really helps them a lot in terms of their needs. She aims to increase her income so that she can give her children a better living. She decided to borrow a loan to buy more good items to sell so that she can increase her store inventory and be able to sell more goods that will generate a better income.

Ignacia's plan in the future is to save money from her business income to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy more good items to sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 38 years old and married with 6 children, all of whom go to school. They live in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a cattle keeper and has been in that business since 2005 to earn a living. He also earns a salary as Chairperson Local Council 3, which supplements his income from cattle rearing. 

Charles dreams of expanding his cattle business and completing his residential house, however he is limited by inadequate capital. He has asked for a loan to buy more cattle for rearing and then selling in the future.

loans.use: to buy cattle for reselling.

loans.name: Florepes

texts.en:
Florepes works hard to support her family. She is married and has a baking business in the Philippines. Florepes has been in this business for 5 years now.

Florepes requested a 13000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for baking. In the future, Florepes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy what she needs from tools, supplies and food to make a large number of products to sell to finance university

loans.name: Sebastian Fabian

texts.es: Sebastian es un hombre de 61 años, esta casado y vive junto a su esposa en la localidad rural de Cabanaconde. Él se dedica a la agricultura y solicita el micro crédito para poder sembrar alverja orgánica, él destinara parte del préstamo para comprar semilla orgánica de alverja y la otra parte para preparar el terreno agrícola con abono orgánico. En el futuro espera poder darle a su esposa estabilidad económica y sobre todo espera poder tener salud, es por ello que apuesta por lo orgánico, para seguir estando junto a su esposa por mucho tiempo mas.
texts.en:
Sebastian is 61 years old, married and lives with his wife in the Cabanaconde rural area. He makes a living in farming and is applying for this microloan in order to grow organic peas. Part of the loan will be spent on buying organic pea seeds, while the rest will be spent on preparing the farming land with organic manure.

In the future, Sebastian hopes to offer his wife financial stability and, above all, to maintain his health. It is for his health that he works with organic products - so that he can stay by his wife's side for much longer.

loans.use: to grow organic peas.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru:
Зарина 39 летняя замужняя женщина из района Чкаловск. Ее муж находится на заработках заграницей. Воспитанием двоих детей Зарина занимается самостоятельно. Дети подросли, и она имеет больше времени посвятить другим вещам.
  Она решила поднять семейный бюджет и совместить приятное с полезным. Зарина открыла свой бизнес. Она сдает и продает свадебные платья. Зарина обожает свою работу. За 7 месяцев работы она поняла, что она будет работать в этой сфере деятельности еще много лет. Теперь она хочет расширить бизнес и привести новые платья. Для этого она обратилась за кредитом. Зарина будет очень счастлива, если ее поддержать. Она заранее выражает благодарность и просто говорит спасибо!
texts.en:
Zarina is a 39-year-old married woman from the Chkalovsk region. Her husband is away working abroad. Zarina raises their two children on her own. Now the children have grown up, and she has more time to dedicate to other things.

She has decided to increase the family budget and mix business with pleasure. Zarina has opened her own business. She rents and sells wedding dresses. Zarina loves her work. In seven months of work she has understood that she is going to keep working in this field for many years more. Now she wants to expand her business and buy in some new wedding dresses. She has applied for a loan to do this. Zarina will be very happy if she will get support. She expresses her gratitude in advance and simply says thank you!

loans.use: to buy some wedding dresses and expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy porridge ingredients such as green beans, palm sugar, coconut milk, and sweetened condensed milk.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 60 years old and she supports 6 children. She has been a tailor for the last 20 years, and the business earns her 5,000 KES per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to purchase more stocks of cloth materials for making clothes to sell her clients. She plans to use the gained profits to repay the loan and purchase a dairy cow for milk production, so as to enable her to supply milk to clients and educate her children.

Her hope is to expand her business sector and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of cloth materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married with two children and is a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.

Josephine supports the family through her food vending business in the Philippines.

She took an educational loan for her son John Jhobert, 20 years old and the second of two children in the family. He is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Marine Transportation and is currently in the third year of this three-year course.

Josephine is borrowing 10,276 PHP to pay for tuition fees for her son John Jhobert for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

John Jhobert plans when he graduates to earn an income and help his parents.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business raising livestock in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Mary Ann has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from a general store.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Ururabo Sub Group

texts.en:
URURABO is a group led by Francoise who is 31 years old. The group name means “Flower” in English. Shee is married with 2 children aged between 1 and 3 years. She owns shop and has been selling in a business for 2 years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their life. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more salt,sugar and cooking oil for sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more salt,sugar and cooking oil for sell.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 24 years old and lives in Kilombero district. She is single, living with her parents, and volunteering as a Camfed Learner Guide, leading life skills sessions to students in a nearby secondary school to help them improve their learning performance. 

Asha managed to repay her first Kiva loan on time. She has a palm oil business and sells the oil near her home. She is requesting a second Kiva loan to increase her capital and buy her materials wholesale in order to increase profit. Asha plans to use the profits to pay school fees for her nursing course.

loans.use: to increase capital and buy her product materials wholesale.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 34 years old, married and supports a family of four children. She has been practicing farm supplies for the last six years earning KES. 12,000 per month. 

Jackline has applied for her first loan of KES25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply in the area for more income gain. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply in the area for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more vegetables in larger amounts, such as spinach, water spinach, cabbage, chili, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахноза молодая и талантливая девушка. Ей 18 лет и она в этом году окончила среднюю школу. Она с детства хотела стать портнихой. После окончания школы мама научила её шить национальные женские платья. День за днем она шьет все красивее и красивее. Пока что Шахноза шьет дома только для своих близких и родных, но она хочет повысить свою квалификацию и опыт. У Шахноза есть стимул, потому что она очень любит эту работу и у нее есть интерес к шитью. Шахноза работает с воодушевлением. У нее есть мечта открыть собственное ателье. Но пока что она столкнулась с трудностью. У неё старая швейная машинка. Шахноза с огромной надеждой обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить новую вышивальную швейную машинку. На новой машинке она будет в состоянии шить дорогие ткани и тем самым обрести все новых клиенток. Она верит, что благодаря Вам её мечта воплотиться в реальность.
texts.en: Shahnoza is a young and talented lady. She is 18 years old and she graduated from high school this year. She has wanted to become a seamstress since childhood. After graduating from school her mother taught her how to sew national women's dresses. Day after day she sews more and more beautifully. For the time being Shahnoza sews at home only for her friends and family, but she wants to increase her qualifications and experience. Shahnoza has an incentive because she really loves this work and she has an interest in sewing. Shahnoza works with enthusiasm. She has a dream of opening her own studio. But for now she has met with difficulties. She has an old sewing machine. Shahnoza has applied for a loan with high hopes in order to buy a new embroidery sewing machine. She will be able to sew expensive fabrics with a new machine and in doing so to acquire new clients. She believes that, thanks to you, her dream will become reality.

loans.use: to buy a new embroidery sewing machine.

loans.name: Maria Linda

texts.en:
Maria Linda is 39 years old, married and has three children to provide for. To earn a living she is engaged in a piggery business. She raises a pig and sells it in the market. She aims for a better income for the family so she decided to borrow a loan to purchase feed for the pigs so that she can produce a good quality of pigs and be able to sell them in the market and generate a good income.

Maria Linda's plan for the future is to improve her living conditions from her business income.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the pigs.

location.town: Water Fall, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of five children, Flordeliza works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling ready to wear. Flordeliza is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy more materials for her tailoring business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Flordeliza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials like fabric, threads, zippers, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 38 years old and has two children. She is married and has one child in school.

Elsie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Elsie has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elsie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 47 years old and has one child in school.

Leonida has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed for her business.

Leonida has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed

loans.name: Janier Miguel

texts.es: Janier creció en El Carmen de Bolívar, municipio en el cual su familia distribuía drogas y desde niño estuvo vinculado a este negocio,  adquirió toda la experiencia y habilidad necesaria para iniciar su propio negocio, sin embargo el conflicto armado que se sostenía en la zona, lo obligaron a salir desplazado de sus tierras y viajar a la Ciudad de Cartagena de Indias para iniciar nuevamente su negocio.  Gracias a su compromiso y entrega, logró consolidarse en el sector como distribuidor de drogas de uso común como ibuprofenos, acetaminofén, amoxicilina entre otros  y productos de aseo y misceláneos.  Su principal desafío ha sido que luego de haber entregado a un grupo armado en la población donde antes residía el capital de su negocio, volvió a iniciar sin capital, él está  aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en drogas y productos de aseo personal y así continuar respondiendo a los pedidos de sus clientes.  Su mea a futuro es ampliar su cobertura de clientes a otros municipios de Colombia y continuar ofreciendo bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Janier grew up in El Carmen de Bolívar, a municipality in which his family distributed medications. Since childhood, he has been connected to this business. He acquired all of the experience and skill to start his own business. 

However, the armed conflict that has continued in the region has forced him to leave, displaced from his lands, and travel to the city of Cartagena de Indias to begin his business again. Thanks to his commitment and dedication, he was able to establish himself in the sector as a distributor of common use medications like ibuprofen, acetaminophen, and amoxicillin, among other miscellaneous products and personal hygiene products.

His main challenge has been that after having been given over to an armed group in the town where the the capital of his business had perviously resided, he once again started without capital. He is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing he asks of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to invest in medications and personal hygiene products and, in this way, continue supplying the orders of his customers.

His goal for the future is to expand his range of clients to other municipalities of Colombia and continue offering well-being to his family.

loans.use: to invest in medications and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel, 29, is a smallholder farmer residing in Kitale, an agricultural town in the Rift valley region of Kenya. She is arguably among the most successful clients of Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance institution that deals only with smallholder farmers in rural parts of Kenya. Most of the time, Rachel dedicates her time in taking care of her family. With the little time Rachel has, she sells crops from their small farm and also keeps dairy cows and poultry. 

From Kiva lenders, Rachel is seeking a loan worth 65000 KES to buy seeds and grow her horticulture business and buy poultry birds. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector. 

It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to give Rachel access to a loan facility that will aid her to grow her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. Through the loan she will also be able to satisfy the demand of eggs that is in her area hence increasing the profit margins. 

With your loan, Rachel’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability. Help Rachel make her dreams come true; this loan can change her life.

loans.use: To buy seeds and start horticulture and poultry farming

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victorina is very thankful to Kiva for the loan granted to her in the amount of 12,000 PHP, with which she bought rice, sugar, and condiments to sell in her store. To date, Victorina still re-selling food items like pepper, salt, and garlic, but more than that, she now has others items like rice and sugar that help increase her income. The revenue is used for their family needs, and she saves a little in case of unplanned events. Using her income and some of her savings, she was also able to put tiles on the floor and paint the wall of her room for rent.

Today, Victorina is requesting a loan amounting 10,000 PHP to buy more rice, canned goods, coffee, sugar, and laundry soaps to sell in her store. She says that during the rainy season, rice and other products are more in demand and she wants to grab the opportunity to increase her income to further provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items for her store, such as rice, canned goods, coffee, sugar, and laundry soaps.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is aged 29 years, married to James and she supports 1 child.  She has been selling chips to clients for the last 5 years and the business earns her KES 4,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase more stock of cooking oil and potatoes for making chips for sale to clients and meet both client and family needs.  She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to enable her supply milk daily to clients and educate her child. 

Her hope is to expand her business sector and support her siblings in educating them  to higher levels of education.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of cooking oil and potatoes for making chips for sale to clients and meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 32 years old and lives in the Kitale area of Kenya, where she owns a small farm which has helped her not only survive but become an entrepreneur. She is committed, responsible, and works really hard to see her farming business become successful. This charming mother has been engaged in mixed farming for the past 10 years. She commands a lot of respect from fellow farmers in her village. Her main source of income has been eggs, maize, milk, and a variety of food crops that she plants. Taking care of her poultry is an activity she finds very enjoyable. Feeding her poultry is her hobby.

Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in Kitale. Joyce has a good knowledge of the market and has been taking advantage of that ready market. However, the demand is very high. Being a visionary woman, she has always wanted to increase her poultry. She is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry.

Accessing financial services for women is very difficult, but through institutions such as Kiva, enterprising women like Joyce will achieve their dreams and goals. Joyce believes that the key to increased egg production is proper feeding of poultry and taking good care of them. By ensuring that the poultry are fed well, she is guaranteed to reap the benefits. In addition to selling eggs and poultry meat, she will also sell poultry feathers, which are commonly used to make earrings. The increased income will be used to improve her living conditions and to repay the loan.

You can help Joyce with a loan that will allow her to accomplish all her dreams

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 29 years old and has two children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Marites is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Marites has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 31 years old and married with six children.

Norma earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Norma has been in pig fattening for two years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Piliphine

texts.en:
When you are young, naive, and starting a new family with a fragment of land, you face so many problems. However, Piliphine, a small-holding farmer from Siongiroi, has overcome this challenge and has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. Her primary source of income has been selling eggs, milk, and some personal business she engages in to supplement her meager income. She has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans that farming is for the older generation; she passionately loves dairy goat farming, and taking care of her goats gives her great joy. She is an early-riser and wakes up every day in the morning to go and milk her goat. 

Although this humble mom has been making profits by selling goat milk to her neighbors and the local market, she is faced with the challenge of meeting the demand. She is known for having the best quality goat milk. Through word of mouth, customers have been flocking to her farm for milk. Piliphine is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy goat that will produce milk that is high in nutrients and will be able to satisfy the demand. Through the loan she will buy a dairy goat that will produce more milk. This will help fully satisfy the demand. 

Through Juhudi Kilimo, which is a field partner, she attended training sessions and was taught the best financial management skills. This will help her save more money to fully repay the loan and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a quality breed of dairy goat.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 56 years old, married and blessed with four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to benefit from the training, especially enterprise development.

Her economic activity is farming of maize, beans, and vegetables. She also does poultry farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy poultry feed hence increase egg production. This will enable her to meet rising customer demand and so earn more income to provide better food and clothing to her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed hence increase egg production and earn more income to provide better food and clothing to her children.

loans.name: Bibijamila

texts.ru: Бибичамила прекрасная женщина из Гиссара. Ей 50 лет. Бибичамила добрая, общительная, обаятельная и приятная.  У нее двое детей. Ее дети подросли и теперь у нее есть время заняться другими делами. Она приняла решение заняться бизнесом. Бибичамила поставила себе цель стать успешной бизнес леди - и она будет ей! Бибичамила знала, что будет работать в торговой сфере. Долго ходила по рынку и нашла торговую точку, такую которую она хотела бы создать (на фотографии торговая точка, по ее мнению самая идеальная для нее). Бибичамила надеется с KIVA и МДО "ХУМО" приобретет первый товар (мужскую одежду), начнет торговую деятельность и создать успешный и процветающий бизнес. Поддержите Бибичамила в ее начинаниях.
texts.en:
Bibijamila is a wonderful woman from Gissar. She is 50 years old. Bibijamila is kind, sociable, charming and pleasant. She has two children. Her children are grown up and now she has time to do other things. She has taken the decision to open a business. Bibijamila has set herself the goal of becoming a successful businesswoman - and she will be one!

Bibijamila knew that she would work in the sphere of trade. She walked around the market for a long time and found a sales point like the one that she would like to create (in the photograph is the sales point that is in her opinion the most ideal for her). Bibijamila hopes that with the help of Kiva and MLO Humo she will acquire her first goods (men's clothing), start trading, and create a successful and thriving business. Please support Bibijamila in her endeavors.

loans.use: to start a new business and buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of sodas to sell to clients.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Veronica is aged 28 years, married to Ben and she supports 2 children.  She has been  a shopkeeper to clients for the last 10 years and the business earns her KES 4,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase more stocks of cooking oil, salt and baking flour for sale to clients and meet both client and family needs.   She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to enable her supply milk daily to clients and educate her child. 

Her hope is to expand her business sector.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of cooking oil, salt and baking flour for sale to clients and meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar is 40 years old and has three children. Maricar is married and her three children are in school.

Maricar is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Maricar has been raising livestock for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maricar would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is a widowed woman with nine children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Olivia is 37 years old and has six children who are presently in school.

Olivia has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines. Olivia requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables and fruit to sell like squash, coconuts, okra, etc.

Olivia has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables and fruit to sell like squash, coconuts, okra, etc.

loans.name: Sarem's Group

texts.en:
Sarem is 34 years old and a married mother of a school child, living in a rural area of Kampong Cham province. The sources of her family’s income are from cassava growing and harvesting mangoes on her co-villager’s farm to get a fee. She has been involved in these businesses for five years. Due to drought, insects destroyed her crops, it cause to reduce her profits to lower than her expected. 

Now she is lacking funds to do farming for this season, so she decides to lead a group of two to take a new Kiva loan via VisionFund. As a group leader, she is willing to use her loan portion to buy seeds and fertilizer for doing farming and boost her crop yields. 

This is the third Kiva loan for her while the other one in her group is the fourth loan cycle. The previous loans provided her the positive impact on her farming living and for this loan she hopes to earn more income to keep sending her child to school and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for doing farming and to boost her crop yields.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is 48 years old and married with five children.

Rosanna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Rosanna has borrowed and paid back one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Rosanna aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick(30) is a father of 2; a boy and a girl, aged 5 and 3 respectively. He has been working as a cook for 5years and is currently also doing part-time catering work to sustain his young family.

Having been in the industry for a while, he has noticed the deterioration of health within his location."People keep getting sick because the only thing they can afford is chips and they don't have money to go to hospital" he explains. 

It is this concern that has spurred Patrick and his wife to start a food stall.  He is requesting for a loan to buy the necessary equipment and food stock needed to start the business. With a Kiva loan, he will buy a deep freezer, fryer, food warmer amongst other things.

Patrick is determined to improve his community by giving them a chance at a healthier lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy a deep freezer, fryer, takeaway trays, ood warmer and groceries such as spices, mealie meal etc

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine is 25 years old and she lives in Lchashen village of Gegharkunik region, with her husband, two children and parents-in-law. She works at the bread factory as a baker and also runs farming in which her husband, being unemployed, greatly helps her.  On the farm Armine has cows, calves and a lot of chickens. Armine makes very tasty macun (national dairy-product) and cheese from her farm milk; she also sells meat and eggs. 

Armine on her plot of land with her husband planted nice apple and apricot trees and also they cultivate potato and greens all for sale.

Armine is hopeful that her first Kiva deal will be start for her further profitable partnerships. She needs this Kiva loan as her cattle have a lack of food and she wants to buy animal fodder and more chickens for her farm.

loans.use: to buy animal fodder and more chickens for her farm

loans.name: Nuhfarzjon

texts.ru: Нухфарзчон веселый и добрый молодой человек. Он родом из района Рашт, но живет и работает в городе Душанбе. В Душанбе он продолжил учебу и нашел работу. Она работает кредитным офицером. Ему дается совместить учебу с работой. Нухфарзчон учится на платной основе. Он не имеет достаточных средств, чтобы оплатить следующий год обучения и обратился за финансовой поддержкой. Поддержите Нухфарзчона.
texts.en: Nuhfarzjon is a cheerful and kind young man. He is a native of the Rasht region, but he lives and works in the city of Dushanbe. In Dushanbe he has continued his studies and found work. He works as a loan officer. He is able to combine his studies with work. Nuhfarzjon is studying on a fee-paying basis. He does not have enough funds to pay for the next year of tuition and he has applied for financial support. Please support Nuhfarzjon.

loans.use: to pay for a year of university tuition.

loans.name: Mariama Sow

texts.fr:
Membre depuis le 11 Juillet 2008,  cette brave femme a une expérience dans le programme des Bancs Villageois et a comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Mariama est mariée, âgée de 41 ans et mère de 06 enfants dont 01 fille et 05garçons. Elle est vendeuse de produits alimentaires.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 02 sac de sucre à 25000f le sac, 02 bouteille de 20 litre d’huile raffiné 16000f l’une  02 sceaux de 25 kg de patte d’arachide à 10500le sceau et d’autres condiments pour le revendre en détails.

 Les bénéfices lui serviront  de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants et d’aider son mari dans la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
A member since July 11, 2008, this hard-working woman has experience with the program of "Bancs Villageois" (village borrowing groups) and her main activity is small-scale commerce.

Madame Mariama is married, aged 41, and the mother of six children, one daughter and five sons. She sells foodstuffs.

With this loan she intends to buy two sacks of sugar at 25,000 f per sack, two bottles of 20 liters of refined oil at 16,000 f each, two buckets of 25 kg of peanut butter at 10,500 f per bucket, and other condiments to resell retail. The profit will help her to cover the needs of her children and help her husband with daily expenditures.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of sugar at 25,000 f per sack, two bottles of 20 liters of refined oil at 16,000 f each, two buckets of 25 kg of peanut butter at 10,500 f per bucket

loans.name: Munyiva

texts.en:
Munyiva is a 35 years old lady. She is married and has three children.  She operates a green grocery,  selling mostly fruits and tomatoes. She has been in the business for 10 years. 

This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya. She intends to use the loan to purchase additional stock of fruits and vegetables especially tomatoes 

She will use the profit from her business to educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future is to buy a plot and build rental houses and educate her children to complete their education.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of fruits and vegetables especially tomatoes

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana is thankful that she was granted an 15000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. She is glad that their daily needs and the school needs of her children were met. No matter how hard it is live in a poor country she maintains a positive out look that life will get  better for them.  

She continues to persevere to provide for her children. She is again humbly asking for a 19000 loan to buy more grocery items like instant noodles, canned good, bread, beverages and frozen foods to sell. Her store means a lot to her for this is where she source their day to day needs and her children's education. To augment their income Feliciana took a part-time job so she looks for a substitute to tend to her store whenever she is not around.

Feliciana's  dreams to be successful in all her undertakings so she could send her two children to college. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies . 

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for groceries, beverages and toiletries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 31 years old, married and has three children. 

She is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Arlyn requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise.

Arlyn has been raising livestock for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Arlyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college. In the photo Arlyn together with her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 41 years old and married.

Arlene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.  Arlene has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from selling purified drinking water.

Arlene aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 59 years old, married and has five children. 

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Carmen requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.  Carmen has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline lives in Bingwa village, situated in the Siongiroi area of Kenya. Land in Siongiroi is extremely fertile for agriculture, so most families in Siongiroi practice agriculture. Jackline and her husband own a small piece of land in this region. They live together with their children. They have been doing dairy farming for the last six years to earn a living. Her primary income source is milk. 

Jackline is seeking a loan to purchase an additional dairy cow. As her children grow older, the upkeep and educational expenses keep rising. In order to meet these needs, Jackline needs to boost her milk production to earn more income. 

With your loan, she will be able to afford a high-yielding dairy cow. She will use the additional income from milk sales to pay the loan installments and, later on, school fees.
Help out this enterprising Kenyan woman with a loan today!

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is an ambitious and young rural smallholder farmer from Chepchonia village, in Kitale area of Kenya. He is married and has three children. 

He makes a living doing sheep, goat, and maize/corn farming. He has been doing this business for six years. With the help of his family, he also opened a small hotel, which enabled them to sell their farm produce in its final form, food, thus increasing their profit margins. 

Kennedy is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer to produce more food. The impact of this investment on his family will be improved livelihood and better income.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Ruibirizi Tweyombekye Group

texts.en:
Rubirizi Tweyombekye,was formed by the members as the name suggests to rebuild their community more so by working hard together to develop the area. The membership comprises of mainly farmers and traders along the agriculture value chain, especially those selling agricultural products like cereals, corn and beans.

Wilber is a 30 year old male Ugandan who is married and has three children but only one is in school currently. In order to meet the needs of his family, he operates a retail shop and also practices farming in addition to selling agricultural out put. He has been doing these activities since 2009.

Wilber has applied for a loan of UGX1,800,000  to complete his house, He will buy shutters and cement using the loan. This will help him to upgrade his status in society. He says the challenges that he faces include bad weather and fluctuation of prices for agricultural produce.

His dream is to acquire a tractor and venture in to commercial farming.

loans.use: To buy shutters and cement to complete his residential house.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Doña Catalina de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo desde hace 30 años, inicio con capital propio cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarla en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y asi poder obtener una mejor cosecha para mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Catalina, 50, lives in her own house with her family group.  She has been making a living growing corn and sorghum for 30 years.  She began with her own capital.  When the harvest is ready, she stores it in the granaries that you see in the photograph in order to sell it later in the surrounding areas of the zone where she lives.  
She is requesting a loan in order to buy fertilizers, manure, blight control, etc. and in this way to be able to obtain a better harvest for better economic income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, blight control, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply in the area for more income gain

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is 54 years old who is a widower. He has 4  children whom he currently supports.

Gabriel is a welder, a business he has been doing for the last for 4 years and it has been profitable. 

This is his second loan with VisionFund Kenya and he intends to use it to buy new welding materials.  He will use the profit from the business to pay school fees for his children. 

His hopes and dreams for the future is to have a big business

loans.use: to buy new welding materials, to help support his children, as he lost his wife

loans.name: Arayik

texts.en:
Arayik in the village Varser of Gegharkunik region lives with his wife, son and his retired parents. Arayik used to work in different workshops and private companies but now he is a farmer and also manages some agricultural activities. 

On his farm he has cows, calves, lambs, sheep, chickens, turkeys and rabbits. Arayik takes care of the farm with his lovely wife. So together they sell their farm milk, cheese, meat (mutton, beef and poultry) and eggs. On his plot of land he cultivates potato, beans, tomato and cucumbers and these goods he sells at the local wholesale market. 

Arayik asks this Kiva loan as he wants to buy diesel fuel, fertilizer for his agricultural works and also animal fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy diesel fuel, fertilizer for his agricultural works and also animal fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Jeorgie

texts.en:
Jeorgie is 53 years old and married. 

Jeorgie is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Jeorgie requested a PHP 35000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.  Jeorgie has been raising livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Jeorgie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Urozoy

texts.ru: Урозой добрая и гостеприимная женщина из района Вахш. Ей 47 лет. Она вдова. Урозой сама поднимает на ноги пятерых сыновей. Она занимается животноводством и этим кормит своих детей. Дети растут и растут их расходы. Урозой хочет расширить животноводческий бизнес и поэтому обратилась за финансовой поддержкой. За счет заемных средств она планирует купить пару голов телят и бычков, тем самым увеличить поголовья скотов. Она верит, что найдутся люди которые ей помогут и заранее благодарит за помощью.
texts.en:
Urozoy is a kind and hospitable woman from the Vakhsh region. She is 47 years old, and a widow. Urozoy is raising her five sons herself. She practices animal husbandry, and that is how she feeds her children. The children are growing, and their expenses are growing as well.

Urozoy wants to expand her animal husbandry business, so she has applied for financial support. With the borrowed funds, she plans to buy a couple head of calves and steers, and increase her livestock headcount with them. She believes that there are people who will help her, and gives thanks in advance for the help.

loans.use: to buy a few head of livestock and expand her animal husbandry activities.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong is a 56-year-old married rice farmer who lives in a community in the Kampong Speu province of Cambodia. She has cultivated rice for more than 14 years. Kong has five children but only four which are in her care. Among the four children, three are working in a factory. Her husband is 51 years old and he is also a rice farmer. Together, the family can earn around $17 per day. 

Kong would like to expand her rice farm, so she is requesting a loan, which is her second loan with Kiva through Kredit MFI, to buy more farmland for rice cultivation. With this loan, she will be able to have enough finances to buy more farmland and earn more rice crops to support her family. 

In the future, she is going to buy more soil to fill the yard around her house and build a new kitchen.

loans.use: to buy more farmland for rice cultivation

loans.name: Rhina

texts.es: Rhina de 25 años de edad es una joven que siempre demuestra su deseo de superación, actualmente habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 16, 15 y 12 años de edad. Rhina desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta de comida, tortillas y además  posee una pequeña tienda de productos básicos para el hogar, actividades con las cuales ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes mostrando su responsabilidad y excelentes servicios. Rhina desea aumentar sus ingresos y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz, carnes, verduras y otros productos básicos para su tienda y de esta manera aumentar las ventas y ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rhina has always demonstrated her will to overcome since the age of 25.  She currently lives in her own house along with her husband and their three children, who are 16, 15 and 12 years old.  For several years, Rhina has worked selling tortillas and other food.  Moreover, she has a small store selling basic home products.  With these jobs, she has been learned to gain the confidence of her customers, showing her responsibility and excellent services.

Rhina wishes to increase her earnings, and to that end, she is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in corn, meat, vegetables, and other basic products for her store.  In this way, she seeks to increase her sales and offer a better variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to invest in corn, meat, vegetables, and other basic products for her store.

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es: María de 51 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y gracias a su esfuerzo han hecho que poco a poco su calidad de vida mejore un poco más. María es una mujer luchadora que sus visiones siempre han sido luchar  por el bienestar de su hogar, es una mujer responsable, honesta, sincera, trabajadora y muy amable y eso a ella le llena de orgullo ser un ejemplo de vida. María posee una pequeña tienda donde vende artículos básicos y de primera necesidad como leche, huevos, papel higiénico y otros, además posee venta de artículos escolares como: cuadernos, lapiceros, borradores, sacapuntas, etc. La tienda está ubicada en su casa y gracias a la manera de atender a las personas ella posee mucha  clientela quienes son los que la buscan para comprarles productos a diario. Lastimosamente ella no tiene el capital necesario para hacer que su tienda crezca cada vez más y es por eso que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para la compra de más materia prima como: sopas, café, maíz, frijol, huevos, leche, pan dulce, chocolate, cuadernos, lapiceros, y otros.
texts.en:
Maria, 51, lives in her own home with her husband.  Thanks to their efforts, they gradually improved their quality of life.  Maria is a very tenacious woman whose vision has always been to fight for the well-being of her household.  She is responsible, honest, sincere, hardworking, and very friendly, and it fills her with pride that she has set an example with her life.  

Maria has a small store where she sells consumer staples such as milk, eggs, toilet paper, and other items.  She also sells school supplies such as notebooks, ball point pens, erasers, pencil sharpeners, etc.  Her store is located in her house, and thanks to the way she treats people she has a lot of customers who come to her daily to buy products.  Sadly, she lacks the capital she needs to make her store grow.  This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy more products such as: soups, coffee, corn, beans, eggs, milk, sweetbread, chocolates, notebooks, pens, and other products.

loans.use: to buy products for her store

loans.name: Virginia Concepcion

texts.es: Virginia es una mujer de 29 años de edad,  vive junto a su esposo en casa propia y es una mujer que siempre busca la manera de salir adelante, es por eso que hace dieciocho años decidió dedicarse a la venta de productos por catálogo, de vinos y ropa, obteniendo hasta la fecha una gran cantidad de clientes. Virginia desea realizar una inversión en su negocio ya que con el capital propio no logra cumplir la demanda de productos con la que solicitan sus clientes, es por ello que desea adquirir un crédito con FUSAI que le permita invertir en: compra de productos varios de catálogo como: perfumes, tintes para cabello, cremas para la piel, vinos y ropa para dama, caballeros y niños, etc., para poder cumplir con la demanda de productos que sus clientes solicitan y de esta forma obtener mejores ingresos y tener una mayor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Virginia, 29, lives together with her husband in their own house and she is a woman who always looks for a way to get ahead.  For this reason, 18 years ago she decided to make a living selling products from wine and clothing catalogs, obtaining until now a great quantity of customers.  
Virginia wants to make an investment in her business since with her own capital she can't fulfill the demand for products that her customers request.  For this reason, she wishes to get a loan from FUSAI which will allow her to invest in the purchase of various catalog products such as perfumes; hair color; skin cream; wines; clothing for ladies, men and children; etc. in order to fulfill the demand for products which her customers ask for, and in this way obtain better income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in perfumes; hair color; skin creams; wines; clothing for ladies, men, and children; etc.

loans.name: Wendy Esmeralda

texts.es: Wendy de 19 años de edad, vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su hijo de 3 años de edad y sus padres con quienes trabaja mucho para poder dar lo mejor al  hogar y contar con todo lo necesario para vivir mejor. Wendy se dedica a la venta de ropa femenina como: blusas, pantalones, camisetas, ropa interior y otros más. Ella es una persona que se esfuerza por vender más cada día ya que sabe la importancia que su aportación tiene para el bienestar de su casa y su familia. Wendy comercializa la ropa de forma ambulante, contando con varios clientes fijos y así mismo la vende en su casa de habitación con los vecinos cercanos. Wendy solicita un préstamo a FUSAI con el cual pueda invertir en su negocio aumentando la cantidad de ropa así como también adquirir más variedad de colores, tallas, estilos y estampados, con lo que podrá complacer una mayor cantidad de gustos de las personas y de este modo aumentar sus ventas y ganancias.
texts.en:
Wendy is 19 years old and lives in a home of her own with her 3 year old son and her parents, who she works with a lot to be able to provide the best for the household and have everything needed to live a better life. Wendy works in the sale of women's clothing such as: blouses, pants, t-shirts, undergarments, and more.

She's somebody who tries hard to sell more every day and understands how important her contribution is to the welfare of her household and family. Wendy's selling is done as a mobile vendor, and she has several steady customers and also sells out of her home to area residents. Wendy is applying for a loan from FUSAI that would enable her to invest in her business by increasing the amount of clothes as well as acquiring a greater variety of colors, sizes, styles, and patterns.

With this she would be able to satisfy a broader range of tastes and that way boost her sales and profits.

loans.use: To purchase: blouses, pants, t-shirts, undergarments and other types of apparel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for: cement, sand, gravel, a toilet and the work to build a septic tank for a sanitary toilet in her home.

loans.name: Ergashali

texts.en:
Ergashali is a brave man. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1988. He lives in a village with his family. He is married and has two children. He is a talented, generous and responsible person. He is one of the trustee clients at IMON and makes repayments on time. 

Ergashali works at a cement factory. His wife is a housekeeper. His father also works at the factory. 

His mother is in the hospital; she is sick and needs an operation. Unfortunately, they do not have enough money to pay for the treatment and surgery. 

As a kind and careful son, Ergashali is willing to treat his mother and look after her. He is asking for a loan from IMON and Kiva to pay for his mother's surgery at the hospital. 

His mother hopes to be supported and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his mother's surgery.

loans.name: Simion

texts.en:
Simion is 56 years old, married, and supports a family of 8 children. 

He has sold construction supplies for 4 years and earns 8,000 KES per month. 

Simion has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to expand his business. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Haykanush

texts.en:
This charming and beautiful woman lives in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. Her name is Haykanush and she lives with her brother. Haykanush is a teacher with higher education and all her life she worked of her profession. Now she works at the local school as a teacher of mathematics. 

As she mentions she likes her profession and she is greatly devoted to her work. She is patient with her pupils and ready to help each of them to overcome any hardship in learning process. 

This loan of 650.000 Armenian drams Haykanush asks as she wants to buy a computer and also professional literature for self-development at her house, free from work time.

loans.use: to buy a computer and also professional literature for self-development at her house, free from work time

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is aged 54 years, married to Benedict and she supports 10 children.  She has been selling clothes for the last 2 years and the business earns her KES 4,500 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase more stock for clothes for sale to clients and meet both client and family needs.   She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and educate her children. 

Her hope is to expand her agricultural sector and be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks for clothes for sale to clients and meet both client and family needs.
